Description:
Enjoy a unique adventure as you row along the Croatian coast with this Verudela Kayak Night Tour from Pula. You'll have a totally transparent kayak and equipped with lights.
 Enjoy the night tour around Verudela 
 Views of Pula 
 Admire the illuminated views 
 The transparent kayak with lights 
 Pula beach 
 Look out for marine life with the kayak's lights 
 Verudela bay 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Verudela Kayak Night Tour
At 9 pm we'll meet at Istria beach in Verudela for a very special night tour. But before paddling through the waters of Pula, you'll receive a brief explanation about how to navigate in a kayak. Then, everything is ready for the adventure!
We'll go into the dark waters and see the underwater life, with the help of a transparent kayak equipped with LED lights. As we approach the coast, at a depth of between four and eight meters, we'll enjoy the Adriatic Sea. No need to snorkel!
During the tour we'll see different species including sea urchins, jellyfish and corals. The guide who will accompany us at all times will tell  you anything you want to know.
The tour will end arriving at the starting point at 10:30 pm.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Delve into the Venetian past of the Istrian Peninsula on this guided walking tour of Rovinj: discover the charms of this picturesque Croatian coastal town!
 Second World War Monument in Rovinj 
 Rovinj 
 Exploring the historic streets of Rovinj 
 Marshal Tito Square in Rovinj 
 Statue in Marshal Tito Square 
 Basilica of St Euphemia 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Rovinj Walking Tour
After meeting at 6:30 pm in front of the Second World War Monument on Pietra Ive Street, we'll set off on our guided walking tour of Rovinj and its most important places of interest.
Heading into the old town, we'll first explore the farmers' market. Afterwards, we'll stroll through some of the town's main streets, delving into its Venetian past and learning how Rovinj went from being an island to a peninsula. We'll make a stop in Marshal Tito Square, a favourite meeting place for locals.
We'll continue our tour climbing up to the Basilica of St Euphemia. During the walk, we'll be immersed in the medieval streets of Rovinj, a charming area full of historic buildings and handicraft shops. Having passed by the old Jewish Quarter of the town, we'll finally reach the hilltop church. We'll admire the imposing white façade of the Basilica and its bell tower, noting its similarities to the famous Campanile de San Marcos in Venice.
Our guided walking tour of Rovinj will end here at approximately 8 pm.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
If you like adventure, then this kayaking trip on the Cetina River is not to be missed. Paddle and have fun as you discover the exceptional beauty of Croatia's interior.
 Paddling on the Cetina River 
 Enjoying the kayaks 
 A photo of the group 
 Tour in kayak 
 Touring the Cetina River in kayaks 
 A family enjoying the kayaks 
 The banks of the river Cetina 
 Kayaking in the Sinj valley 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Cetina River Kayak Trip
We will meet up at 10 am next to the Alkar Hotel in Sinj before heading to Panj, just a 15-minute drive away. There, the kayaks will be waiting for us to start the tour of the Cetina River.
Before we start rowing, we will receive a brief presentation on how to do the activity safely. Don't worry because no previous experience is necessary - everyone can participate!
Our adventure will take us almost 10 miles down Croatia's longest river. Halfway through, we will stop for a tasty picnic lunch that includes a sandwich, juice, and fruit. Then we continue paddling to our final destination. Along the way, you will enjoy unique views of the idyllic landscapes that surround us.
When we reach the endpoint, we will get out of the kayaks and return to Sinj where our brilliant adventure finishes at 1 pm. 
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protection and safety, to help avoid the spread of Covid-19. Specifically, the provider of this tour will apply the following measures:
Tours or activities will not consist of more than 25 people per group.
A safe distance of one metre between clients will be maintained whenever possible.
The use of masks is obligatory. The client must bring their own mask.
Alcohol gel will be available before, during, and after the service.
All those running the service (guide, driver etc...) will wear a mask throughout its duration.
All those running the service (guide, driver etc...) will wear gloves throughout its duration.
Handing out of printed material such as maps or brochures will be avoided.
The transport used will be disinfected before and after each service and deep-cleaned every 24 hours.
Showing your voucher on your phone will be enough, and it is not necessary to print anything.
Alcoholic drinks are not available.

Description:
This buggy tour will take you across beautiful landscapes of the Croatian hinterland to discover streams, lakes and rivers - enjoy the adventure!
 Getting ready for the buggy tour 
 Buggies in the valley 
 Exploring the landscapes 
 Driving a buggy 
 Touring the valley in buggies 
 Buggies at full speed 
 Buggy tour 
 Buggy tour of the Sinj valley 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Sinj Buggy Tour
We'll meet at 10 am at the Alkar Hotel in Sinj where we'll receive a short safety introduction and get kitted out in our helmets.
Now it's time to get behind the wheel! We'll zoom off to the Sinjsko polje valley and slowly leave the concrete tracks behind as we head onto more natural terrain. We'll discover secret paths and explore the most unusual parts of the Dalmatian landscapes.
We'll pass by trickling streams until we will reach the Lake Peruča dam, the second-largest artificial lake in Croatia? From its shores, we'll also admire the Cetina River. We'll make a stop here to enjoy a picnic lunch that includes sandwiches, juice and fruit.
Afterwards, we'll make our way back to Sinj. The buggy tour ends at 1 pm at the starting point.
Important Information
To drive the buggies you must be at least 18 years old and hold a valid driving license.

Description:
Horses, lush green landscapes, views of the Cetina River... All this and much more awaits you on this bike tour through the Sinj valley. 
 Enjoying Sinj valley 
 Bike rental 
 Cetina River 
 Exploring Sinj on a bike 
 Cycling in Sinj 
 Sinj valley

 Cycling in the Sinj Valley 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Sinj Bike Tour
Ready for a day full of nature and adventure? We'll meet at the Alkar Hotel in Sinj at 10 am and hop on our bikes.
The Sinj valley awaits us! We'll cycle for 40 kilometres through small villages such as Brnaze and Trilj as we admire horses and the banks of the Cetina River. 
Halfway there, we'll stop in a picnic area to enjoy a well-deserved lunch that includes a sandwich, juice and fruit. Once we've recovered our strength, we'll set off through the villages of Obrovac Sinjski and Panj. They'll take your breath away!
We'll finish the tour at 2 pm back at the starting point in Sinj.

Description:
Cruise along the beautiful waters of the Adriatic Sea to the Blue Cave, one of the most magical corners of Croatia's Dalmatia region. This is a boat trip you will never forget.
 The entrance to the Blue Cave 
 Inside the Blue Cave 
 Hvar 
 
 
 
Blue Grotto Boat Trip
Croatia is a treasure trove of beautiful places, not least the wonderful Blue Cave. Get ready for our amazing boat trip to this magical cave in the Adriatic Sea. We will climb on board the vessel in Trogir and sail to the beautiful island of Biševo, where the famous cavern is located.
Once we arrive on the island, we will change to a smaller boat which will take us among the rock tunnels of the grotto. You will witness how, as the day breaks, the sun's rays are cast onto the crystal clear water, turning it a magical turquoise quarter.
Back in reality, we head to Komiža, a picturesque fishing village on the island of Vis. There you will have the opportunity to relax at the idyllic Stiniva beach, swimming or snorkeling in the emerald waters. You will also encounter the Green Cave, another stunning natural landmark.
Our trip continues, with a stop at beautiful Budikovac Island or, if you prefer, at the heavenly Smokova beach where you can take a dip in its deep blue waters. If by now, you are feeling hungry, then now is the chance to eat. We will head to the island of Hvar, one of the largest in the Adriatic. Here, you will have your own free time to try some local food and explore the narrow streets of the city, where a magnificent medieval fortress and cathedral are waiting to be discovered.
Then we will take the boat back to Trogir, arriving at around 6:45 pm.
Important information
Children under 4 years old cannot participate in this boat trip to the Blue Cave.
The Blue Cave may be closed in the event of adverse weather conditions. If this is the case, we will offer an alternative or a full refund.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
With the Split sightseeing bus tour, you will explore the city in the most comfortable and convenient way, and at your own pace. You will also enjoy a panoramic bus tour and guided walking tours of Split and Trogir.
 The promenade in Split 
 The fortress of Klis 
 Trogir, close to Split 
 
 
 
Split Hop On Hop Off Bus Route & Stops
The Split sightseeing bus follows a complete route of 9 stops. Throughout the trajectory, you will have English language recorded commentary about the places and monuments which you see. Some of the main attractions that you will see in Split are the church and monastery of San Francisco, Diocletian's Palace, the Cathedral of Saint Domnius, and the promenade of Split.
You can consult the route and all the stops on the map by clicking on this link:
Route and stops of the Split sightseeing bus
The sightseeing bus route is marked in red.
How it works
You can reserve tickets for the Split tourist bus, which is valid for 24 or 48 hours. During this time, you can hop on or off the red bus as many times as you want. When you make the reservation, we will send you an email with the voucher that you must present at the first bus that you board.
Times and Frequency
From 1 April until 30 June: Daily departures at  9:45 am, 11 am, 12:15 pm, 1:30 pm, and 2:45 pm.
From 1 July until 31 August: Daily departures at 9:45 am, 11 am, 12:15 pm, 2:45 pm, 4 pm and 5 pm.
From 1 September until 31 October: Daily departures at 9:45 am, 11 am, 12:15 pm, 1:30 pm, and 2:45 pm.
Panoramic tour of Split
By reserving the Split sightseeing bus, you will also receive a ticket to do a panoramic tour around Split, which has two different routes:
Blue line
This tour will take you around the city and its surroundings on a 5-hour tour in which you will be accompanied by an English-speaking guide. We will stop at Split, the fort of Klis, Salona, and Trogir, and you'll have free time there to admire these beautiful locations and take photographs of them. This tour departs every day at 9:15 am from Obala Lazareta 3 (stop 1). The itinerary follows the blue route on the tourist bus map.
Green line
The green line panoramic bus tour takes you to Klis, Stella Croatica and the Vranjaca Caves. This route departs daily at 11:45 am from Obala Lazareta 3 (stop 1).
Guided walking tour
Besides the panoramic tour of Split, the reservation for the tourist bus also includes guided walking tours of Split and Trogir. These English-speaking guided trips will allow you to explore these beautiful cities which were founded as Greek colonies and have the best conserved Romanesque-Gothic quarters in Central Europe.
The personnel on board the sightseeing bus will direct you to the meeting points of each tour and inform you of the timetables.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Enjoy a day of sun and sea in true Croatian style on this boat trip to Bol, the oldest town on Brac Island. Explore picturesque streets and relax on one of the Dalmatian Coast's most beautiful beaches: Zlatni Rat, or the Golden Horn. 
 Zlatni Rat Beach, or the Golden Horn 
 Picturesque Bol port 
 Typical streets of Bol 
 Views of the town of Bol, on Brac Island 
 Bol boat cruise 
 Zlatni Rat Beach 
 Bol port 
 Enjoying views of the landscape from the boat 
 Zlatni Rat Beach 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Bol Boat Trip Itinerary
After meeting at Split harbour, you'll board your boat ready to embark on your day trip to the beautiful town of Bol, on the Croatian island of Brac. Sail over the sparkling waters of the Dalmatian Coast for around two hours, enjoying the spectacular views of passing islands and indulging in a delicious breakfast too.
Arriving in Bol, a tiny town on the south of Brac, you'll be welcomed by its expanse of pristine beaches and crystal-clear sea. Head onto dry land to discover the picturesque fishing village at your own pace. Feel like taking a dip? Relax on Martinica Beach or make your way to the popular Zlatni Rat Beach, also called the Golden Horn thanks to the shape of the spit of land.
The more adventurous amongst you might choose to climb Vidova Gora. The highest peak in the Adriatic at over 2550 feet (778 m) tall, its summit offers incomparable views over Bol and its beaches. Well worth the hike up the mountain!
You could also spend your time strolling along the town's cobblestone streets and taking in the historic atmosphere, before you climb back onto the boat for the return cruise to Split. On board, you'll enjoy a delicious lunch while relaxing throughout the journey back.
Menu
Your boat trip to Bol includes breakfast and lunch. Your breakfast will include croissants and tea or coffee. For lunch, you'll be served grilled meat, fish or vegetables with salad - you choose which you prefer when making your reservation. Drinks (wine, beer and soft drinks) and dessert are also included. Delicious!
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Discover the beauty of the Dalmatian coast on this boat cruise from Split. You'll visit the Blue Cave, one of the Croatian islands' most incredible natural phenomena. What are you waiting for?
 The entrance to the Blue Cave 
 Inside the incredible Blue Grotto 
 Stunning views of Hvar Island 
 Cruising around the Dalmatian Coast 
 Enjoying a dip in the Adriatic Sea 
 Inside the breath-taking Blue Cave 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Blue Cave Boat Trip Itinerary
After meeting first thing in the morning, you'll begin your full-day boat trip from Split to one of the most stunning spots on the Dalmatian coast: the Blue Cave, also known as the Blue Grotto.
Climb on board a luxury boat to sail from Split's harbour to the isle of Biševo, a beautiful island in the Adriatic Sea. As you cruise through Croatia's crystalline turquoise waters, you'll enjoy spectacular views across the sea and the different islands along the way to the Blue Cave.
Arriving at this incredible place, you'll be left in awe. Formed by waves eroding the limestone of the island over time, the natural grotto is particularly special for the way the light hits it at certain times of day. Entering inside the cave, enjoy the breath-taking iridescent blue glow of the sunlight reflecting off the water around the rock walls.
After taking in this magnificent sight, you'll head back out into the sun to explore the ancient fishing town of Komiza, on the island of Vis. Here, you'll have the possibility to escape the heat of the day. Relax on the pristine beach at Stiniva Cove; take a refreshing dip in the stunning waters of the Adriatic Sea; and even snorkel around the nearby green cave.
For the finishing touch on this magical day trip, you'll make your way over to the island of Hvar, from which you'll have unforgettable panoramic vistas of the Palmižana Bay and the Pakleni Islands. Don't forget your camera! You'll return to Split around 6 pm.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Swim in the sparkling turquoise sea around Brac Island, enjoy a delicious lunch on board and explore Stomorska, a historic village on the peaceful island of Solta... don't miss this Croatian island-hopping boat trip!
 Breathtakingly blue seas around Brac Island 
 The port of Brac Island 
 Sailing from picturesque Solta Island 
 Looking out from Solta Island 
 Boat at Brac and Solta Islands 
 Swimming in the waters of Brac and Solta 
 Bird's eye view of the island 
 Damaltian coast 
 Hidden cove in Brac 
 Brac Island port 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Croatia Islands Boat Cruise Itinerary
After setting sail from Split's harbour, your boat trip around Croatia's islands on the vintage Polaris yacht will begin. Cruise for around an hour to the nearby island of Brac, the first destination of the day.
Drop anchor in a hidden bay, little known by tourists, where you'll enjoy a peaceful escape from the rest of the world. Sunbathe on the beach and swim in the crystalline turquoise sea - if you're feeling even more adventurous you could try diving or snorkelling amongst Croatia's marine life too!
Having spent a good couple of hours on Brac Island, you'll climb back on board the boat and head to the next stop on your tour: neighbouring Solta Island. During your cruise over, you'll be served a delicious lunch to renew your energy.
Arriving in Stormorksa, the island's most historic town, you'll have free time to explore at your own pace. Wander along quaint streets and discover the beautiful beaches of this picturesque fishing village.
At the end of your visit, you'll return to the boat to relax as you sail back across the Adriatic Sea to Split, where your Croatian islands boat trip will come to an end.
Menu
Your Croatian island-hopping cruise includes breakfast and lunch. Your breakfast will include croissants and tea or coffee. For lunch, you'll be served grilled meat, fish or vegetables with salad - you choose which you prefer when making your reservation. Drinks (wine, beer and soft drinks) and dessert are also included. Delicious!
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Cetina River Kayak Trip
After picking you up at your hotel in Split at 9 a.m, we will set off for the small town of Panj. The journey by road will take us around one hour and 15 minutes.
Once we arrive, you will receive a brief class on the main kayaking techniques. We will paddle around 9 miles down the beautiful Cetina River, discovering the wonderful flora and fauna of Croatia's interior. This is the best way to combine tourism and sport.
During the trip, we will stop to enjoy a tasty picnic that includes a sandwich, juice, and fruit before we continue rowing.
After the navigation, we will return by car or minibus to your hotel in Split, arriving at 2 pm.

Description:
Put the perfect finishing touch on your day: enjoy a sunset cruise around Split. Relax on deck and enjoy live music and unlimited drinks as you watch the last rays of sun illuminate the picturesque Croatian city.
 Split harbour at nightfall 
 Views of picturesque Split from the sea 
 Sunset over Split 
 Boat at sunset 
 Sunset on the Dalmatian Coast 
 Couple enjoying the sunset on the boat 
 Friends having fun on the boat 
 Admiring the sunset 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Split Sunset Boat Cruise
Meet at Split's port on the evening of your cruise, and climb on board your boat ready to discover the beauty of the Croatian Dalmatian Coast at nightfall.
As the afternoon turns to dusk, you'll sail towards Marjan Hill. This unique peninsula is covered in Mediterranean pine forests, leading to its nickname as the lungs of the city. It is a spectacular sight at all times, and even more so with a backdrop of the vibrant colours of the sunset sky.
Relax on board the boat as you cruise over to Kastela Bay, nestled in the foothills of the rocky Kozjack mountain. Here, you'll also spot the iconic Hajduk Football Stadium, an important symbol for the people of Split thanks to its history and architecture.
Cruise around the newer part of the city too, all the while enjoying the peaceful rock of the boat and the atmosphere of live music on deck. You'll be treated to unlimited drinks, including champagne, wine, beer and soft drinks, accompanied by snacks. Dance under starlit skies and toast to a wonderful evening!
Your sunset boat cruise will come to an end returning to Split port.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Discover a tropical paradise in the heart of the Dalmatian Coast. Visit the beautiful Blue Lagoon and the historic town of Trogir on this boat trip from Split. Unmissable!
 Croatia's dreamy Blue Lagoon 
 Trogir Coast 
 Blue Lagoon 
 Trogir 
 Trogir Cathedral 
 Trogir Old Town 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Blue Lagoon Cruise
The tour meets at the chosen time, near to the Split port, from where we'll launch on an unforgettable day of adventure! We'll climb aboard a luxurious boat, making our way to the historic city of Trogir.
In this beautiful town, you'll have an hour of free time to explore the historic centre of the island - a little gem in the Blue Lagoon, at only one square kilometre! Among the unmissable sights are the St. Lovre Cathedral, and the winding medieval streets.
Then we'll visit the Blue Lagoon itself, a paradise island in the middle of the Adriatic sea. During the tour, you'll be able to enjoy incredible views of numerous islands scattered across the expanse of sea. In this beautiful part of the Dalmatian Coast, you'll have an hour to snorkel or take a dip and relax, drinking in the views.
Then we'll head to Labadusa Beach Bar, on Okrug Gornji beach, where you can have a bite to eat and make the most of the area with free time. Then finally we'll sail back to Split, putting an end to the tour.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Enjoy a sunny day in this tropical paradise of fine white sand and crystal clear waters with this return transfer to the stunning Maguana Beach.
 A view of the beach 
 Maguana beach 
 The Caribbean landscapes of Maguana 
 
 
 
What to expect
We will depart from Parque Central (Central Park) in Baracoa at 9 a.m, and head to Maguana Beach where you will enjoy a spectacular piece of the Caribbean.
After traveling for around 40 minutes, you will arrive at this paradise beach. You then have the next 6 hours to enjoy this spectacular cove in the way you want at your own pace. You can swim in the warm, crystalline waters, go snorkeling, or enjoy the delicious local food whilst admiring spectacular views of the ocean. The choice is yours!
After this brilliant day at the beach, we will return to Baracoa at 4:30 pm.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Discover the beautiful nature surrounding the Rio Miel (Honey River) and relax on the tropical beaches where it meets the sea when you take this brilliant trip from Baracoa.
 A bridge on the Rio Miel river 
 A view of the river mouth 
 A panorama of Honey River 
 
 
 
Miel River Mouth Trip
We will pick you up at Baracoa's Parque Central (Central Park) at 9 am and head towards the Mouth of the River Miel.
The journey will take us alongside the Baracoa Beach until we reach the mouth of the idyllic Miel River. There, we will see the mangroves and the natural terraces formed by the river, and enjoy an incredible view of the surrounding landscapes. We will also experience what life is like in the small villages that are located here.
We will also stop at a wonderful freshwater cave in the surroundings, the "Cueva del Agua" (Water Cave). Legend has it that whoever tastes the waters of the River Miel is condemned not to leave Baracoa forever. However, if you feel brave enough then you can take a refreshing dip!
You will then have your own free time in the area so that you can enjoy the local cuisine and recharge your batteries.
After lunch, we will go to Playa Blanca (White Beach), a small beach with stunning crystalline waters where you can relax and put the finishing touch to this wonderful day.
We will return to Central Park in Baracoa at 5 pm.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Discover the military fortress in an idyllic location with this Morro Castle Classic Car Day Trip. You'll have the chance to experience the day in a 1950s style car.
 Classic Cuban car 
 Views from the Morro Castle 
 Ride in the classic cars 
 Experience the traditional cars 
 Morro Castle, Santiago de Cuba 
 Spend the day exploring 
 Views from the fortress 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Morro Castle Classic Car Day Trip
We'll pick you up at 4 pm at your hotel in Santiago de Cuba in a classic car. Afterwards, we'll take a 30 minute excursion to the Morro Castle, declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
Once there, we'll visit the 17th-century Spanish architectural jewel, created to defend against pirate attacks. We'll see cannons, moats and a military structure in perfect condition. We'll also talk about the function of the building in the War of 95.
During the walk through the fortress, we'll admire the beautiful panorama of Santiago de Cuba and the Caribbean waters. You will love it!
Finally, we'll get into the classic car and return to your hotel between 6 and 6:30 pm.
Types of transport
At the time of booking, you can choose to do the activity in a standard air-conditioned car or in a classic car from the 1950s. 
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protection and safety, to help avoid the spread of Covid-19. Specifically, the provider of this tour will apply the following measures:
Tours or activities will not consist of more than 4 people per group.
A safe distance of one metre between clients will be maintained whenever possible.
The use of masks is obligatory. Masks will be given to those clients who do not have their own.
Alcohol gel will be available before, during, and after the service.
All those running the service (guide, driver etc...) will wear a mask throughout its duration.
All those running the service (guide, driver etc...) will wear gloves throughout its duration.
Disinfected radio units will be provided, and headphones will be single-use.
Handing out of printed material such as maps or brochures will be avoided.
The temperature and wellness of all those taking part in the service will be monitored daily, excluding and maintaining in quarantine any who display fever or symptoms.
The temperature of all attendees will be taken, and admission will be denied to those with a temperature of more than 37 degrees Celsius (99 Fahrenheit), and a full refund applied.
The transport used will be disinfected before and after each service and deep-cleaned every 24 hours.
The capacity of all means of transport will be reduced to 50% of their maximum capacity.
At monuments, museums and attractions, the maximum permitted capacity will be a 50% of the total maximum capacity.
Showing your voucher on your phone will be enough, and it is not necessary to print anything.

Description:
This free walking tour of Trinidad will take you round the most important parts of one of the most well-preserved colonial cities in Latin America, for free!
 San Francisco de Asís Church 
 Walking through the centre of Trinidad 
 Typical street market 
 Street in Trinidad 
 Church of San Francisco de Asis 
 Cobbled streets in Trinidad 
 Santa Ana Square 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Trinidad Free Walking Tour
We'll meet at 10 am in front of the Grand Iberostar Trinidad Hotel, located at the heart of this beautiful colonial city. This building is a wonderful example of the town's typical architecture. 
Then we will begin a walking tour of Trinidad's cobbled streets. Our first stop will be at the San Francisco de Paula Church, which was a Franciscan place of worship in Cuba's central region during the colonial era. 
From there, we'll go to the Brunet Theatre ruins and pass by the Casa de Cultura cultural centre. Did you know that this is one of the locals' favourite places to go salsa dancing? Later, we'll walk down to the Plaza Mayor main square, the town's historical centre. We'll admire the magnificent surrounding buildings and look around the Amelia Peláez art gallery. 
Then we'll take you to try the region's most famous drink: la canchara. We'll then continue the free tour, stopping at the San Francisco de Asís Church, built in the 18th and 19th centuries. Its yellow tower is a landmark of the city. 
We'll finish the tour at 1 pm in the Plaza de Santa Ana square, where you'll be able to see the ruins of an ancient prison from colonial Trinidad. 
Groups
This free tour doesn't take bookings for groups of over 6 people. 
Important information
Minors must be accompanied by an adult, maximum 3 minors per adult. 
We won't be paying for any entries, you'll just be given a guided tour from the outside. 
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protection and safety, to help avoid the spread of Covid-19. Specifically, the provider of this tour will apply the following measures:
A safe distance of one metre between clients will be maintained whenever possible.
The use of masks is obligatory. The client must bring their own mask.
Alcohol gel will be available before, during, and after the service.
All those running the service (guide, driver etc...) will wear a mask throughout its duration.
Handing out of printed material such as maps or brochures will be avoided.
The temperature and wellness of all those taking part in the service will be monitored daily, excluding and maintaining in quarantine any who display fever or symptoms.
The transport used will be disinfected before and after each service and deep-cleaned every 24 hours.
Showing your voucher on your phone will be enough, and it is not necessary to print anything.
Alcoholic drinks are not available.

Description:
Take a trip to the glorious Playa Ancon beach in a classic American car. White sand and crystal-clear waters await!
 Classic car in Trinidad 
 Playa Anacon beach 
 
 
Classic Car Ride to Playa Ancon
We'll pick you up from your hotel between 8 and 9 am and start our journey to Playa Ancon beach. You'll travel in style in a classic American car- a tourist attraction in itself! You'll feel like you've stepped back in time in a vintage Hollywood movie.
After a 15-minute journey, we'll reach the beach. Here you'll have free time to sunbathe under the warm Caribbean sun or even go snorkelling in the sparkling turquoise sea. Did you know that the waters here are home to sunken shipwrecks and numerous coral reefs?
You'll have eight hours of free time in Playa Ancon. Your classic car driver will come and collect you at 5 pm and you'll be dropped back at your hotel in Trinidad at between 5:15 and 6 pm.
Maximum Occupancy
These vintage cars have a maximum occupancy of between 5 and 12 passengers, depending on the model. The car that you will ride in will depend on the number of people taking the tour.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Don't miss this spectacular jeep safari through the beautiful Yumuri Valley. Along the way, we will also drift down the Canimar River, swim in a coral reef, and explore the incredible Saturn Cave.
 Yumuri Valley 
 Coral Beach 
 A bridge over the Canimar river 
 The Cave of Saturn 
 
 
 
 
Yumuri Valley Jeep Trip
We will pick you up from your hotel in Varadero and head to the starting point where the jeeps are waiting. You will drive the 4x4s through the beautiful Yumurí Valley, a territory of jungle landscapes and sugar cane fields.
The route begins at Coral Beach, a heavenly natural enclave of crystalline waters where we can snorkel for around 30 minutes in an impressive coral reef whilst admiring the island's rich marine diversity.
Afterward, we will take a speedboat ride on the Caminar River - a perfect place to enjoy the rainforest. There we will also enjoy a very special Indian performance.
We will head back to La Arboleda, where we will offer you a delicious traditional Cuban meal. And if you want, afterward, you can go for a tranquil horseback ride, visit a coffee plantation or take a trip in a rowing boat. The choice is yours!
We will drive through the picturesque city of Matanzas and arrive at the incredible Cave of Saturn, which features two large caverns and a natural pool of emerald waters. We will admire its half-submerged stalactites and stalagmites and snorkel to the bottom of the cave.
The put the finishing touch to this terrific adventure, we will visit the El Campesino agroecological farm. There we will learn all about the land is used and managed sustainably.
At the end of the tour, we will take you back to your hotel in Varadero.
Important information
If none of the people have a valid driving license or do not feel like driving, you will have the option of a driver for a cost of 40 CUC (US$ 40).
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Feel a rush of adrenaline as you take a fantastic speedboat ride from the Cuban countryside to the coast. This is a brilliant adventure for your stay in Varadero.
 Boat trip on Huatiguanico river 
 The crocodile farm 
 Snorkel in the Caribbean ocean 
 
 
 
Guama and Hatiguanico River Trip
After picking you up at your hotel in Varadero, we will start our journey into the wild interior of Cuba, learning about the history and culture of the island along the way. We will pass through farmland and villages that hide ancient mysteries and legends.
We will head south to our first destination: Peninsula Zapata National Park where you will discover the beautiful contrasts that exist between the Cuban countryside and the coast.
We hit the road again, and make a second stop at a fabulous crocodile farm. Then our trip continues, heading to the coast, where we board a speedboat. Get ready for a thrilling rush of adrenaline!
The boat will take us across the Laguna del Tesoro lake and into the hear of a stunning natural wilderness surrounded by water and vegetation. Back on dry land, we will enjoy Guamá and the Hatiguanico River, two places where tropical beauty reigns.
If this journey through Cuban nature has made you hungry, then don't worry because its time to enjoy the delicious local gastronomy. This tasty meal consists of chicken, pork or fish, garnish, a drink, and coffee.
Before taking you back to your accommodation in Varadero, we will have time for one last adventure. We will immerse ourselves in the crystal Caribbean Sea, and also do some snorkeling under the waves. If we are lucky, we may even get a close look at the exotic species that inhabit these emerald waters.
Important information
On occasion, due to the high volume of participants, it may not be possible for all guests to have a snorkel mask.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Explore Havana in style, touring the beautiful streets of the Cuban capital in an elegant vintage American car. Get the best views of the incredible city from a classic automobile.
 Classic car in Havana 
 One of Havana's vintage American cars 
 Havana's Plaza de la Revolución 
 
 
 
Havana Private Classic Car Tour
What does it matter that their ancient motors were built in the 1950s? Or that their bodywork is older than their drivers? The vintage glamour of Cuba's classic cars never goes out of fashion, and they remain the best way to discover the iconic sights of Havana. The brightly coloured elegant 1950s American vehicles have become a symbol of the city and no trip to La Habana would be complete without a tour in one.
At the scheduled time on the day of your tour, your driver will pick you up from your hotel in the Cuban capital in a classic car, ready to begin your ride around the city. You'll be taken to see the most emblematic places of interest in Havana, visiting Plaza de la Revolución, or Revolution Square, and driving around the outskirts of the lush Almendares Park.
Your vintage car route, which will last around two hours, will include one of the most famous areas of the city: the Malecón, the seafront promenade. Explore the streets and avenues around the John Lennon Park, the Vedado and Nuevo Vedado districts, and the Colon Cemetery.
Finally, at the end of your classic car tour, you can choose to be dropped back off at your accommodation, or to delve deeper into the historic centre of Havana: discovering the World Heritage Site on foot at your own pace.
Important information
This private tour includes a pick up service from hotels and "casas particulares" (homestays) in Havana. Please indicate the name and address of your accommodation when making your reservation.
Each vehicle has a maximum capacity of five people (four passengers plus the driver).
As a private panoramic tour, you can ask the driver to stop at the places you like best to see them from outside, tailoring the experience to your interests.
The driver is not a tour guide. However, you can ask if you have any questions about the city.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Viñales Valley is one of the most spectacular natural regions in Cuba. Immerse yourself in its history, traditions and beautiful landscapes on this day trip from Havana. What's more, you'll be driven there in a typical classic car!
 Spectacular views over the Viñales Valley 
 Horse riding in Valle de Viñales 
 Visiting a tobacco plantation in Viñales 
 Learning about Cuban cigars 
 The Prehistory Mural in Viñales 
 The Prehistory Mural in Viñales 
 Exploring Viñales by classic car 
 Enjoying horse riding 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Viñales Valley Private Tour by Classic Car
One of the most emblematic images of Cuba are the iconic classic cars that cruise the streets. These vintage 1950s vehicles seem to have made a deal with the devil, because their distinguished glamour has not faded over the years. What better way to explore the island? On the morning of your tour, one of these elegant cars will pick you up from your hotel in Havana and hit the road for the two-and-a-half hour drive to the stunning Viñales Valley.
Reaching Viñales National Park, you'll be captivated by the natural beauty of its verdant jungle-covered karst landscapes, dotted with "mogotes", or island-like limestone cliffs. Your first stop will be at a traditional tobacco plantation, where you'll learn how the world-renowned Cuban cigar is made. Delve deeper into the valley next: enjoy horse riding through Viñales (not included). The route, which lasts around an hour, ends with a tasting of Cuban coffee or a glass of Guayabita del Pinar rum - you choose which you prefer!
Hop back into your classic car and cruise over to the Mirador de los Jazmines, a viewpoint offering unparalleled panoramic views over the karst valley. Your attention will surely be drawn to the famous Mural of Prehistory, an enormous rock face painted with brightly-coloured scenes of the evolution of natural life in Cuba.
The next stop on your tour will be at a traditional local restaurant where you'll have the choice of a wide range of typical Cuban delicacies: ropa vieja, or braised beef; crab, lamb or shrimp. Each dish, served with salad and a drink, costs 15 CUC. 
After eating, you'll visit one of the most popular attractions in Viñales Valley: the Cueva del Indio (entrance not included). This karstic cave is considered to be one of the geological jewels of Cuba. Do you know which minerals you'll find inside the cavern?
At the end of a full day of exploring, you'll return to Havana, where you'll be dropped back off at your hotel at around 7 pm.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protection and safety, to help avoid the spread of Covid-19. Specifically, the provider of this tour will apply the following measures:
A safe distance of one metre between clients will be maintained whenever possible.

Description:
Discover a natural oasis in the heart of Havana! You'll be driven around the Cuban capital by classic car to explore the tropical forest known as Almendares Park.
 Tropical trees in Havana's enchanted forest 
 Birdwatching in Almendares Park 
 Lush greenery in Havana's botanical garden 
 
 
 
Almendares Park Tour by Classic Car
On the day of your tour, make your way to the iconic Hotel Inglaterra, where a vintage car will be waiting for you. It wouldn't be a trip to Havana without a drive around the city in one of these classic 1950s vehicles! Your English-speaking guide will take you to the Parque Metropolitano, also known as Almendares Park, the lush green space that extends along the Almendares River.
Arriving in Havana's green lung, you'll explore the trails that cross through the park. Strolling through the dense tropical greenery will have you feeling like you've entered the jungle without leaving the city. Enjoy the fresh air and the beautiful natural landscapes of the urban forest - the perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of the Cuban capital.
Your tour will take you to visit the National Botanical Garden, where you'll have the opportunity to see both native and exotic trees, with more than 4000 plant species in total. One of the highlights of the botanical garden is the Japanese Garden, home to a beautiful waterfall, lake and viewpoint.
You'll also visit Loma del Husillo hill, the Bosque de la Habana, the Jardin de la Polar and the Jardin de la Tropical. The latter, known as Tropical Gardens in English, was opened as a pleasure garden by the owner of the La Tropical Brewery and is now a venue for concerts and dance festivals.
At the end of your tour of Havana's parks and forest, your classic car will take you back to the original departure point in the city centre.
Important information
The classic car has a maximum capacity of three people. If there are more than three people on the tour, two cars will be used.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
See a new side of the Cuban capital discovering its vibrant urban art and important Afro-Cuban heritage on this classic car tour of Havana culture.
 Discovering Havana's urban art 
 Exploring the famous Callejón de Hamel in Havana 
 One of the murals in Callejón de Hamel 
 
 
 
Havana Art & Culture Tour by Classic Car 
On the day of your tour, you'll be picked up from the emblematic Hotel Inglaterra at your chosen time. You'll soon feel like a true Havana local as you cruise around the Cuban capital in one of the city's iconic vintage American cars!
The classic car will take you over to the famous Callejón de Hamel, a side street renowned for the presence of Afro-Cuban art, music and religion. Here you'll find a community culture project created in the 1990s by Cuban artist  Salvador González Escalona. Through his work, Salvador, as he is simply known, celebrates the African origins of the Cuban identity. Admire the murals and sculptures created from scrap objects and different paints that have rejuvenated this area into an exciting cultural hub.
After enjoying the vibrant atmosphere and incredible art of the Callejón de Hamel, you'll toast to an unforgettable tour with a typical Cuban drink - cheers! You'll then hop back into the classic car and return to the Hotel Inglaterra.
Visit Fusterlandia
When making your reservation, you'll be given the option to complete your art and culture tour of Havana with a visit to Fusterlandia. This community project, created by Cuban artist José Rodríguez Fuster in the district of Jaimanitas, is an incredible work of public art allowing visitors to immerse themselves in Cuban folklore through Fuster's enchanting rainbow of mosaics and sculpture.
Important information
The classic car has a maximum capacity of three people. If there are more than three people on the tour, two cars will be used.
This tour requires a minimum of two people.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Enjoy a day under the Cuban sun with this Private Classic Car Beach Day Trip. Travel in a traditional American car to the best beaches in the country. Just for you, your partner, family or friends.
 Bay of Pigs 
 Travel in style 
 Varadero beach 
 Enjoy travelling in the classic cars 
 Cuban beaches day trip 
 The impressive coastline 
 Discover Varadero 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Private Classic Car Beach Day Trip
When booking, you can choose between three different beach areas, all including pick up from your accommodation in Havana and the transfer back. Once at the destination, you'll have free time to enjoy at your own pace. If you choose the transfers to Varadero and Bahía de Cochinos, you'll have the driver at all times to move between the different beaches.
Este beaches transfer (4 hours or 8 hours)
Discover the best beaches in close proximity to Havana. You can select the 4 or 8 hour tour. We'll pick you up at your accommodation and just 30 minutes later, we'll arrive at our destination. Kilometres of white sand and turquoise waters, spread over seven beaches, are waiting for you. Santa María del Mar, Guanabo and Boca Ciega are some of them. 
Timetable: Daily departures every hour from 8 am to 2 pm for the 4-hour option. Every hour from 8 am to 12 pm for the 8 hour option. 
Varadero transfer (12 hours)
Do you want to travel further? No problem. After we pick you up, we'll head to the Varadero peninsula, two hours from Havana. On the way, you'll feel the luxury as you travel in the American classic cars. You'll have about 10 hours of free time to enjoy the beaches, local food and shops in this area.
Timetable: Daily departures at 8 am and 9 am. 
Bay of Pigs transfer (12 hours)
Have you heard of the invasion that took place at the Bay of Pigs in the 1960s? On these coasts, you'll discover the best areas for snorkelling in Cuba. After a two-hour drive, we'll arrive at Playa Girón and the Cueva de los Peces. We can also go to Playa Larga, located near the Ciénaga de Zapata National Park, ideal for bird watching fans! 
Timetable: Daily departures at 8 am and 9 am. 
Capacity
Each vehicle has a maximum capacity of 5 people (4 passengers and the driver).
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Discover hidden Havana on this underground bike tour of the Cuban capital's alternative sights. Follow your local English-speaking guide deep into real Cuba!
 Exploring Havana's Chinatown 
 Street art in the Cuban capital 
 Callejon de Hamel, in Havana 
 
 
 
Havana Alternative Bike Tour
Cuba is a country defined by different cultures, and the vibrant mix of religions, traditions and diverse ways of life can be found around every corner of its capital. After meeting your guide at the Parque de los Martires Universitarios, you'll hop onto your bike and delve deep into a new and different side of Havana.
Your cycling route around underground Havana will take you from the emblematic historic centre of the island's capital to what is considered its most hipster neighbourhood. Immigrants and influence from Spain, Africa and China have forged the Cuban culture and people as they are today, and your guide will reveal signs of the diverse religions, music, dance and traditions that coexist in the city throughout your tour.
Learn about Cuban-Chinese culture and history as you pedal through Havana's Chinatown; discover the incredible street art decorating the city down the lively Callejón de Hamel, whose colourful murals will leave you in awe. You'll also visit a tattoo shop where you'll hear all about the body art culture here, as well as uncovering a hidden restaurant and a place selling 5 cent coffee! 
Follow your guide as they explain the challenges of daily life here and the innovative ways that locals have come up with solutions, like Paquete Semanal, a way to bypass the lack of internet in Cuba. Embrace the energetic atmosphere that remains in Havana and hear stories of the Malecon nightlife while finishing up an unforgettable bike tour in a bar where only locals go.
Important information
Children under 14 years old are not permitted to participate in this tour. Minors must be accompanied by an adult.
This activity includes an 11.2 mile (18 km) bike ride. While the terrain is relatively flat, there are no bike lanes in Cuba, so we recommend having a good level of cycling experience.
We recommend wearing light, comfortable clothing and footwear and insect repellent, and bringing water and sun protection.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Havana's Enchanted Forest, also known as the Great Metropolitan Park, is an immense jungle in the heart of the Cuban capital. Discover its magic on this bike tour.
 Pedalling through the Enchanted Forest in Havana 
 Exploring Havana's forest on the bike tour 
 You'll be enchanted by Havana's forest 
 The Great Metropolitan Park of Havana 
 
 
 
 
Havana Enchanted Forest Bike Tour Itinerary
Having met up in front of the Iglesia de 16, the church by Vuelo Lam Park in Havana, on the morning of your tour, your guided bicycle tour of the Enchanted Forest will begin. On your bikes!
Kick off your cycling rhythm by pedalling over to El Vedado to take in the atmosphere of Havana's hipster neighbourhood, before heading to the banks of the Almendares River, where the Great Metropolitan Park is located. Designed by French landscape architect Jean-Claude Nicolas Forestier, whose other masterpieces include the gardens of the Champ-de-Mars underneath the Eiffel Tower, the lush greenery of the riverside urban park will remind you of the great Amazon rainforests - without even leaving the city!
Following the course of the river, you'll reach Parque Almendares, a park located under the bridge of the same name. Here you'll find a popular amphitheatre nestled amongst the verdant trees and plants of Havana's green lung. The Enchanted Forest, as it is fondly nicknamed, is home to any number of hidden surprises that you'll discover throughout your bike tour.
The final stop on your cycling route will be in Havana's Miramar district, where you'll take a well-earned break from pedalling to enjoy some fruit juice and tapas (not included). At around 12:30 pm, your tour will come to an end back at your original departure point.
Important information
Children under 14 years old are not permitted to participate in this tour. Minors must be accompanied by an adult.
This activity includes a 6.2 mile (10 km) bike ride of medium difficulty (there are some hills on route, and there are no bike lanes in Cuba). We recommend having a good level of physical fitness.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Learn about the Cuban Revolution with this tour of Havana and find out about the movement that led Fidel Castro to power. 
 Plaza de la Revolución 
 National Capitol Building 
 Bacardi Building 
 
 
 
Havana Walking Tour
We'll meet at 10 am by the José Martí statue in the Central Park to start this tour of the Cuban Revolution. From there we'll walk down to the Bacardi building, the old headquarters of the famous brand of rum, and we'll tell you what happened to this stunning art deco building after 1959. 
Then we'll walk past a grocery store and find out about the country's food rationing. We'll also find out about the relationship between the Cuban government and the Catholic Church in what is known as Operation Peter Pan, which transported over 14,000 children from Cuba to the United States. 
Then we'll go to the Museum of the Revolution, where we'll see the Granma Yacht that Fidel Castro arrived in from Mexico and used in the Bay of Pigs invasion. When we leave the museum, we'll walk down to the Spanish Embassy and arrive at a primary school, where we'll learn about education on this Caribbean island since the Cuban Revolution. 
The next stop will be the National Capitol Building. After admiring this landmark's impressive architecture, we'll catch a bus to the Plaza de la Revolución square. During the 20 minute journey we'll tell you all about the interesting history of this popular means of transport. 
In Plaza de la Revolución we'll see its iconic building with the image of Che Guevara; one of the most prominent figures of the revolution. We'll finish the tour here at 1pm. 
Museum of the Revolution
This tour doesn't include tickets to the Museum of the Revolution, which cost 10 Cuban pesos per person (around 10 dollars). 
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protection and safety, to help avoid the spread of Covid-19. Specifically, the provider of this tour will apply the following measures:
A safe distance of one metre between clients will be maintained whenever possible.
The use of masks is obligatory. The client must bring their own mask.
Alcohol gel will be available before, during, and after the service.
All those running the service (guide, driver etc...) will wear a mask throughout its duration.
Handing out of printed material such as maps or brochures will be avoided.
The temperature and wellness of all those taking part in the service will be monitored daily, excluding and maintaining in quarantine any who display fever or symptoms.
The transport used will be disinfected before and after each service and deep-cleaned every 24 hours.
Showing your voucher on your phone will be enough, and it is not necessary to print anything.
Alcoholic drinks are not available.

Description:
This free walking tour of Viñales is the best way to see this colonial city in the West of Cuba. You'll take a walk through its colourful streets and visit a tobacco farm, all for free!
 Walking around Viñales 
 Viñales Main Square 
 Streets in Viñales 
 Botanic Gardens in Viñales 
 
 
 
 
Viñales Free Walking Tour
We'll meet at 10 am in front of the Parque José Martí statue, right in the centre of the city. This is the ideal place to start learning about the origins of Viñales, a city that still preserves its agricultural tradition. 
From there we'll walk down the main avenue, admiring the red brick houses that are so characteristic of this region of Cuba, wonderfully mixed among restaurants and little souvenir shops. We'll also come across some horse and carts, the locals' traditional vehicle. You'll love it! 
Then we'll head to the Botanic Gardens, where we'll learn about the plant species that grow in the Viñales valley. Did you know that this Cuban valley was declared a World Heritage Cultural Landscape?
We'll finish this free walking tour of Viñales on a tobacco farm at 12 pm. At this last stop we'll discover the history and secrets of the cultivation process of one of the country's most famous products. 
Groups
For free tours we don't allow bookings for over 6 people.

Description:
Experience the best of Cuba: explore the beautiful natural landscapes of the Viñales Valley in an iconic classic vintage car. Discover the Cueva del Indio and the Mural of Prehistory. What are you waiting for?
 Cueva del Indio, in Viñales National Park 
 Valle del Silencio, Viñales 
 The Mural of Prehistory 
 Tobacco plantation in Viñales 
 
 
 
 
Viñales Valley Classic Car Tour Itinerary
On the day of your tour, you'll be picked up from your agreed meeting point in Viñales, where you'll climb into your classic American car ready to begin an unforgettable adventure through Viñales Valley. 
Throughout your three-and-a-half-hour guided tour, you'll enjoy a route around the spectacular countryside that will take you to visit some of the most emblematic places of interest in this region of Cuba. And what's more, you'll be able to choose four stops along your route at the sights that interest you the most, allowing you to tailor your vintage car tour itinerary.
The valley, a World Heritage Site, has a number of fascinating places from which you can choose. There's the enormous and vibrantly colourful Mural of Prehistory; the Cueva del Indio, a natural cave in the characteristic limestone cliffs of Viñales Valley; and the Palenque de los Cimarrones, a living museum dedicated to showcasing the history of slavery in Cuba and the African heritage that remains in the country.
You might choose to survey the entire area from viewpoints like Cuajaní or the Mirador de los Jazmines; discover the agriculture of the region visiting the famous tobacco plantations that make Cuban cigars or the El Paraíso eco-farm; or admire the local flora at the Viñales Botanic Garden. What's more, if you'd like, after the tour, your driver will take you to a typical Cuban restaurant where you can treat yourself to the best local cuisine (food not included).
Wherever you decide to explore, one thing is for certain: you'll be captivated by this breath-takingly beautiful area and the experience of driving through it in an equally magnificent vintage car.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Explore some of the most unique places in Cuba: discover the limestone caves scattered throughout the beautiful Viñales Valley. Enjoy a classic car ride and a boat cruise on this guided tour!
 Inside the Gran Caverna de Santo Tomás 
 Views over Viñales from the Gran Caverna de Santo Tomás 
 Inside the Palenque de los Cimarrones cave 
 Enjoying a boat trip through Cueva del Indio 
 
 
 
 
Viñales Caves Vintage Car Tour Itinerary
After meeting your English-speaking guide at the agreed time and place, you'll hop into a vintage American car - one of the most iconic symbols of Cuba - to begin your tour around the area's most famous caves. Are you ready? Let's go!
You'll be driven to the west of Viñales town, in the direction of the first stop on your route: the Gran Caverna de Santo Tomás, or the "Great Cavern of Saint Thomas" (entrance not included). At 28 miles (48 km) long, this is the island's most important and largest cave system. It is full of fascinating stalactite and stalagmite formations.
Return to your vintage car for the next part of your tour, stopping at Palenque de los Cimarrones (entrance not included). At this living museum partly located in a cave, you'll travel back in time learning about the history of slavery and the legacy of African culture in this region of Cuba.
For the finishing touch on your tour, you'll head to one of Viñales' best known caves: the Cueva del Indio. You'll explore the cavern on foot until you reach the point where you can go no further. At this point, you'll climb aboard a boat and enjoy a cruise through the limestone tunnel, finding cave paintings and archaeological remains from pre-Columbian Cuban cultures.
At the end of your tour, you'll be driven back to Viñales.
Important information
Children under 16 years old must be accompanied by an adult.
At one of the stops along your route, you will be offered a free drink.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Delve into the history of Cuba exploring on this bike tour of the Viñales Valley. Travel through time as you learn all about the area's past while exploring its lush jungle landscapes on two wheels.
 Mirador de los Jazmines viewpoint 
 Cueva del Indio 
 Exploring Viñales, Cuba by bike 
 Mural of Prehistory 
 Inside the Cueva del Indio 
 Bike tour of Viñales 
 Viñales Valley 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Viñales Valley Bike Tour
We'll meet at 9 am on the corner of Salvador Cisneros and Ceferino Fernández de Viñales Streets in Viñales. There, we'll collect our bikes and set off on our unforgettable adventure through this lush valley.
The first stop on our bike tour of Viñales will be at the Palenque de los Cimarrones, home to a museum where we'll learn about Cuba's colonial history and its relation to slavery. Later, we'll cycle to the Cueva del Indio, a cave that was historically inhabited by indigenous peoples. If you'd like, you can choose to explore inside on a boat trip. 
Afterwards, you'll have free time to get some lunch in a local restaurant before we continue onwards to the Mural of Prehistory. Stopping to take in this huge painting, we'll learn more about life in ancient times in the Viñales Valley.
We'll continue cycling to the Mirador de los Jazmines, a viewpoint from which we'll enjoy unparalleled views of the beautiful Viñales Valley and its mogotes. The guided tour will come to an end here at 3 pm, but you'll be able to use the bikes at your leisure until the next day. 
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Experience an unforgettable cruise along the coast of Cyprus when you take this evening cruise from Paphos. At the end of your trip, you will also enjoy a fantastic fireworks display.
 Yacht cruise along the coast of Paphos 
 Firework display on the coast of Paphos 
 The firework display seen from the deck of the boat 
 
 
 
Evening Fireworks Cruise
We will collect you from your hotel in Paphos at around 5 pm and then head to the city's port. A luxury yacht will be waiting to take you on a fabulous cruise towards the stunning Rikkos Beach.
As we cruise along the western coast of Cyprus under the glorious Mediterranean sunset, you will enjoy an entertaining disco on board. There is also free wifi and an open bar so you can choose your favorite drink. At about the halfway point on our journey, a buffet-style dinner will be served, including different Mediterranean specialties both hot and cold.
The highlight of the night takes place as we make our way back to the port. From the boat's deck, you will witness a spectacular fireworks display on the banks of Rikkos Beach, lighting up the Cypriot Sky in a glorious range of colors.
We finally reach the docks of Paphos where we will take you back to your hotel, arriving at around 11 pm.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
We currently don’t have any scheduled dates for this activity.
Check out all the activities in Paphos 
Do you want to drive a buggy along the east coast of Cyprus? You can tour Akamas National Park and enjoy places such as Lara beach, Coral Bay and the Sea Caves.
 Buggy Tour 
 Coral Bay 
 Adonis Baths 
 Lara Beach 
 
 
 
 
Akamas National Park Buggy Tour
We'll pick you up from your hotel in Paphos between 9:15 am and 9:40 am and get on a comfortable bus that will take us to Coral Bay in Peyia. When we arrive, the monitors will tell us how to drive the buggies.
Buckled up and ready to go, we'll set off on our buggy tour around eastern Cyprus, through the beautiful Akamas National Park and its surroundings. On the tour we'll drive past places such as the Sea Caves, the EDRO III shipwreck and St George's Chapel.
We'll enter Akamas National Park and head to Lara beach, where we'll take a dip to freshen up after the first part of the tour. We'll also recharge our batteries with a drink in a local café.
Then we'll hop back on the buggy and head to the Adonis baths (entrance fee not included), a beautiful waterfall with a deep blue lagoon. After this last stop, we'll drive the buggies back to the starting point after a four and a half hour tour. 
We'll arrive at the Paphos hotels between 3 pm and 3:30 pm.
Important information
You must have a driving license. 
Each buggy has a maximum capacity of 2 people. However, the price is the same for driver and passenger.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Explore Akamas National Park in style on a quad bike. You'll get to admire the beautiful scenery of eastern Cyprus while enjoying a fun driving experience.
 Edro III Shipwreck 
 Lara Beach 
 Adonis Baths 
 
 
 
Akamas National Park Quad Bike Tour
We'll pick you up from your hotel between 9:15 am and 9:40 am and head to the north of Cyprus, specifically to the famous Coral Bay in Peyia, just 6 kilometres from Paphos.
As soon as we arrive, the instructors will give us all the necessary safety instructions to drive the quads. Once we're kitted out and ready to go, we'll set off on a 4 hour and a half tour to discover the beauty of Akamas National Park and its surroundings. 
We'll start with Coral Bay, a popular paradise for local Cypriots to relax in its crystalline waters. Near here, we'll also find the 2011 EDRO III shipwreck. Another of the attractions we'll get to see are the Sea Caves where you'll be able to admire the beautiful east coast of Cyprus.
We'll  continue driving through the banana plantations until we reach St. George's Chapel, when we'll finally head into Akamas National Park. Here we'll visit Lara Beach, where we'll have some time to take a dip and relax with a drink in a local café.
With our batteries recharged, we'll hop back on the quads and zoom off to the Adonis Baths (entrance fee not included); a stunning waterfall and lagoon that make up a natural paradise.  After this last stop, we'll make our way back to the starting point.
At 2:30 pm we'll arrive at Coral Bay, and at the Paphos hotels between 3 pm and 3:30 pm.
Important information
You must have a driving license.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Go on an exciting journey through Akamas National Park with this jeep tour. You'll also enjoy a boat ride on the Blue Lagoon. Can you think of anything better to do in Cyprus?
 Jeep ride 
 Akamas National Park 
 Blue Lagoon 
 
 
 
Akamas National Park & Blue Lagoon Cruise
We'll pick you up from your hotel in Paphos between 8:15 am and 8:45 am and climb on board a comfortable bus that will take us to the Akamas Peninsula area, which we'll tour in an all-terrain jeep.
Our tour will begin at the incredible Avakas Gorge, a narrow tunnel formed by two sheer cliffs where a stream runs through. After admiring this beautiful part of the island, we'll head to Lara beach, one of the most paradisiacal beaches on the island. We'll also find out everything that goes on at the Turtle Conservation Station.
From here we'll hop back on the jeep and continue exploring the stunning landscape of northwestern Cyprus until we reach one of the viewpoints in Akamas Natural Park, where you'll get the chance to take some impressive photos.
The tour will then continue to the Baths of Aphrodite, a small lagoon surrounded by orange and carob trees, typical of the Mediterranean landscape. Then we'll head to one of the most eagerly awaited places of the day, the Blue Lagoon.
The lush greenery contrasted with the sparkling blue water of the lake will take your breath away. We'll enjoy a boat ride on the lagoon to explore the caves and even make stops so you can take a dip in its crystalline waters.
To recharge our batteries, we'll enjoy a meal in a local restaurant, which will be a traditional dish accompanied by drinks such as water, wine and lemonade.
Between 6 pm and 6:30 pm we'll make our way back to the Paphos hotels.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Hop on a mountain bike and explore the surroundings of Akamas National Park- a unique opportunity enjoy Cyrpus' wonderful scenery while doing exercise. 
 EDRO III Shipwreck 
 Lara Beach 
 Adonis Baths 
 
 
 
Akamas National Park Bike Tour
Between 9:15 am and 9:40 am we'll pick you up from your hotel in Paphos. We'll climb on board a comfortable bus that will take us on a 6 kilometre journey north to Coral Bay.
When we arrive, the specialised monitors will kit us out with all the necessary equipment so we're safe and ready to go. We'll mount our bikes and set off on a four and a half hour ride through Akamas National Park and its surroundings.
On the tour, we'll see the Sea Caves, Saint George's Chapel  and the EDRO III shipwreck. We'll also head into Akamas National Park and visit Lara Beach, where we'll get the chance to take a dip and freshen up with a drink in a local café.
After this stop, we'll cycle on to the Adonis Baths (entrance fee not included); an impressive waterfall and a deep blue lake. After this stop, we'll head back to the starting point to return the bikes.
The tour will end at Paphos hotels between 3 pm and 3:30 pm.
Important information
You must be able to ride a bike to go on this tour.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Go on an unforgettable boat ride across the Blue Lagoon and admire the magnificent coastline of Akamas as you dive into Cyrpus' crystal clear waters.
 Blue Lagoon 
 Blue Lagoon boat ride 
 Sailing the Blue Lagoon 
 
 
 
Blue Lagoon Cruise
We'll pick you up from your hotel between 7:50 am and 8:35 am and head to Latchi Harbour, an hour's drive from Paphos. As soon as we arrive, we'll board a boat and set sail across the Blue Lagoon.
On the cruise, we'll admire the beautiful coast of Akamas. We'll also enjoy some music on board along with a buffet of drinks and food throughout the journey.
As we approach the Blue Lagoon, we'll marvel at its crystal clear water and the lush natural environment that surrounds it. You'll want to jump right in! Don't worry, the crew have snorkelling equipment on board so you can admire the beauty of the lagoon as well as the fish that inhabit its waters.
After a pleasant swim, we'll sail back to the harbour. We'll arrive at the Paphos hotels at 4 pm.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Check out all the activities in Aarhus 
Explore Denmark's 2nd biggest city in comfort and style when you take our fantastic sightseeing bus tour of Aarhus. You can hop and off whenever you want, at any of the designated stops, making it easy for you to discover all the essential landmarks at your own pace.
 Aarhus 
 The bus waiting at the port 
 The sightseeing bus tour through Aarhus 
 
 
 
Routes and stops
The tourist bus of Aarhus will take you to the top sights around one of Denmark's oldest, and largest, cities. The open-top vehicle will give you exclusive panoramic views of the historic streets around the 2017 European Capital of Culture.
Throughout the journey, you can hop on and off at any of the 8 designated stops. This makes it easy for you to discover important locations such as Marselisborg Palace, the City Hall, the Cathedral, and ARoS Kunstmuseum museum of art, at your own pace. The bus route also takes you alongside the beautiful Aarhus river and into the shopper's paradise of Strøget.
How it works
Once you have used the ticket for the first time, you can continue to use it for the following 24 hours at any of its designated stops. You can consult the route and all the stops by clicking on the following link:
Route and stops of the Aarhus sightseeing bus.
All bus tickets are valid for three months from the date you have selected when making the reservation.
Times and frequency
The service operates from 10 am to 2 pm.
The bus departs every 60 minutes and the total journey lasts 55 minutes.
Important information
The sightseeing bus only operates on days when a cruise ship is scheduled to arrive at the port of Aarhus.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Discover two special locations in the Dominican Republic with this Dublanc Hike & Indian River Shore Excursion. Experience a boat ride along the Indian River and a famous hiking trail.
 Cabin on the Indian River 
 Path for the hiking route 
 Indian River Mangroves 
 Hiking along the Syndicate route 
 Boat trip on the river 
 The local fauna 
 Crossing a bridge during the route 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Dublanc Hike & Indian River Shore Excursion
At the time of your choice, we'll meet at the Roseau meeting point to start this day full of adventure. Are you ready? 
After 1 hour's drive along the Dominican coast, we'll arrive in Dublanc, where the Syndicate Trail is located. Did you know that this is one of the most famous routes on the island? Over a distance of 2 kilometres, we'll have the opportunity to walk along its leafy paths and see its endemic fauna - if we're lucky, we'll see a sisserou parrot!
We'll return to the minibus to head towards the Indian River. There we'll get into a wooden boat and sail along its calm waters for 1 hour 30 minutes. Does the landscape look familiar to you? Some scenes of Pirates of the Caribbean were recorded on this riverbed. As we're carried away by the gentle current, we'll spot the mangroves in the area.
After the boat ride, we'll take you back to the meeting point so you can return to your cruise. 
Pick up
If your ship docks at the Roseau cruise port, we'll meet in front of the Museum of Dominica, across Bay Street.
If your cruise ship docks at Woodbridge Bay pier, we'll meet at exit 1.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protection and safety, to help avoid the spread of Covid-19. Specifically, the provider of this tour will apply the following measures:
Tours or activities will not consist of more than 12 people per group.

Handing out of printed material such as maps or brochures will be avoided.
The transport used will be disinfected before and after each service and deep-cleaned every 24 hours.
Showing your voucher on your phone will be enough, and it is not necessary to print anything.

Description:
Your first time in Prague? Get to know the principal sights of "the city of a hundred spires" with this free walking tour of the Czech capital.
 Old Town Square 
 Wenceslas Square 
 The Astronomical Clock 
 The old Jewish cemetery 
 
 
 
 
Free Walking Tour of Prague
Starting in front of the Hamleys toy shop, at the booth located at Na Příkopě 14, the tour starts by taking in the site of the old city moat, pressed into action at sieges during the Seven Years War, and the War of the Austrian Succession.
From there, the tour heads towards Wenceslas Square, in the heart of the Prague's New Town and dominated at one end by a stunning example of neoclassical architecture: the Czech National Museum. Leaving the almost 14 million items housed inside for another day, the tour dives into the old town, looking for the contrasting Gothic and Baroque beauty of the old town square and the Astronomical Clock: an impressive feat of medieval engineering which at over 600 years old both tells time and gives astronomical information.
Having taken a break, the Jewish Quarter is the next stop, where we can see sights such as Franz Kafka's birthplace, and the setting of the classic expressionist film "The Golem: How He Came into the World". The tour finishes by the river, in front of the Rudolfinum Concert Hall.
Points of Interest
Wenceslas Square 
National Museum

This free tour does not permit bookings for more than 6 people. If you are a group of more than 6, please book a private tour of Prague.
If you are looking for a more complete group tour, check out the guided tour of Prague.
Children must be accompanied by an adult. The maximum number of children permitted is three per adult

Description:
When it comes to cities with a river like the Vltava, you've got to get to know then from the bank and the river itself. This hour long cruise down the Vltava river will give you a different view of Prague.
 Cruising past the sights of Prague on the River Vltava 
 Boat next to the historic Charles Bridge 
 Bridges in Prague 
 Charles Bridge 
 
 
 
 
Prague River Cruise
During the cruise, you can admire the most famous monuments in Prague: the Charles Bridge, Prague Castle and the Rudolfinum are some of the sights you can see from the deck of the boat.
The hour-long cruises take a route between the Charles Bridge and the Stvanice Island.
During the tour there will be narration in seven languages, including English. These comments are recorded and can be heard in all languages, without headphones.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protection and safety, to help avoid the spread of Covid-19. Specifically, the provider of this tour will apply the following measures:

All those running the service (guide, driver etc...) will wear a mask throughout its duration.
All those running the service (guide, driver etc...) will wear gloves throughout its duration.
