The temperature and wellness of all those taking part in the service will be monitored daily, excluding and maintaining in quarantine any who display fever or symptoms.

Description:
Enjoy a gourmet menu on board one of the most beautiful boats sailing on the river Vltava. A perfect experience for couples who want to spend a special night together.
 Boats cruising under the Charles Bridge at night 
 Prague at night 
 Gourmet dinner on board 
 Boat at the dock with views of Prague 
 
 
 
 
Route
The cruise takes three hours and goes from the Čech Bridge to Vyšehrad, passing past beautiful sights such as the Prague Castle, the Charles Bridge, and the National Theatre. The on-board pianist and the city lit up by night are the cherry on the cake.
Menu
Starters
Prague ham with a cranberry sauce.
Caprese salad with cherry tomatoes, mozzarella and homemade pesto.
Swordfish carpaccio with olive oil and lemon.
 
Main Course
Duck confit with Karlovy Vary dumplings and red cabbage.
Parchment cooked swordfish steak with cherry tomatoes, olives and grenaille potatoes.

Dessert

Strawberries with mint leaves and lemon sorbet
Chocolate mousse

Description:
Enjoy a relaxing cruise on the Vltava River to the famous Prague Zoo where you can meet its many different animals. A great day out for the whole family!
 Boat cruise on the Vltava River 
 Giraffes at the Prague Zoo 
 A tiger at Prague's zoo 
 Elephant enjoying bathing at Prague Zoo 
 Prague Zoo's sightseeing train 
 
 
 
 
 
Itinerary
After meeting at Křižovnické Náměstí Square next to the iconic Charles Bridge, you'll catch a tram to the nearby dock, from which your boat trip on the Vltava River will depart.
Throughout the cruise, which lasts around an hour and a half, an English-speaking guide will fill you in on interesting facts about the history of the different monuments that you'll pass along the way, including Prague Castle. You'll also be able to enjoy free soft drinks and coffee.
Once you've arrived at the dock in Troja, your guide will accompany you on the short 10 minute walk to the main entrance of Prague Zoo. There, you'll be given your entrance tickets, a map of the zoo, and your bus tickets for the return to Prague city centre.
You'll then have the rest of the day free to explore the zoo at your own pace. Rated amongst the top five zoos in the world, its many distinct areas house a variety of different animals: from giraffes to tigers and elephants to penguins... there's even a sightseeing train to take you around the zoo if your feet get tired!
Discover the zoo's different areas in the following link:
Map of Prague Zoo
When you've seen all you can of the zoo, return to the centre of Prague by bus using the tickets given to you earlier in the day by the guide.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protection and safety, to help avoid the spread of Covid-19. Specifically, the provider of this tour will apply the following measures:
Tours or activities will not consist of more than 15 people per group.

Handing out of printed material such as maps or brochures will be avoided.
At monuments, museums and attractions, the maximum permitted capacity will be a 50% of the total maximum capacity.
Showing your voucher on your phone will be enough, and it is not necessary to print anything.

 Prague bridges 
 Cruise along the Moldava river 
 Dinner aboard 
 Buffet Dinner

Description:
Enjoy drifting down the canals of Prague and visit the Charles Bridge Museum at your own leisure. The best of the Czech capital!
 Navigating the canals of Prague 
 Embarking at the banks of the Vltava river 
 Crossing the canals of Prague. 
 Navigating through Prague 
 Charles Bridge in Prague 
 
 
 
 
 
Cruise & Charles Bridge Museum Ticket
Meet in front of the Powder Tower, located next to Námesti Republiky (Republic Square). From this central location we will head towards the banks of the Vltava River.
Upon arrival, we will climb aboard a traditional wooden boat. Then for 45 minutes, you will navigate through the picturesque and winding canals of Prague. These waterways which run parallel to the river, flow through the city centre.
While you sit back and admire the views, listen to pre-recorded commentary in English, which provides information on the numerous sights you can see from the boat. On board you can also enjoy a small snack accompanied by a drink (to choose between a coffee, a beer, a warm wine or a drink).
We end our journey back at the same point where we boarded the boat. When the tour has finished you will receive the entrance tickets to the Charles Bridge Museum, which you can tour at your own pace. The exhibition is home to a variety of items and installations that illustrate the history of the construction of this iconic Prague monument.
Boat Timetable and Frequency
The boat runs every 20 minutes. The operation time depends on the time of year:
October to March: 10:30 am to 5 pm.
April: 10:30 am to 6 pm.
May and June: 10:30 am to 7 pm.
July and August: 10:30 am to 8:30 pm.
September: 10:30 am to 7 pm.

Description:
Visit the Czech capital on board a glass-roofed boat. During the cruise, you'll enjoy a delicious dinner while admiring Prague's main monuments.
 Glass-roofed boat on the Vltava 
 Sailing along the Vltava 
 Boat ride around Prague 
 Charles Bridge 
 Sunset in Prague 
 
 
 
 
 
Panoramic Boat & Dinner Cruise
You'll set sail at the selected time from pier number 5 in Prague. During a two-and-a-half hour cruise, you'll sail the Vltava River onboard a beautiful glass-roofed boat. Thanks to its panoramic windows you'll be able to admire the most emblematic monuments of the Czech capital. These include the famous Karlův most (Charles Bridge), the Národní Divadlo (National Theatre) and the magnificent Rudolfinum concert hall. You'll also enjoy breathtaking views of Prague Castle standing proudly on the hill.
Onboard you'll enjoy a live performance by several musicians, who'll add a romantic touch to this unforgettable evening.
Menu
At the beginning of the journey, you'll be greeted with a glass of Prosecco and a delicious selection of Czech cheeses. What's more, in the boat's restaurant you can help yourself to a buffet dinner that will include the following:
Starters
Mozzarella with tomato and fresh basil pesto
Selection of national cheeses, ham and salami
Duck paté with blueberry sauce
Grana Padano cheese
Salad (Greek, fresh or chopped cabbage)
Bread and butter
Gluten-free cakes
Chicken soup
Main dishes
Meat stew
Chicken escalopes
Baked potatoes with courgette
Sautéed vegetables with hake
Paella with roasted vegetables
Desserts
Homemade gingerbread
Apple strudel cake
Macedonia fresh fruit
Drinks are not included in the menu.
Window Seat
If you don't want to miss out on any details of the scenery around Prague as you sail along the Moldava river, you can book a seat next to the panoramic window.
To choose this option there must be a minimum of 2 people. If you're travelling by yourself you'll have to select two seats.
Other experiences by boat on the Vltava
If this cruise is fully booked, you can book any of these other boat rides on the Vltava river:
Cruise with Lunch and Live Music
Prague River Cruise
Night Cruise with Gourmet Dinner

Description:
Set off on a 3,5-hour sightseeing bus tour of Prague and admire the city’s iconic landmarks. The tour also includes a visit to Prague Castle and St. Vitus Cathedral and the Old Town Square accompanied by your knowledgeable English-speaking guide and a short boat trip.  
 St. Vitus Cathedral 
 Wenceslas Square 
 Astronomical Clock 
 
 
 
Itinerary
On this tour on a comfortable air-conditioned bus you’ll set off to discover Prague’s most representative sights. The first stop is the grandiose Prague Castle. Follow your guide into the world’s largest castle complex which was established in the ninth century and visit its splendid rooms, then discover the majestic St. Vitus Cathedral.
After visiting Prague Castle, get back on the bus and head to Prague State Opera, inaugurated in 1888. Continue the tour to the striking National Museum, situated on the renowned Wenceslas Square, discover the National Theatre, and other beautiful landmarks, picturesque squares and streets in Prague.
While you drive past these historic buildings, your professional English-speaking guide will explain the history and the most important events that took place in Prague, like the Velvet Revolution.
Then we will take you to the dock on the Vltava river to discover the city from a different perspective .From the upper deck you will also see the old and famous Charles Bridge.
The last stop of the tour is the Old Town Square in the heart of the city. Hop off the bus and admire its magnificent monuments, including the Old Town Hall and its world-famous “Prague Orloj”, an astonishing astronomical clock dating back to the Middle Ages.

Description:
Fall in love with the charm of Prague's ancient streets and monuments on this evening walking tour of the Czech capital, illuminated by the city's ornate street lamps and the light of the moon.
 Charles Bridge and the Old Town Tower 
 Historic Charles Bridge at night 
 Panoramic views over Prague at sunset 
 Beautiful Prague Castle illuminated at nightfall 
 Petřín Tower against stunning sunset skies 
 Lennon Wall at night 
 Charles Bridge, Prague 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Evening Walking Tour of Prague
Meet your professional English-speaking guide next to the iconic Old Town Bridge Tower on Charles Bridge, ready to start your walking tour.
Stroll across the early 15th century bridge, which connects the two sides of the city divided by the river Vltava. Despite being one of Prague's most visited landmarks, once the sun sets, Charles Bridge takes on a unique peaceful atmosphere allowing you to truly appreciate the beauty of its architecture. From this viewpoint, you'll also enjoy spectacular panoramic views of Prague Castle, the largest ancient castle in the world.
Crossing to the other side of the bridge, you'll reach one of Prague's most iconic landmarks, and a favourite of Beatles fans, the Lennon Wall. Admire the ever-changing graffiti, which is added to every day with a different lyric or image representing symbols of love and peace. 
From here, you'll take the city's historic funicular railway up Petřín Hill, at the top of which you'll find the Petřín Lookout Tower, an observation deck of more than 200 feet (over 60 m) in height. As well as enjoying the magnificent views, being at the highest point in Prague, you'll also see an ancient monastery famous for its craft beer.
Begin your walk back to Prague's Old Town via the Malá Strana district. The neighbourhood dates back to the Middle Ages, but after devastating fires in the 1500s, the majority of buildings were rebuilt in Renaissance styles. Admire the beautiful houses along Nerudova street and Malostranské náměstí, where you'll see the spectacular Baroque St Nicholas' Church.
Your guided evening walking tour of the Czech capital will finish in the city centre, where you'll be left to continue enjoying Prague's nightlife at your own pace.
Important Information
During the summer months, the tour will be mainly in daylight.
Prague's funicular will be closed from 4th March to 15th March and from 5th October to 23rd October. Instead, we'll take a tram to the top of Petřín Hill.

Description:
Enjoy the most emblematic areas of Prague by electric scooter, an ecological and fun vehicle on which you can zip through the capital.
 Passing through Prague on an electric scooter 
 Prague Castle 
 Next to the Moldava River 
 E-scooters in prague 
 
 
 
 
Itinerary
The tour meets in the Prague old town, to begin our electric scooter tour. This ecological vehicle, a more robust version of your average scooter, will allow us to move in comfort around the streets of Malá Strana (the lesser town) and the Castle neighbourhood.
On board our scooters we'll cross the Moldava river on the way to Belvedere, a summer palace surrounded by beautiful gardens from where we will enjoy incredible views of the city. Our route then continues to the Prague Castle, the enormous walled space where the President of the Czech Republic lives and which also houses the cathedral, a convent and a palace, as well as other medieval buildings.
Beyond the walls we will find the Strahov Monastery, constructed in the 12th century, before continuing our tour up the castle hill, to the Malá Strana, one of Prague's oldest neighbourhoods, famous for its palaces, which today are the headquarters of a number of embassies. We'll explore the streets of the district known as the "pearl of the baroque" before crossing the Moldava river on the way back to the old town.
The electric scooter tour then ends, returning to the departure point.

Description:
Prepare yourself to pass through the parks and over the hills of Prague on a Segway, and discover the Czech capital in the most fun way possible! Unmissable!
 The Brevnov Monastery 
 Passing through the parks of Prague on a Segway 
 The Hvězda Summer Palace 
 Segway in Prague 
 
 
 
 
Itinerary
The tours take place accompanied by a professional guide who will show you only the best of Prague's west side, in an original and thrilling way!
During the tour we'll discover the parks and other green areas scattered among the hills to the West of the Vltava river. You'll enjoy a tour through the open spaces which take you to see some of the historic buildings such as the Hvězda Summer Palace from the 16th century or the Kajetanka Villa, a small monastery turned into a private residence in 1783.

Description:
Passing through Prague by bike is one of the best ways to visit the city. With this tour, you will discover the main sights in the Czech capital on two wheels.
 Admiring the views of Prague from on top of the hill 
 The Petřín tower 
 Passing through Prague by bike 
 
 
 
Itinerary
The tour meets in the Prague old town, from where we'll begin our route around the old town to discover the secrets of the old Bohemian capital.
During the tour we'll cross the Moldava river, see the giant metronome in Letná park, the royal gardens and the Beldevere Palace, climbing up to the Prague Castle where you can enjoy the best views of the city.
We'll continue our tour next to the Strahov monastery, passing through the parks on the hill to see the Petřín Tower, built in 1891 in a style similar to the Eiffel Tower. We'll cross the river to return to the east bank and dive into the streets of the old town to see some of the most important buildings in the city, such as the National Theatre, the old town hall, the famous Astronomical Clock or the State Opera. 
The tour will end returning to its starting point.
Types of tour
The Prague bike tour is available both on a normal and electric bike. The electric bikes have an electric motor which helps on the hills and when pedalling, making for a more comfortable and relaxing experience.
Important Information
If you would like to take this tour with children who already know how to ride a bike, we recommend that you reserve an electric bike for them, and we will adapt it to their needs. Prague is a famously hilly city, and the help of the electric motor allows them to enjoy the tour to the fullest. We also have smaller bikes which they can try before the tour begins, to choose which they prefer.
Covid-19 Measures

Description:
There is no better way to begin your trip to Prague than with a tour through the historic centre with an English speaking guide: over 2.5 hours, this walking tour will teach you about the history of the old town and the old Jewish ghetto.
 Wenceslas Square 
 Old Town Square 
 The Jewish Cemetery 
 
 
 
Itinerary
Beginning in Prague's main square, Wenceslas Square, which houses the imposing National Museum, over the course of 2.5 hours the tour will dive into the Old Town, its winding streets filled with small shops selling Prague's most typical wares: porcelain, glassware, marionettes or absinthe. 
The tour then passes through the old Jewish Ghetto, a walled-off and poverty-stricken section of town where for some 700 years the discriminated-against Prague Jewish community lived. Here you can see the cemetery dating back to the 15th century and 16th-century synagogues. 
Next the tour passes through Ungelt, founded in the 12th century as a place where foreign merchants paid customs on the goods they brought into Prague. Then nearby the tour makes a stop before one of the most impressive sights in the Old Town, Týn Church, which dominates the landscape with two gothic towers each 80m tall.
After a walk down Celetna Street the tour ends in front of the "Powder Tower", one of the symbols of Prague and one of the 13 original city gates which today separates the old town from the new.

Description:
Delve into the rainforest and go white water rafting on the Pastaza River. You'll get the chance to row along a calm river as well as have fun in the rapids.
 Rafting on the river Pastaza 
 Heading down the river in Baños de Agua Santa 
 Rafting equipment 
 
 
 
White Water Rafting
We'll meet at 9 am between streets Calle 16 de Diciembre and Calle Juan Montalvo de Baños de Agua Santa. There we'll pick up the rafting equipment and set off for the Pastaza River, half an hour away. On the way, we'll pass some incredible waterfalls, such as the Manto de la Novia and the Pailón del Diablo. 
When we arrive we'll receive an introduction from the instructor, before hopping on the raft and onto the river!
We'll spend an hour and a half rowing down the river, overcoming obstacles and enjoying the rapids. We'll even get to see fascinating plants and wildlife of the rainforest on our cruise.
The river will lead us to the village of Topos, where we'll leave the rafts and head back to the vehicle. To end the day on a high note, we'll go to a local restaurant and enjoy a lunch with a main course, a side and a drink. 
At 2 pm we'll take you back to the starting point.
Important Information
The activity is not recommended for pregnant women or people with back and/or heart problems, and you must be a strong swimmer ​to take part.

Description:
The Guayaquil tourist bus is the best way to visit the most emblematic places in this Ecuadorian city located on the banks of the Guayas River. 
 Guayaquil Municipal Palace 
 Malecón Simón Bolívar 
 Guayaquil Tourist Bus 
 
 
 
Guayaquil Hop On Hop Off Tourist Bus
The Guayaquil tourist bus is one of the best ways to explore the city and see its magnificent combination of modernity and Latin American tradition.
You can hop on and hop off at any of the 36 stops. The entire route lasts 90 minutes. During the trip, you'll enjoy live explanations from a local guide.
The bus stops at the most iconic parts of Guayaquil, passing by places such as the famous Malecón Simón Bolívar, the first view travellers had of the city when they arrived during the 19th century and which today is a beautiful park for families to enjoy a walk.
The bus also stops at some of the city's political landmarks, such as the Municipal Palace. You can also admire Guayaquil's main streets: Avenida de las Américas and Avenida 9 de Octubre.
Check out this map of the Guayaquil tourist bus route.
More Information
With your ticket you'll be able to hop on and off at any of the stops. Your ticket will be active for one day and for one complete route.
The Guayaquil tourist bus leaves every day from 10 am and come every 2 hours.

Description:
Discover the coastal monuments of Guayaquil with a peaceful boat ride on the Guayas River and discover this beautiful Ecuadorian city from a different perspective!
 Cruising the Guayas River 
 Malecón Simón Bolívar in Guayaquil 
 Hemiciclo de la Rotonda monument 
 Municipal Palace of Guayaquil 
 
 
 
 
Guayas River Boat Ride
After picking you up from your hotel in Guayaquil we'll head straight to the Malecón Simón Bolívar promenade, where we'll board our boat. 
During this approximately hour-long cruise on the Guayas River, we'll admire Guayaquil's iconic monuments on the shores. In particular, we'll get to see the famous Hemiciclo de la Rotonda, which represents the historic meeting between the liberators José Martí and Simón Bolívar in 1822.
As we sail, we'll also marvel at the Municipal Palace of Guayaquil and the famous Torre Morisca clock tower. Did you know its clock was imported from a country on the other side of the Atlantic? Find out more on the tour!
What's more, we'll discover the beautiful historic neighbourhood of Las Peñas from a different perspective as we cruise the river. The tour will then end back at the starting point on the Malecón Simón Bolívar and we'll take you back to your hotels.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Explore the Mindo Nambillo Ecological Reserve. Ride up the mountain in the traditional tarabita cable car and stroll through the waterfall sanctuary!
 Tarabita cable car 
 Nambillo Waterfall 
 Small waterfalls in the waterfall sanctuary 
 
 
 
Mindo Cable Car & Nambilla Waterfall
At the selected time, head to the Mindo Nambillo Ecological Reserve, where you'll show your ticket to enter one of the most stunning natural areas in Ecuador. 
How would you like to see this breathtaking natural landscape from 150 m above? You'll get the chance to ride up in a traditional tarabita, a traditional Ecuadorian cable car. You'll soar over the scenery and get off at the Nambilla Waterfall Sanctuary, made up of seven spectacular waterfalls. 
It's around a 15-minute walk to the Nambillo Waterfall, and half an hour to the Reina Waterfall, one of the most popular. Further on are the smallest waterfalls in the sanctuary.
You can enjoy the Mindo Nambillo Ecological Reserve for as long as you like until closing time at 5:30 pm.

Description:
Rent a bike for a day and cycle through Mindo to discover its hidden treasures. You'll be able to ride along dirt roads and even explore a virgin forest. 
 Cycling through the Mindo Forest 
 Bike ride 
 Touring Mindo 
 
 
 
Bike Ride in Mindo
Make your way to the bike rental shop in Calle Vicente Aguirre, 48, Mindo at the selected time where you'll pick up your bike. Now let's get pedalling!
You'll be able to explore the town of Mindo and visit the Mindo Nambillo Protected Forest. You'll be able to ride among the tropical vegetation and admire the animals that inhabit the area. 
You can even head to the Waterfalls Sanctuary, where you can take a dip in the natural pools. 
At the end of the ride, you'll have to make your way back to the starting point to return the bikes by 6 pm at the latest.

Description:
Enjoy a guided tour of the historic centre of Copenhagen, the best way to get to know the Danish capital for a first timer, and what's more, it's free!
 Copenhagen Town Hall 
 Nyhavn the colourful maritime walkway 
 The Christiansborg palace arches 
 Amalienborg Palace 
 
 
 
 
Free Walking Tour of Copenhagen
Our free tour begins by the dragon fountain found in the Rådhuspladsen, the Town Hall Square. We will observe the beautiful decoration of the municipal headquarters where the golden sculpture of the bishop-founder of the city, Absalon, is a highlight.
As we learn about the legends and curiosities which run through the history of the Danish capital, we will continue our Copenhagen guided tour along the Nyhavn. This famous waterfront walkway along the banks of the canal is known for the buildings along it which add a splash of colour to the district: the tour digging into the reasons behind their striking colour scheme.
The tour continues to take in the Christiansborg palace - the current headquarters of the Danish Parliament, and home to the tallest tower in Copenhagen.
The route concludes in Amalienborg Square - by the Danish Royal Palace. In this famous square we'll learn about the palace intrigues of the Danish monarchs of the past. 
Important Information
It is not possible to take the free tour if you are a group of more than 9 people. If this is the case, check out our Private Walking Tour of Copenhagen.
Minors should come accompanied by an adult. The maximum is 3 minors per adult.
The tour does not enter any of the monuments, visiting the outside instead.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
On this free walking tour of Christianshavn, a historically Bohemian neighbourhood of Copenhagen, you'll discover essential sights such as Freetown Christiania.
 The equestrian statue of warrior-bishop Absalon 
 The canal in Christianshavn 
 Church of Our Saviour, in Christianshavn, Copenhagen 
 Sign welcoming visitors to Christiania 
 
 
 
 
Free Walking Tour of Christianshavn
Meet your guide at Hojbro Plads, next to the equestrian statue of Absalon, the 12th century warrior-bishop who founded Copenhagen. After learning all about the legendary history of this famous Dane, you'll make your way over to the islands situated to the east of the city.
Here you'll find Christianshavn, the 'alternative' district of Copenhagen. The origins of this renowned neighbourhood date back to the 17th century, when it was created as an extension of the city's fortifications by the ruler at the time, Christian IV, for whom the district was named. Explore the area's pretty cobblestone streets on this free walking tour of Christianshavn while you learn more about its past from your expert guide. 
Next to the Christianshavn Canal, which cuts through the district, you'll reach the iconic Church of Our Saviour. This striking Baroque building is characterised by its black-and-gold corkscrew spire, which has an external winding staircase that visitors can climb up for panoramic views of Copenhagen from above.
From here, you'll head over to Freetown Christiania. While this intriguing community is technically part of Copenhagen's Christianshavn neighbourhood, it has been seen as a "state within another state" since its formation in the 1960s. The 1000-odd inhabitants have their own regulations, and consider themselves outside of Danish and EU law.
Stroll through the cobbled streets of Christiania known as  while you hear all about the hippy origins of this small commune, and learn about the controversies surrounding it. Don't forget to check out the examples of the "Architecture without Architects" movement, which includes a house built entirely out of windows! You'll end your free tour of Christianshavn at the entrance to Christiania which you can visit of your own accord if you wish to. 
Important information
It is not possible to reserve this free walking tour of Christianshavn for groups of more than 9 people. If you're a group of over 9 you can book our private tour of Copenhagen.
Covid-19 Measures

Description:
Castles, towers and churches... Discover the golden age of Danish culture on this walking tour of Renaissance Copenhagen. What's more, it's FREE!
 Neoclassical façade of the Church of Our Lady 
 Copenhagen's Rundetaarn, or Round Tower 
 Rosenborg Castle in Copenhagen 
 Torvehallerne Market 
 Rosenborg Castle 
 Absalon Statue 
 Food in Torvehallerne Market 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Free Walking Tour of Renaissance Copenhagen
Begin your journey back in time meeting your professional English-speaking guide in Hojbro Plads, next to the equestrian statue of Absalon. Learn the history of this warrior-bishop, considered to be the founder of Copenhagen.
Wander through the surrounding streets until you reach the Church of Our Lady, Copenhagen's cathedral. On the site of many previous churches destroyed by fires and bombing over the years, the current temple, finished in 1825, boasts a striking Neoclassical-style façade that will remind you of classical Greek temples.
Continue your free walking tour route to the Rundetaarn. This round tower was originally constructed as an astronomical observatory in the 17th century; inside, instead of stairs, a spiral ramp was built to allow horse and carriage access to the top. Discover the secrets and legends housed by this intriguing monument thanks to your expert guide.
A short ten minute walk from the tower, you'll find the Rosenborg Castle, the next stop on your route. Delve deep into the history of Copenhagen as you admire this Dutch Renaissance-style palace, built in the early 1600s as a summer residence for the Danish royal family. The building is located within the "Kongens Have" or King's Garden, the city's oldest and most visited park.
Your walking tour will come to an end at Torvehallerne market. Amongst the many food stalls offering all manner of delicacies, a highlight are the selections of Danish pastries popular in the country since the Renaissance era.
Important information
It is not possible to reserve this free walking tour of Renaissance Copenhagen for groups of more than 9 people.

Description:
Explore Copenhagen in a different way by taking this boat tour along its canals. You will discover the city from a unique and special perspective. This trip is simply unmissable for any visitor to Copenhagen!
 The Little Mermaid statue in Copenhagen 
 Sailing along the canals of Copenhagen 
 The Nyhavn waterfront district of Copenhagen 
 
 
 
Itinerary
We will meet up at the dock located next to the square on Gammel Strand square. You will climb on board before setting off on the canal tour which will introduce you to the city from the water.
We start by cruising along the Nyhavn canal, which was once home to seamen and prostitutes, but which nowadays is one of the busiest parts of Copenhagen thanks to its numerous bars and cafes.
During the 60-minute trip, we will pass some of the essential sights of Copenhagen, such as the mythical Little Mermaid statue, the Royal Opera House, Amalienborg Palace, The Royal Library, the stock exchange, and the Church of Our Saviour.
Timetable and frequency
From 4 May to 15 June: from 9:30 am to 6 pm every 10-30 minutes.
From 16 June to 31 August: from 9:30 am to 9 pm every 10-30 minutes.
From 1 September to 21 October: from 9:30 am to 6 pm every 10-30 minutes.
From 22 October to 15 March: from 9:30 am to 3 pm every 20-45 minutes.
From 16 March to 3 May: from 9 am to 5 pm every 20-45 minutes.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Sail the canals of Copenhagen on board a comfortable sightseeing boat which you can hop on and off as often as you want. The best way to explore the city!
 Cruising the canal 
 Passing the canal bridges on the sightseeing boat 
 
 
Copenhagen Hop-On Hop-Off Boat Tour
The entire tour lasts an hour and a half. During the cruise, you'll enjoy impressive views of Copenhagen as you listen to an audio guide with interesting information about the sights. You can also get on and off at each stop as many times as you like.
The sightseeing boat in Copenhagen cruises the city’s waterways and stops at seven piers:
Ved Stranden/Strøget 
Nyhavn entertainment district
Reffen Street Food
The Little Mermaid
Ofelia Plads/Amalienborg Palace
Christianshavn
The Black Diamond/BLOX/DAC cultural area
During the journey of one hour and a half you will enjoy the best views of the city from the water. Learn all about the main points of interest around Copenhagen and its history with the on-board audio guide.
You can consult the route map by clicking on the following link:
Route of the sightseeing boat tour
How does it work?
The canal boat ticket is valid for 48 hours. To access the boat, head to any of the designated jetties at any moment you wish, during the indicated operational hours. You can then hop on and off the boat as many times as you want for the following 48 hours. For example, if you use it for the first time on Tuesday at 12:00 pm, your ticket will be valid until 11:59 am on Thursday.
If you intend to do the complete tour, we recommend that you start from the Ved Strand jetty.
Timetable
The boat departs from the specified piers:
Every 30 minutes between 9:45 am and 5:15 pm from 4 May to 15 September.
Every 10-45 minutes between 9:30 am and 3 pm from 16 September to 1 May.
Important information
The stops at Reffen, The Little Mermaid, Ofelia Plads, Christianshavn and BLOX are only operational in summer, from 4 May to 15 September.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Discover Copenhagen on two wheels on this exciting Segway tour! Zoom around the historical centre, pay a visit to the famous little mermaid and see the city's most emblematic buildings.
 Segway adventure along the Nyhavn canal 
 The Amalienborg Palace 
 Outside the Copenhagen Opera House 
 Segway tour around the Kastellet 
 
 
 
 
Copenhagen Segway Tour
We offer two different routes so that you can choose the best segway tour for you. In both cases, you'll receive brief training from the guides so that you can get around the city without any difficulties. And don't worry, no driving licenses or previous experience are required!
1-hour route
After an introduction from the guides, we'll head into the centre of Copenhagen and our first stop will be along the harbour at the Little Mermaid statue. Don't miss your chance to take a photo with the symbol of the city!
Next, we'll head to the residence of the Danish royal family, Amalienborg Palace. Here, in front of the Princess Marie of Orléans monument, we'll discover more about the history of the Danish monarchy, the third oldest in Europe. Afterwards, we'll pass by St. Alban's Church and Frederik's Church, popularly known as The Marble Church, before admiring Gefion Fountain, the largest monument in Copenhagen.
We'll also pass by Gefion bridge, the central Kongens Nytorv square, the Holmen Naval Base and the old ferry terminal. Plus you'll be able to admire the Opera House and the Royal Theatre.
Following that, we'll see Kastellet, a citadel and one of the best-preserved fortresses in Northern Europe, located in the centre of the city, before passing along the Nyhav canal, with its typical colourful façades.
Finally, we'll finish the tour by enjoying an organic soft drink.
2-hour route
If you choose the 2-hour route, we'll follow a similar route to the 1-hour version, but we'll also visit City Hall Square, the National Bank and the Copenhagen Stock Exchange, with its typical Danish architecture and spiralled chapel.
We'll continue our segway tour past the Royal Danish Library and the NY Carlsberg Glyptotek- this sounds like the beer, right? Maybe there's some kind of link... 
Next, we'll stop outside the Christiansborg Palace, home to the Danish Parliament, but then we'll switch from politics to fun at the old Tivoli theme park. After, we'll see the Royal Library, the largest in the Nordic countries, and then we'll step back to the Rococo style at Old Fellows Mansion, an ornate townhouse located in the city centre.
We'll go back even further in time as we visit the Kastellet, before eventually reaching the colourful Nyhavn canal- a must see in Copenhagen! 
Just like with the 1-hour option, we'll end the tour by enjoying a refreshing organic drink.
Important Information
For health and safety reasons, these tours are not available for children under the age of 12 years. The minimum height required is 5 feet (140 cm) and participants must weigh between 77 and 276 lb (35 and 125 kg).
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
The City Sightseeing tour bus is the best way to see all of Copenhagen's main attractions. Thanks to its two floors and open top, the bus provides excellent views of the city.
 Copenhagen tourist bus 
 Touring the centre of Copenhagen 
 Amalienborg Royal Palace 
 Rosenborg Castle 
 
 
 
 
Copenhagen Tour Bus
The Copenhagen tour bus makes 26 stops at the city's main attractions. Throughout tour you'll be able to listen to an audioguide with information about all the places you pass.
Some of the most interesting stops are the Amalienborg Royal Palace, Rosenborg Castle, the City Hall Square and the Royal Library.
Check out the route and the different stops on the map via the following link:
Copenhagen Tour Bus routes and stops.
Validity
The ticket is valid for 72 consecutive hours from the time it is first used, i.e. if it is first used on a Monday at 3 pm, it will be valid until 3 pm on Thursday.
During this time you'll be able to get on and off as many times as you want, which will allow you to see places such as the Nyhavn waterfront, Langelinie and the Black Diamond, one of the most impressive examples of Danish architecture.
Options
When booking you can choose if you want to go on all the routes through the city or just the route that goes through the essential places:
Mermaid Tour (red line): This main route through the Danish capital is named after the famous statue of The Little Mermaid, which has become a landmark of the city.
Other routes: the Christiania Tour and the Carlsberg Tour.
Important information
Although when you book you'll be asked to select a start day, you can start using the service within 3 months from the selected date.
When you book we'll email you a voucher that you'll have to hand over on the first bus you take.
Timetables
From 1st April to 29th September
Mermaid Tour (red line, 1 hour 30 mins): daily departures every 10-20 minutes between 9:30 am and 7 pm.
Christiana Tour (purple line, 55 mins): daily departures every 30-60 minutes, between 10 am and 5 pm.
Carlsberg Tour (green line, 45 mins): daily departures every 30-60 minutes, between 10 am and 5 pm.
From 30th September to 31st March
Mermaid Tour (red line, 1 hour 30 mins): daily departures every 10-20 minutes between 9:30 am and 3:30 pm (Monday to Thursday) or 4 pm (Friday to Sunday).
Christiana Tour (purple line, 55 mins): daily departures every 30-60 minutes, between 11 am and 3 pm.
Carlsberg Tour (green line, 45 mins): daily departures every 30-60 minutes, between 11 am and 3 pm.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Pedal around the historic centre of the Danish capital on this sightseeing bike tour of Copenhagen, one of the world's most bike-friendly cities!
 Exploring the sights of Copenhagen 
 Discovering Amalienborg on the bike tour 
 Enjoying the bike tour 
 Cycling through Copenhagen 
 
 
 
 
Copenhagen Bike Tour Itinerary
After meeting your guide at the time selected in Frederiksborggade, right in the heart of the Danish capital, you'll be kitted out with your helmets and hop onto your bicycles ready to begin your sightseeing tour of Copenhagen city centre on two wheels.
You'll spend three hours cycling around the city's most emblematic monuments. Firstly, you'll cycle over the elegant Rosenborg Castle, the perfect example of Dutch Renaissance architecture, before pedalling onwards to visit a sculpture that has become the symbol of Copenhagen. Do you know what it could be? The Little Mermaid! This bronze statue, created in homage to the famous character created by Danish author Hans Christian Anderson, is located at the city's port.
The next stop on your bike tour will be Amalienborg, a palace that is the official residence of the Danish royal family. After admiring the impressive Rococo-style complex, you'll continue cycling towards the Copenhagen Opera House, one of the most contemporary and most expensive opera houses in the world. You'll then reach Nyhavn, the city's most famous canal, where you'll stop to take in the views of the stunning colourful houses that line its banks, before heading over to the fascinating area of Freetown Christiania.  
Afterwards, you'll make a stop in front of Christiansborg Castle, the current seat of Parliament, and the Tivoli Gardens, one of Copenhagen's most beautiful spots. Did you know that this is one of the oldest theme parks in the world? Your bike tour will also take you to see the City Hall and Nytorv, the market.
Your sightseeing bike tour of Copenhagen will come to an end back at the original departure point, passing by St. Peter's Church and the iconic Rundetaarn on the way. We'll arrive back at te meeting point at 6 pm.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Enjoy a fantastic panoramic bus tour around Copenhagen followed by a wonderful boat ride along the city's canals.
 The panoramic sightseeing bus of Copenhagen 
 Touring the canals in the sightseeing boat 
 Exploring the Copenhagen on board the sightseeing bus 
 
 
 
Sightseeing Bus Trip and Canal Boat Trip
We will meet at on Vester Voldgade street, next to the Town Hall in the city center, where we jump aboard the bus to start our fantastic panoramic sightseeing tour of Copenhagen.
We will make our first stop at Amalienborg Palace where we will witness the famous changing of the guard. Then you have 30 minutes of your own free time to explore the grounds and take some brilliant photographs. This is one of Copenhagen's most popular attractions where the Royal Family spends the summer.
Our next stop is at the mythical sculpture of The Little Mermaid, Copenhagen's most iconic landmark and the symbol of the capital.
After seeing the city's impressive Opera House up close, we will get off the bus and hop onto a boat to explore the city's canals and enjoy a different perspective of Copenhagen.
Our guide will tell you all about the important landmarks as we pass them in the water. On this wonderful journey from the Christianshavn Canal to the Frederiksholms Canal, you will see many beautiful historic buildings alongside elegant modern architecture.
Our boat trip finishes at Gammel Strand/Ved Stranden.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
With the Copenhagen tourist train, you will explore the City of Spires in an entertaining and unique way. On this sightseeing train ride, you will admire all the special monuments of the old town.
 Exploring the historic city centre on the tourist train 
 Stroget street 
 
 
Route and stops
The historic center of Copenhagen, originally a Viking fishing village, is home to an important set of historical sites which you can admire all from the carriage of the comfortable tourist train.
The tour starts at the City Hall Square and makes its way around the main historic city center. Strøget street is one of the longest pedestrianized streets in the world. From there, you will then tour around the medieval quarter of the city, famous for its architecture and full of fascinating history. You will see sculptures of Nordic mythology such as magnificent dragons and scary serpents.
Throughout the 40-minute journey, you will have access to an English language audio guide which will allow you to learn all about the monuments of the Danish capital. You will discover the main places of interest around the city, such as the Round Tower, the Cathedral of Copenhagen and the City Hall Square.
The route has three stops: the City Hall Square, Copenhagen Cathedral and Gammal Strand.
You can consult the route and all the different stops on the map by clicking on the following link:
Routes and stops of the Copenhagen sightseeing train
Timetables and frequency
The train departs every 60 minutes from the centrally located City Hall Square, also known as Radhuspladsen.
By presenting your reservation voucher you can access the tourist train whenever you want within the following timetable:
From 5 May to 15 June, Saturdays and Sundays between 10:30 am and 4:30 pm.
From 16 June to 31 August, every day between 10:30 am and 4:30 pm.
The tour lasts approximately 40 minutes and you can climb on and off as many times as you want during the day.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Enjoy a private walking tour of Copenhagen: make the most of your trip, exploring the Danish capital's most emblematic monuments with your own personal expert guide.
 Nyhavn, Copenhagen's picturesque waterfront promenade 
 The Little Mermaid of Copenhagen 
 Christiansborg Palace 
 Rosenborg Castle 
 
 
 
 
Copenhagen Private Walking Tour Itinerary
After meeting your expert English-speaking guide on the day of your tour, you'll begin your private walking tour of Copenhagen. Remember, you can pick the places of interest that you'd most like to see, tailoring your visit to your tastes. 
Your tour guide will take you to the Danish capital's most iconic landmarks and monuments, keeping you entertained and informed with their explanations and fun facts. Head to Nyhavn, the 17th-century waterfront district characterised by its brightly-coloured houses, to admire the historic architecture and the traditional wooden boats harboured there. From there, you can enjoy a 20 minute stroll along the promenade to the statue of the Little Mermaid of Copenhagen, one of the city's most recognisable symbols.
Not far from the Mermaid, you'll find Kastellet, or "The Citadel", one of the best-preserved fortress in Northern Europe, constructed in the shape of a star. See the windmill inside the bastion, used to grind flour to provide food in case of a siege.
If you feel like delving deeper into the history of the Danish royals, you could also choose to visit the beautiful 17th century Renaissance-style Rosenborg Castle, or the Christiansborg Palace, still an important political building to this day, as the seat of the Danish parliament.
Why book a private tour?
When you reserve a private guided tour, you have the benefit of personalised service and fascinating commentary on the history, myths and legends of the places you visit from an expert English-speaking guide exclusively for you and your group. You can also design your own itinerary, choosing the places that interest you the most.
Hotel pick up
This private walking tour of Copenhagen begins from the following meeting point: the main entrance to the Copenhagen Central Station, on the esplanade in front of Tivoli Gardens.
If you'd prefer to start your tour from another location, provided it's in the central area of the Danish capital (zones 1 and 2), you can reserve the tour including a pick up service. When you book this option, you'll be asked to indicate your hotel name or chosen central meeting point in the Comments box, and on the day of your tour, your guide will meet you there to begin your walking tour of the city. Please bear in mind that the pick up time is included in the tour duration.
Copenhagen harbour
If you're arriving in the Danish capital on a cruise and you disembark at the city's port, you'll have to make you own way to Copenhagen Central Station to meet the guide. The journey between the port and the station takes between 25 and 30 minutes, and you can go by bus or taxi (not included).
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Discover Quito's historic centre and learn the secrets of its cultural heritage on this guided walking tour of the Ecuadorian capital. What's more, it's FREE!
 Dome of La Compañía Church 
 Traditional Ecuadorian dance 
 La Ronda, a historic street in Quito 
 La Compañía Church, Quito 
 
 
 
 
Free Walking Tour of Quito
The tour meets at the Parque de la Alameda, at 9 am. From there we'll begin a route through 15 centuries of a city built in the image of the constellation of the sacred jaguar.
Stroll around the beautiful historic centre, getting to know the most important monuments in the Ecuadorian capital, which unites the Northern and Southern hemispheres. And you'll marvel at the Pichincha volcano, which rises 4,784 metres above sea level, and whose most recent eruption in 1999 covered Quito's sky for two full weeks!
As you admire the city's colonial architecture, your free walking tour guide will reveal all about the fascinating ancient wisdom of the indigenous people who lived here, and who created the first solar calendar.
Marvel at historic pagan temples, which, although converted to be Christian churches, still produce magical light effects when the sun hits them during the winter and summer solstices.
Continue wandering through the city's winding alleys, once part of a more than 37,000 mile (60,000 km) network of roads through the Andes that are still used to this day. Your guide will reveal fascinating tales about Quito, including the story of Ruminñahui, the head of the Inca army who ordered that the city be burnt to the ground so that the Spanish could not conquer it.
As legends go, it was this general who also hid all the Inca gold, prompting the myths of El Dorado... it still hasn't been found to this day.
The free tour of Quito then ends in the Plaza de Santo Domingo following approximately three hours.
Groups
This tour does not accept bookings for more than 6 people. If you're a larger group, you'll need to book a private tour of Quito.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protection and safety, to help avoid the spread of Covid-19. Specifically, the provider of this tour will apply the following measures:
Tours or activities will not consist of more than 10 people per group.
A safe distance of one metre between clients will be maintained whenever possible.
The use of masks is obligatory. The client must bring their own mask.
Alcohol gel will be available before, during, and after the service.
All those running the service (guide, driver etc...) will wear a mask throughout its duration.
All those running the service (guide, driver etc...) will wear gloves throughout its duration.
Handing out of printed material such as maps or brochures will be avoided.
The transport used will be disinfected before and after each service and deep-cleaned every 24 hours.
The capacity of all means of transport will be reduced to 75% of their maximum capacity.
Showing your voucher on your phone will be enough, and it is not necessary to print anything.
Alcoholic drinks are not available.

Description:
The Quito Tourist Bus is a practical and comfortable way to get to know Ecuador's beautiful capital and all of its main monuments.
 Quito Tourist Bus 
 Admiring Quito from the bus 
 Touring Quito 
 Night tour of Quito 
 Enjoying the night tour of Quito 
 
 
 
 
 
Quito Tourist Bus
The Quito Tourist Bus has 3 different lines with 10 to 11 stops. Explore the capital of Ecuador on a double-decker open-top bus as you listen a live commentary in English and Spanish, as well as an audio guide. 
You'll pass the city's most iconic monuments and landmarks, such as the Botanical Gardens, the El Panecillo statue, the Plaza Foch square, the Basílica del Voto Nacional church and the Parque García Moreno park.
Check out the different routes and stops via the following links:
Quito Tourist Bus Red Line
Quito Tourist Bus Blue Line 
Validity
Your ticket will be activated when it is used for the first time. It is valid for one day, so we recommend starting early so you can make the most of it. 
You can use your ticket to hop on and off as many times as you like and discover iconic landmarks such as the Palacio de Carondelet palace, the Basílica del Voto Nacional church, La Merced church, the Plaza Grande square and Quito Cathedral. 
Night Tour
The night tour has one departure point and makes no stops. The route takes around 3 hours and will take you past some of the most important monuments in the city so you can admire them lit up in the moonlight!
Timetable
Red line: Monday to Saturday from 9 am to 4 pm every hour.
Blue line: Sundays from 9 am to 4 pm every hour.
Night tour: Fridays and Saturdays at 7 pm from Bulevar Naciones Unidas.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Discover Quito's fascinating historical centre or its beautiful botanical garden on this electric scooter tour of the city which also includes a chocolate tasting!
 Entrance to the Botanical Garden 
 Electric scooter tour of Quito 
 Plaza de la Independencia in Quito 
 Touring Quito on an electric scooter 
 Discovering Quito in a different way 
 Selfie with the guide 
 Chocolate tasting 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Options
When you book, you can select one of two routes. On the day of the tour we'll meet at 9 am at a meeting point in Quito to give you your scooter and helmet.
Historic Centre Tour (3 hours)
Once we've gotten the hang of driving the scooters, we'll set off on a tour of Quito's historic centre. We'll visit the most important parks, squares, palaces and churches of the Ecuadorian capital to learn all about its history.
Next, you can choose between visiting the Church of the Society of Jesus or tasting some of Quito's delicious chocolate. Or, if you want to do both, let the guide know and do the complete tour for US$ 6.
Botanical Garden Tour (4 hours)
If you're more interested in enjoying Quito's nature, this is the route for you. We'll drive our scooters to the north of the city to the Botanical Garden.
As we explore the beautiful gardens, we'll learn all about the area's plants and wildlife. We'll also visit the magnificent orchidarium! At the end of the tour, you can enjoy a tasting of some Quiteño chocolate for US$ 6!
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protection and safety, to help avoid the spread of Covid-19. Specifically, the provider of this tour will apply the following measures:
Tours or activities will not consist of more than 5 people per group.
A safe distance of one metre between clients will be maintained whenever possible.
The use of masks is obligatory. The client must bring their own mask.
Alcohol gel will be available before, during, and after the service.
All those running the service (guide, driver etc...) will wear a mask throughout its duration.
Showing your voucher on your phone will be enough, and it is not necessary to print anything.

Quito Electric Scooter Night Tour
We'll meet at 5 pm on Calle Vicente Ramón Roca to give you your scooter and helmet.
From here, we'll set off on a tour of the Ecuadorian capital, heading first towards Calle de las Siete Cruces, a famous street located in the heart of Quito's historic centre. 
We'll drive our scooters through the main parks and squares, stopping to admire important monuments lit up at night, such as the National Assembly, the Government Palace, the Cathedral and the Church of the Society of Jesus.
As we explore the city by night, the guide will tell us all about its fascinating history! What's more, you can immerse yourself in Quito's culture with a chocolate tasting!
At the end of the tour, we'll make our way back to the meeting point for around 8 pm.

Description:
Did you know that Quito was the first city to be declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site? Get to know it on this tour of its main attractions, and be seduced by its beauty.
 Quito's Independence Square 
 Basilica of the National Vow in Quito 
 La Compañía Church 
 La Ronda, a traditional street in Quito's historical centre 
 
 
 
 
Quito Walking Tour
Having picked you up at your hotel, we'll make our way to the historic centre of Quito on board a private vehicle.
Our first stop will be the Panecillo Viewpoint, where we'll enjoy some spectacular views more than 10,000 feet (3000 metres) above sea level, admiring the Virgen de Quito statue, 150 feet (45 metres) tall.
Following our route, we'll visit one of the most traditional markets in Quito, the Mercado San Francisco. Here you'll be able to see for yourselves the charm, tradition and tastes of the Ecuadorian capital, which passes from generation to generation through the melting pot of the market. Here you'll have the chance to try it for yourselves, with some delicious fruit juices from the capital.
Having left the market, we'll head to the Church of San Francisco, a gem of colonial architecture. Next, we'll pass through its surroundings and head into a traditional shop to learn all about the secrets of cacao, Equador's most popular product, with a sweet and velvety chocolate tasting.
The tour continues taking in the Iglesia de la Compañía, which stands out for its mixture of colonial and baroque architectural styles, and one of the most important and ornate religious sites in Equador. Then we'll visit the Plaza Grande and Basílica del Voto Nacional, a testament to the varied architectural heritage of the city, with its distinctive neo-gothic style.
Next, we'll head to the La Casa del Alabado museum, travelling back through Equador's past with a complete collection of pre-hispanic art and Ecuadorian archaeology. Then we'll make a stop to try some delicious desserts in the San Agustin Ice Cream Shop - the oldest café in the city.
The guided tour continues through the traditional Calle de La Ronda, where the cultural and traditional mix in markets, colonial buildings and artisanal workshops which maintain their Equatorian essence.
At the end of the tour, you'll have the option to continue enjoying the historic centre of Quito on your own, or head back to the hotels by public transport.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Giant iguanas, sea lions and spectacular volcanic landscapes: discover the magic of Santa Cruz Island on this unforgettable boat cruise!
 Iguana on Santa Cruz Island 
 Las Grietas, a volcanic rock formation 
 Puerto Ayora 
 
 
 
Santa Cruz Island Boat Tour
We'll pick you up from your hotel on Santa Cruz Island at your selected time and take you to La Lobería, a small islet just two miles away. Here, you'll have the opportunity to spot sea lions in their natural habitat, admiring the large number of the adorable creatures that inhabit the Galapagos Islands.
The next stop will be the Canal de Tiburones, or "Shark Channel". How do you think this rugged volcanic fissure got this name? You'll discover why as we visit this spectacular natural lava formation!
We'll then head to another channel, this time with a friendlier name: welcome to "Love Channel"! This fissure is the perfect place to take some beautiful photos for you to remember the view forever. Next, we'll make our way to Franklin Bay, where we'll find sea turtles, pelicans and herons.
Our boat trip will continue onwards, cruising through Las Grietas on a fifteen-minute ride between dramatic lava rocks. As we sail down the channel, we'll spot cacti, iguanas and numerous different bird species, including Darwin's finches.
Finally, we'll pay a visit to Los Perros Beach, where we'll see lots of crabs as well as the largest marine iguanas in the world. The boat tour will then come to an end in Puerto Ayora after a four hour cruise.
Tour Times
The morning boat trip departs at 9 am, and the afternoon trip departs at 1 pm.
Important Information
You must stay on Santa Cruz Island the night before this day trip.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Discover the rugged beauty and spectacular wildlife of the northern Galapagos Islands on this unforgettable four day cruise of Santa Cruz, Genovesa and Rabida Islands!
 Colourful landscapes of Rabida Island 
 Cruising around the Galapagos Islands 
 Enjoying the natural scenery on Genovesa Island 
 On the beach on Santa Cruz Island 
 Crab in the Galapagos Islands 
 Iguana on the Galapagos Islands 
 Playa Dorada or Golden Beach on Bartolomé Island 
 On board the catamaran 
 Galapagos Islands cruise 
 Standard cabin 
 Cabin with bunk beds 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
North Galapagos Islands 4 Day Cruise
Day 1: Baltra & Santa Cruz Islands
On the first day of the cruise, we'll pick you up from the Galapagos Islands Airport and set off to the south of Baltra Island. We'll take a ferry from the pier for the 10 minute trip to the northern coast of Santa Cruz Island, where a catamaran awaits us ready for our four-day island hopping tour.
After being welcomed aboard with a cocktail and a delicious lunch, we'll sail to around the coast to visit several spots where boats were shipwrecked during the Second World War. At the end of a day full of adventure, we'll relax in the cabins of the catamaran. Overnight, we'll cruise north towards Genovesa Island.
Day 2: Genovesa Island
We'll drop anchor in Great Darwin Bay, located to the south of Genovesa Island, or Tower Island as it's alternatively known. We'll then get to explore, enjoying a short trek around the isle to discover the local wildlife up close. In the afternoon, after having lunch, we'll climb up a famously steep rocky path known as Prince Phillip's Steps, where we'll get to see the incredible seabird colony that inhabits the area.
Returning to the boat, we'll relax and set sail for Rabida and Bartolomé Islands.
Day 3: Rabida & Bartolomé Islands
Our first stop will be on Rabida Island, whose landscapes are characterised by their intense red colour. We'll discover why this is as we explore its rugged natural scenery. We'll also get to admire the pelicans, flamingos and sea lions that call the island home!
From Rabida, we'll cruise over to Bartolomé Island, where we'll enjoy snorkelling amongst the incredible marine life in the crystal-clear waters here. Afterwards, we'll head on to dry land for a short hike through the wilderness to discover the wildlife that inhabits the island. Our day will come to an end back on the catamaran and we'll sail back to Santa Cruz Island.
Day 4: Santa Cruz & Baltra Islands
Disembarking onto Santa Cruz Island, we'll have the unique opportunity to see the famous giant turtles in their natural habitat. After this unforgettable experience, we'll head to the north of the island and catch the ferry to Baltra Island. From there, you'll be taken to the Galapagos Islands Airport, where we'll say goodbye.
Cruise boat
The cruise will take place on a catamaran with a maximum capacity of 14 guests. You'll enjoy full-board accommodation including all breakfasts, lunches and dinners. When making your reservation you'll choose between a standard cabin with double bed or a cabin with a bunk bed. Both options have private bathrooms.
Note on prices
The indicated price is based on two people sharing a double cabin. If you're travelling alone, you'll have to pay an individual supplement.
See more of the Galapagos Islands
If you'd like, you can also book our South Galapagos Islands 4 Day Cruise. If you've got more time to spend on the archipelago, why not book our South Galapagos Islands 8 Day Cruise or North Galapagos Islands 8 Day Cruise.
Cancellation deposit
If you cancel this activity after booking, a deposit of US$ 150 to US$ 250 depending on the season will be withheld. The rest of the price of the cruise will be refunded. Find further details in the cancellation policy section.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Immerse yourself in the natural beauty of the Galapagos on this four-day catamaran cruise around the southern islands of Santiago, Santa Cruz and Santa Fé.
 Views of Santiago Island 
 Cruising around the Galapagos Islands 
 Sea lions on Santa Fé Island 
 Puerto Ayora, in the south of Santa Cruz ISland 
 Crab in the Galapagos Islands 
 Iguana on the Galapagos Islands 
 Santa Cruz Island 
 On board the catamaran 
 Galapagos Islands cruise 
 Standard cabin 
 Cabin with bunk beds 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
South Galapagos Islands 4 Day Cruise
Day 1: Baltra & Santa Cruz Islands
We'll pick you up from the Galapagos Islands Airport on your arrival and head to the south of Baltra Island, where we'll catch the ferry for the short 10 minute journey to the north of Santa Cruz Island. From there, we'll drive to the town of Puerto Ayora, where our catamaran awaits us.
After lunch on board the boat, we'll visit the Charles Darwin Research Station, where we'll learn all about the work of the famous naturalist. Our day will come to an end enjoying dinner and relaxing on board the catamaran.
Day 2: Santa Fé & Plaza Sur Islands
On day two, we'll set sail from Puerto Ayora, leaving the southern coast of Santa Cruz behind and heading to Santa Fé Island. There, we'll explore the beautiful turquoise lagoon and see its famous iguanas.
From Santa Fé, we'll continue our catamaran cruise to Plaza Sur, a tiny islet where we'll discover incredible virgin beaches. After strolling along the beautiful coast, we'll return to the boat for dinner and to rest, while we sail onwards to Santiago Island.
Day 3: Santiago Island
After breakfast on board the boat, we'll disembark on Santiago Island ready to explore its natural landscapes. We'll first make a stop to see a volcanic rock formation known as Sombrero Chino, or Chinese hat, due to its conical shape. We'll then enjoy a tour along the shores of Sullivan Bay, walking along its intriguing volcanic terrain and snorkelling in its crystalline waters.
At the end of the day, we'll relax on the boat as we sail over to the north coast of Santa Cruz Island.
Day 4: Santa Cruz & Baltra Islands
We'll spend the morning enjoying a boat tour of Black Turtle Cove, a mangrove estuary considered one of the most beautiful natural spots in the north of Santa Cruz. Don't forget your camera!
Finally, we'll catch the ferry from the north of Santa Cruz to the south of Baltra Island, and from there you'll be transferred to the Galapagos Islands Airport where our unforgettable four days of adventure will come to an end.
Cruise boat
The cruise will take place on a catamaran with a maximum capacity of 14 guests. You'll enjoy full-board accommodation including all breakfasts, lunches and dinners. When making your reservation you'll choose between a standard cabin with double bed or a cabin with a bunk bed. Both options have private bathrooms.
Note on prices
The indicated price is based on two people sharing a double cabin. If you're travelling alone, you'll have to pay an individual supplement.

Description:
Enjoy the experience of a lifetime spending eight days cruising around the incredible southern Galapagos Islands and discovering their natural beauty and wildlife.
 Admiring the Sleeping Lion 
 Española Island in the Galapagos 
 Floreana Island 
 Crab in the Galapagos Islands 
 Cruising around the Galapagos Islands 
 Iguana on the Galapagos Islands 
 Puerto Ayora on Santa Cruz Island 
 On board the catamaran 
 Galapagos Islands cruise 
 Standard cabin 
 Cabin with bunk beds 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
South Galapagos Islands 8 Day Cruise
Day 1: Baltra & North Seymour Islands
On the day of your arrival, we'll pick you up from the Galapagos Islands Airport on Baltra Island. From there, we'll set sail by catamaran to North Seymour Island. This tiny islet is known for its numerous colonies of sea birds, and we'll learn to distinguish the different species.
We'll then spend the rest of the day relaxing and having dinner on board the boat as we sail over to San Cristóbal Island.
Day 2: San Cristóbal Island
We'll kick off the second day of our eight-day cruise snorkelling in the waters around the Sleeping Lion Rock, an islet located off the coast of San Cristóbal. We'll then head to Isla Lobos, where we'll get to see the many sea lions that inhabit the island and that give it its Spanish name.
In the afternoon, we'll head onto San Cristóbal Island itself where we'll enjoy a hike around Cerro Bruja, where the abundant wildlife was of great interest to Charles Darwin. At the end of the day, we'll return to the catamaran and cruise to Española Island.
Day 3: Española Island
On the approach to Española Island, we'll find a group of smaller islets including Osborn and Gardner, where we'll take the opportunity to snorkel and discover the wealth of marine life in the area. We'll then sail to the beautiful Gardner Bay and around the coast of Española to Punta Suarez, where you'll be captivated by the spectacular natural landscapes.
From here, we'll continue on our sailing trip to Floreana Island.
Day 4: Floreana Island
After breakfast on board the catamaran, we'll dock at Punta Cormorant and set off on a trek around this beach located on an outcrop off Floreana Island. We'll then go by boat to Champion Island, where we'll enjoy a refreshing dip and get to snorkel in its waters.
Our route will continue to the west of Floreana, where we'll visit Post Office Bay and discover how it earned this intriguing name. Nearby, we'll stop at the Baronesa Viewpoint to enjoy spectacular views over the surrounding landscapes, before seeing them up close with a fun kayaking tour. 
Back on the catamaran, we'll have dinner and relax while we set a course for Santa Cruz Island.
Day 5: Santa Cruz Island
After dropping anchor in Puerto Ayora in the south of the island, we'll visit the Charles Darwin Research Station to learn all about the legacy of the English naturalist. At the end of the day, we'll return to Puerto Ayora and continue on our cruise to Santa Fé Island.
Day 6: Santa Fé & Plaza Sur Islands
At Santa Fé Island, we'll have the opportunity to meet the iguanas for which the Galapagos Islands are so well known. Then, after eating lunch, we'll sail onwards to Plaza Sur Island, where you'll fall in love with the pristine beaches. If we're lucky, we'll see more local wildlife while we explore!
After dinner on board the catamaran, we'll continue our cruise to Santiago Island.
Day 7: Santiago Island
Bordering the coast of Santiago Island, we'll make a stop to see a conical volcanic rock formation which has earned the name "Chinese Hat" due to its shape. We'll also dive into the water to see it from close up and enjoy snorkelling around the area.
We'll spend the afternoon walking and snorkelling in Sullivan Bay, part of Santiago Island known for its rich biodiversity. Afterwards, we'll return to the sailboat to rest and sail to Santa Cruz Island.
Day 8: Santa Cruz & Baltra Islands
We'll make the most of the final day of our eight-day island hopping trip to cruise through the mangroves of the Black Turtle Cove, considered one of the most beautiful areas of Santa Cruz Island. We'll then take the ferry to Baltra Island, where you'll be transferred to the Galapagos Islands Airport.
Cruise boat
The cruise will take place on a catamaran with a maximum capacity of 14 guests. You'll enjoy full-board accommodation including all breakfasts, lunches and dinners. When making your reservation you'll choose between a standard cabin with double bed or a cabin with a bunk bed. Both options have private bathrooms.
Note on prices
The indicated price is based on two people sharing a double cabin. If you're travelling alone, you'll have to pay an individual supplement.
See more of the Galapagos Islands
If you'd like, you can also book our North Galapagos Islands 8 Day Cruise. If you've got less time to spend on the archipelago, why not book our South Galapagos Islands 4 Day Cruise or North Galapagos Islands 4 Day Cruise.
Cancellation deposit
If you cancel this activity after booking, a deposit of US$ 150 to US$ 250 depending on the season will be withheld. The rest of the price of the cruise will be refunded. Find further details in the cancellation policy section.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Discover the natural paradise of the northern Galapagos Islands on this eight-day catamaran cruise to Santa Cruz, Genovesa, Santiago, Isabela and Fernandina Islands.
 Meeting the local wildlife on Isabela Island 
 Sea lion on Fernandina Island 
 Beautiful landscapes of Rabida Island 
 Crab in the Galapagos Islands 
 Cruising around the Galapagos Islands 
 Iguana on the Galapagos Islands 
 Genovesa Island 
 On board the catamaran 
 Galapagos Islands cruise 
 Standard cabin 
 Cabin with bunk beds 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
North Galapagos Islands 8 Day Cruise
Day 1: Baltra & North Seymour Islands
Welcome to the Galapagos Islands! We'll pick you up from the airport on Baltra Island and take you to the south of the island to catch the ferry to the neighbouring Santa Cruz Island. There, we'll embark on a short hike during which we'll hear all about the boats that were shipwrecked here during World War II.
We'll then board the beautiful catamaran that will be our home for the next eight days. We'll enjoy dinner on board before relaxing and sailing to Genovesa Island.
Day 2: Genovesa Island
After anchoring off Genovesa Island, we'll set off on a walking tour along the coast of Great Darwin Bay. Throughout our stroll, we'll discover the incredible local wildlife for which the area is famous. In the afternoon, we'll climb up Prince Phillip's Steps, a steep rocky path that rewards climbers with spectacular views from the top.
At the end of the day, we'll return to the catamaran for dinner and for the onwards cruise to Rabida and Bartolomé Islands.
Day 3: Rabida & Bartolomé Islands
We'll wake up with a view of Rabida Island, and after breakfast we'll head onto dry land to see its reddish volcanic terrain up close. In the afternoon, we'll have the opportunity to snorkel around Bartolomé Island and discover the wealth of marine life in the area.
Back on the boat, we'll enjoy a well-earned dinner and rest. In the evening, we'll set our course for the south of Santa Cruz Island.
Day 4: Santa Cruz Island
Having docked in Puerto Ayora, we'll visit the Charles Darwin Research Station, dedicated to protecting giant turtles. We'll get to meet these incredible creatures and even feed them!
Our day will come to an end back on the catamaran, and we'll continue sailing onwards to Isabela Island, the largest in the Galapagos archipelago.
Day 5: Isabela Island
On the fifth day of our cruise, we'll tour Moreno Point, a coastal area of Isabela Island known for its abundance of wildlife, and particularly for its flamingo colony. You'll easily spot the striking pink of these birds! We'll then head to Elizabeth Bay, where we'll get to snorkel provided the weather conditions are suitable.
We'll spend the evening relaxing on the catamaran as we cruise over to Fernandina Island.
Day 6: Fernandina & Isabela Islands
Disembarking from the boat at Punta Espinosa, we'll discover the large number of giant iguanas which inhabit this part of Fernandina Island. We'll then sail back to Isabela Island and anchor at Punta Vicente Roca, where we'll make the most of the crystal-clear waters to enjoy snorkelling.
We'll then sail onwards to Santiago Island.
Day 7: Santiago Island
We'll head onto Santiago Island at Puerto Egas, exploring on foot to see its rich biodiversity up close. Following the trail to Espumilla Beach, we'll discover the numerous sea turtles that inhabit the area.
In the afternoon, we'll sail over to Bucanero Bay, and you'll then have the rest of the day free to relax on board the catamaran while we cruise to Daphne Mayor Island.
Day 8: Daphne Mayor & Baltra Islands
After admiring the views of tiny volcanic islet of Daphne Mayor from the boat, we'll head to the final stop on our tour: Baltra Island. There, you'll be transferred to the airport, where we'll say goodbye after eight unforgettable days exploring the Galapagos Islands.
Cruise boat
The cruise will take place on a catamaran with a maximum capacity of 14 guests. You'll enjoy full-board accommodation including all breakfasts, lunches and dinners. When making your reservation you'll choose between a standard cabin with double bed or a cabin with a bunk bed. Both options have private bathrooms.
Note on prices
The indicated price is based on two people sharing a double cabin. If you're travelling alone, you'll have to pay an individual supplement.
See more of the Galapagos Islands
If you'd like, you can also book our South Galapagos Islands 8 Day Cruise. If you've got less time to spend on the archipelago, why not book our South Galapagos Islands 4 Day Cruise or North Galapagos Islands 4 Day Cruise.
Cancellation deposit
If you cancel this activity after booking, a deposit of US$ 150 to US$ 250 depending on the season will be withheld. The rest of the price of the cruise will be refunded. Find further details in the cancellation policy section.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.
