Description:
Immerse yourself in the natural paradise of Santa Cruz Island on this unmissable tour: enjoy mountain biking through Cerro Mesa Ecological Reserve and relaxing on the beautiful Garrapatero Beach.
 Garrapatero Beach 
 Exploring Garrapatero Beach 
 Spotting flamingos on Santa Cruz Island 
 
 
 
Cerro Mesa and Garrapatero Bike & Beach Tour
Having been picked up from your hotel in Puerto Ayora, you'll head to the highlands of Santa Cruz Island. Surrounded by lush green trees, you'll climb onto your mountain bike and set off to discover the incredible biodiversity of the Galapagos.
Cruising along the mountain trails on two wheels, you'll delve deep into the Cerro Mesa Ecological Reserve, marvelling at the vibrant plants and flowers and spotting the wildlife as you pedal. Its hilly location at over 1200 feet (390 metres) above sea level means you'll get to enjoy unparalleled views over the islands of the Galapagos archipelago.
After making the most of your mountain biking tour, you'll get back into the car for the journey to Playa de Garrapatero, a virgin beach where you'll find one of the island's largest stretches of sand. Having settled on the beautiful beach, you'll take a well-earned break to enjoy your delicious picnic lunch. Can you imagine anything better than grilled fish with a sea view?
Then, after lunch, you'll have the rest of the afternoon free to explore Garrapatero Beach at your leisure. Discover the various animals native to the region, take part in some water sports (not included), or simply sunbathe on the beach! Not far from the seafront, you'll be able to visit a lagoon where you're likely to see flamingos and ducks in their natural habitat.
Following a full day of nature in one of the most beautiful areas of the Galapagos Islands, you'll make the return journey to Puerto Ayora, where you'll be dropped off at your hotel.
Important information
The mountain biking route is suitable for most people regardless of physical fitness. However, if you'd prefer to do the entire route by car, just tell the guide on the day of the excursion.
Throughout the year, there is usually light rain in this area of Cerro Mesa.
Hotel pick up
This tour includes a pick up and drop off service at around 7:45 am from the main hotels in Puerto Ayora, on Santa Cruz Island: Flamingo, Red Booby, Mainao, Galapagos Suites, Fernandina, Villa Laguna, Isla Sol, SolyMar, Angermeyer and Royal Palm. The local tour provider will contact you to confirm the exact pick up time.
If your hotel is not in the above pick up area, please make your way to the meeting point at Hotel Maidith White Cove (Cucuve and Floreana Streets) for 8 am.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protection and safety, to help avoid the spread of Covid-19. Specifically, the provider of this tour will apply the following measures:
Tours or activities will not consist of more than 10 people per group.
A safe distance of one metre between clients will be maintained whenever possible.
The use of masks is obligatory. Masks will be given to those clients who do not have their own.
Alcohol gel will be available before, during, and after the service.
All those running the service (guide, driver etc...) will wear a mask throughout its duration.
All those running the service (guide, driver etc...) will wear gloves throughout its duration.
Handing out of printed material such as maps or brochures will be avoided.
The temperature and wellness of all those taking part in the service will be monitored daily, excluding and maintaining in quarantine any who display fever or symptoms.
The temperature of all attendees will be taken, and admission will be denied to those with a temperature of more than 37 degrees Celsius (99 Fahrenheit), and a full refund applied.
The transport used will be disinfected before and after each service and deep-cleaned every 24 hours.
The capacity of all means of transport will be reduced to 25% of their maximum capacity.
At monuments, museums and attractions, the maximum permitted capacity will be a 30% of the total maximum capacity.
Showing your voucher on your phone will be enough, and it is not necessary to print anything.

Description:
No trip to Egypt would be complete without a cruise on the Nile, the most memorable experience during a holiday to this beautiful country. This 3 day cruise leaves from Aswan and arrives in Luxor, the ancient capital of Thebes.
 Philae Temple 
 Karnak Temple 
 Hatsepsut Temple 
 Luxor Temple 
 Kom Ombo 
 Edfu Temple 
 Esna Temple 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
3 Night Nile Cruise
Day 1: Aswan
We'll pick you up on the first day at Aswan airport, train station, your hotel, or whichever point you would like. Then we'll take you to the cruise boat, where your full room and board is waiting for you.
Day 2: Aswan – Kom Ombo – Edfu
Having eaten breakfast we'll disembark to visit one of the most beautiful temples in all Egypt, the Philae Temple (this visit may also take place on the first day of the tour, if all guests arrive early). And for anyone who wants to, there is an optional excursion to the temples of Abu Simbel, which comes highly recommended.
Then, back on the boat, we'll eat and begin to sail along the Nile, arriving at the Kom Ombo Temple at sunset, one of the images of Egypt which will stay with you for life. Then having visited the temple, we'll continue sailing towards Edfu, where we'll drop anchor to eat dinner and spend the night.
Day 3: Edfu – Esna – Luxor
Once we've eaten and with batteries fully charged, we'll visit the Edfu Temple, dedicated to the God Horus. The cruise will then continue on its way towards Esna, where we'll cross the famous floodgate.
Having arrived at the majestic city of Luxor (the ancient Thebes, once the capital) we'll visit two of the most spectacular temples in the country, the Luxor and Karnak temples, separated in antiquity by the Avenue of the Sphinxes, three kilometres long. Here we'll eat and spend the night anchored in Luxor.
Day 4: Luxor
Having eaten and checked out, around 6 am we'll hit the road towards the giant necropoles nearby. We'll visit the Valley of the Kings (taking a look inside three of the tombs) the Hatshepsut Temple (dedicated to the only woman to rule over Egypt for an extended period of time) and the Colossi of Memnon (two giant statues in homage to the Pharoah Amenhotep III). The tour then finishes at around 4:30 pm, then we'll take you to the Luxor airport, the train station, or whichever point in the city you would like.
Boats and Categories
There are three different categories of boat to choose from:
5* Standard: MS Jasimn, Royal Esadora, MS Nile Delta, Miss Egypt or similar.
5* Luxury:  Radamiss II, MS Tuya, Princess Saran, Crown Jewel, MS TiYi, MS Jaz C. Jubilee or similar.
5* Superior Luxury: MS Amarco I, Concerto, MS Le Fayan, Blue Shadow, MS Amwaj, Sonesta Nile Goddess, HS Moon Dance, MS Alexander The Great or similar.
The specific boat will be assigned a week before the activity begins.
All of these boats offer comfort and are a good option to make the most of the cruise. If you're looking for a more luxurious option we recommend the two luxury cruises, their rooms, service and food have that extra special touch.
If you book a standard or luxury category, the first day you get to Aswan whenever you want, and the same applies to the superior luxury category if you arrive on a Friday. However, if you have booked a superior luxury category with arrival on a Wednesday, you must be in Aswan before midday, since you will join a tour on that day. 
Important Information
The order of the activities may change depending on the boat, but you'll always enjoy all of the activities indicated in the itinerary. Once on the boat, you can also reserve additional visits not included in the tour, such as the Valley of the Queens, Deir el-Medina or the Unfinished Obelisk.
Cancellation
From 20th December to 2nd January (Christmas), and the 28th of March to the 4th of April 2021 (Easter), refunds will not be available in the event of cancellation.

Description:
Make the most of your time in Egypt visiting its spectacular ancient temples on this five day cruise on Lake Nasser from Aswan.
 Cruising on Lake Nasser 
 The incredible rock temples of Abu Simbel 
 Ruins of the Temple of Kalabsha 
 Temple of Dakka 
 Aswan Dam 
 
 
 
 
 
5 Day Cruise on Lake Nasser
Day 1
These five unforgettable days exploring southern Egypt will begin when you're picked up from your hotel in Aswan at 10 am on the first day. We'll take you to the shores of Lake Nasser, where our cruise ship awaits us. After embarking, settling in and having lunch on the ship, you'll have the rest of the day free to take in the views of the imposing Aswan Dam from the deck.
Day 2
After a hearty breakfast in the ship restaurant, we'll set foot back on dry land, and more specifically on the island on which the Temple of Kalabsha is located. We'll explore the massive complex of archaeological remains, amongst which the Temple of Qertassi stands out as a particular highlight, thought to be dedicated to one of the most enigmatic female deities of Ancient Egypt: the goddess Isis. Following our guided tour of Kalabsha, we'll return to the boat for lunch and continue our journey on Lake Nasser.
Day 3
Today, we'll visit the ruins of Wadi es-Sebua, or the Valley of the Lions, where we'll be exploring the incredible Temples of Dakka and Mahrraqa. History, legends and ancient beliefs merge to form an enchanting mysticism that you're sure to feel as you stroll around the archaeological site. The sacred sites of this area of Nubia give us fascinating insight into the Egyptian deity Thoth, the ancient god of writing, wisdom, music... and spells! After discovering the enigmas of this respected and highly venerated deity of Pharaonic Egypt, we'll return to the cruise ship to eat and relax ready for the rest of our adventure.
Day 4
Our cruise will continue due south on Lake Nasser. From the ship's deck, we'll be able to make out the ancient citadel of Qasr Ibrim and the Temples of Derr and Amada. The latter, whose construction began under the reign of Thutmosis III, is considered to be the oldest in Nubia. In the afternoon, after eating lunch on board the boat, we'll dock next to one of the most emblematic archaeological sites in Egypt: Abu Simbel. The colossal sculptures of Pharaoh Ramesses II and of his queen Nefertari will leave you speechless at their sheer size, and if we look closely, we might even find the answers to many of the mysteries of Ancient Egypt... but maybe not! 
The last evening of our cruise will be spent in a truly memorable way: we'll attend dinner and a light and sound show at Abu Simbel. Illuminations, projections and music will create a unique perspective on the ancient monument. We'll then return to the ship to spend one final night on board, anchored close to the Abu Simbel sculptures.
Day 5
After breakfast on board the cruise ship, we'll leave Lake Nasser behind and make the journey from Abu Simbel to Aswan by road. Once we're in the city, if you'd like, we can drop you off at the airport three hours before the departure of your flight.
What's the cruise ship like?
Our five-day cruise on Lake Nasser will take place aboard the Nubian Sea or a similar boat.
Note on prices
The indicated price per person is based on two people sharing a double cabin. Single travellers must pay an individual supplement, and children over 12 years old must pay as adults.
Important: accommodation in Aswan before the cruise
This five-day cruise on Lake Nasser begins on a Friday, on which day you'll be picked up from your hotel in Aswan at 10 am. We therefore recommend that you spend the night before (Thursday night) in Aswan, so that you are centrally located for pick up for the first day of your cruise. Accommodation in Aswan is not included in the price of the tour. Please bear in mind that if you plan to arrive in Aswan on the Friday, you may not arrive in time and risk missing boarding time for the cruise.
Don't have five days for your cruise?
If you're short on time, why not take a look at our Lake Nasser Four Day Cruise instead?

Description:
A cruise on the Nile is something no traveller to Egypt should miss. You'll feel the power of the river that gave life to the Egyptian empire, from the deck of a traditional felucca boat.
 Elephantine Island from the Nile 
 The Felucca on the Nile 
 Feluccas in Aswan 
 
 
 
Nile Cruise
You'll climb on board the felucca, a traditional Egyptian boat with distinctive birdlike wings, to begin a tranquil hour and a half cruise on the majestic waters of the Nile, one of the longest and most famous rivers in the world. This is the river so intimately linked with the life and livelihoods of the Egyptian people over centuries, the 6,000-kilometre river with its enigmatic source, and symbol of the country that nonetheless crosses 10 different nations on its winding route to the sea. 
Throughout the hour and a half on board, you'll enjoy some of the most emblematic spots on the banks of the Nile: the famous Elephantine, whose shape from above closely resembles that of an elephant, and Kitchener Island, also known as the Aswan Botanical Garden, whose plant species have, throughout the years developed into a green oasis in the middle of the Egyptian desert.
With the route over, and yourselves still well and truly in love with the magic of the Nile, the tour returns to the departure point in Aswan.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protection and safety, to help avoid the spread of Covid-19. Specifically, the provider of this tour will apply the following measures:

Description:
A trip to Egypt would not be complete without a cruise on the Nile, an experience sure to stay with you forever. On this 4 day cruise from Luxor to Aswan we'll visit the most important temples in the country.
 Karnak Temple 
 Hatsepsut Temple 
 Filae Temple 
 Karnak Temple 
 Valley of the Kings 
 Philae Temple 
 River Nile 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Nile Cruise from Luxor to Aswan
Day 1: Luxor
We'll pick you up at the Luxor airport at your arrival time, although we can also pick you up at the train station, at your hotel, or any other place. Then we'll take you to the cruise boat in which we'll sail the Nile, where your full room and board begins.
Day 2: Luxor - Esna - Edfu
Having eaten breakfast we'll disembark to see the majestic city of Luxor, or Thebes to give it its ancient name. Here we'll visit two of the most spectacular temples in Egypt, the Luxor Temple and the Karnak Temple, separated from each other by the Avenue of Sphynxes, a three kilometre long road lined with the aforementioned sphynxes.
Having eaten we'll head to the giant necropolises near to Luxor. We'll visit the Valley of the Kings (seeing the inside of 3 tombs), the Temple of Hatsepsut (dedicated to the only woman to rule Egypt for an extended period) and the Colossi of Memnon (two giant stone statues which represent the Pharoah Amenhotep III).
Then upon our return to the boat we'll sail in the direction of Edfu, where we'll dock to eat and spend the night.
Day 3: Edfu – Kom Ombo – Aswan
Once we've eaten and with batteries recharged, we'll visit the Edfu temple, dedicated to the god Horus. The cruise then continues towards Kom Ombo, where we'll visit its incredible temple, dedicated to the gods Sobek and Hareoris.
After the days tour we'll head up the nile to Aswan, where we'll spend the night.
Day 4: Aswan
Having eaten we'll disembark to visit one of the most beautiful temples in the country, the Philae Temple, dedicated to the Goddess Isis. And after visiting Philae, anyone who wants to can visit the Abu Simbel temples, something highly recommended.  
Then in the evening we'll ride in a traditional felucca boat down the Nile, taking in its flora and fauna, volcanic islands and its natural beauty, later spending the night again in Aswan.
Day 5: Aswan
Having eaten breakfast and checked out you'll have free time, and whenever you like we'll take you to the Aswan airport, train station, or whichever point in the city you would like. If your transfer is in the evening you can also have lunch on board.
Tours Included
Our 4-night cruise from Luxor includes the following tours, all of which are with an English speaking guide.
Luxor Temple, Karnak Temple, Valley of the Kings, Hatshepsut Temple, Colossi of Memnon, Edfu Temple, Philae Temple and the Temple of Kom Ombo and its crocodile museum. You will also enjoy a cruise on a traditional felucca boat.
Additional Cost
If you would like to complete your trip by visiting the Tomb of Nefertari or the Tomb of Seti I, an additional fee of 1,216 Egyptian pounds (approx. €65) per person must be paid.
Boats and Categories
The Nile cruise can be taken on any of three categories:
5* Standard: MS Pioneer, Nile Dolfine, Radamiss II, MS Mirage, MS Nile Delta, Miss Egypt, Beaurivage II, Grand Princess, Voyager, MS Jasmin, Jaz Regency or similar.
5* Luxury: Royal Esadora, MS Tuya, Royal Princess, Crown Jewel, MS TiYi, MS Liberty, MS Renaissance, MS Stéphane, MS Zeina, MS Jaz, C. Jubilee, Jaz Regency or similar
5* Superior Luxury: MS Royal Viking, Alyessa , MS Le Fayan, Blue Shadow, MS Amwaj, Sonesta Nile Goddess, HS Moon Dance, Steigenberger Minerva, Kon Tiki, Jaz Minerva, MS Opera, Al Jamila, MS Tulip, M/S Alyssa, M/S Royal Princess or similar. 
 
Your boat will be assigned one week before the cruise takes place.
Important Information
The order of the activities can change depending on the boat, but all of the activities included will take place. Once on the cruise, you can reserve additional visits not included in the itinerary (Valley of the Queens, Deir el-Medina or the unfinished obelisk)
Cancellation
From 20th December to 2nd January (Christmas), and the 28th of March to the 4th of April 2021 (Easter), refunds will not be available in the event of cancellation.

Description:
This hot air balloon over Luxor means you'll float over the thousand-year-old Luxor temples as the sun rises, allowing you to get a bird's eye view of these majestic remains of the time of the pharaohs. 
 The balloon ready to take off 
 Balloon filling up 
 Mortuary Temple of Hatshepsut from above 
 Valley of the Kings from above 
 A bird's eye view from the balloon 
 Luxor from the balloon 
 The River Nile from the balloon 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Luxor Hot Air Balloon
We'll pick you up from your hotel in Luxor first thing in the morning, under cover of darkness and before the day has truly begun. During the transfer to the launch site, you'll warm up with tea, coffee, and a little bit of breakfast.
With the balloon ready, you'll get comfortable inside the basket and enjoy an unforgettable ride over the temples of Luxor, in time with the rising sun. During the 50 minute flight, you'll appreciate how the sun bathes the ancient remains in both orange and crimson light, and its reflection on the River Nile.
You'll see both the Valley of the Kings and the Valley of the Nobles from above, and even see the Mortuary Temple of Hatshepsut, perhaps the most impressive of all for its massive size and seeming unity with the surrounding landscape. No wonder the temple complex, carved into the rock, has been declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
With the flight over, you'll receive a flight certificate which will accredit you as having experienced this unforgettable morning. And finally, from the landing zone, we'll take you back to your hotel in Luxor.
Advice
We recommend that you reserve your hot air balloon ride as early in your holiday as possible. This way, if there is a cancellation due to adverse weather conditions, you can plan to take the ride on a different day.

Description:
Do you want to try something different? On this cruise down the River Nile you'll be seduced by the best views of Cairo lit up by night, and enjoy a delicious dinner as well as range of traditional entertainment.
 Cairo Illuminated 
 Enjoying dinner on the Nile 
 A buffet dinner on board 
 The Show 
 
 
 
 
Itinerary
We'll pick you up at your hotel and make our way to one of the docks on the banks of the River Nile to embark on our 5 star boat, the Nile Maxim, which has been awarded 'best boat on the nile' on several occasions, or the Nile Pharaohs, in the same category.
Then over a two hour tour you can enjoy the grandeur of Cairo lit up by night, whilst eating a traditional Egyptian meal. The menu consists of a salad buffet and two main dish options, as well as dessert, and includes both Egyptian and international dishes, perfect for all tastes!
Then, to make the evening even more special, comes the show, which includes belly dancing, whirling dervishes, folk dancing and live music.
Then with the cruise over, we'll take you back to your hotel.

Description:
Tour the magical Egyptian desert by quad bike, and an unforgettable experience with a Bedouin dinner in their ancestral home the cherry on the cake.
 Desert quad bike tour 
 Enjoying the camel ride 
 The bedouin village near Hurghada 
 
 
 
Itinerary
Around 1 pm we'll pick you up at your hotel to pick you up and begin our quad tour around the majestic Egyptian desert.
On our quad tour, we'll explore the arid landscape outside Hurghada, stopping as the sun sets to appreciate the Egyptian sunset glinting off the sands of the desert. 
Our route then continues, but having stopped once more we change four wheels for four hooves, cruising the dunes on the backs of the most iconic animals in the Egyptian desert with a ride on camelback.
On our desert tour, we'll make one last stop in a Bedouin village. Here you'll learn about the culture and life of these legendary nomadic peoples, and eat an authentic Bedouin dinner, made up of rice, bread, potatoes, tahini and kofta. These last two are made with sesame seeds and minced meat respectively, and are staple foods of the Bedouin people.
With dinner over, we'll return to our quad bikes to make the return journey, arriving back at the hotels of Hurghada around 7 pm.
Important Information
This activity is not recommended for pregnant women.
Each quad bike has a maximum capacity of two people.

Description:
See the wonders of the submarine depths on this glass-bottomed boat tour, sailing the waters of the Red Sea.
 Glass bottomed boat tour 
 The Submarine depths of Hurghada 
 
 
Glass Bottomed Boat Tour
We'll pick you up from your hotel at the arranged time, and make our way by bus to the Hurghada New Marina.
Here we'll embark on our boat with its transparent bottom, whose panoramic windows allow us to see all the marine life which calls the east coast of Egypt its home, as we sail the waters of the Red Sea.
If you're lucky, we might see animals such as Dolphins, who at times can be seen to swim alongside the sightseeing boats. And this part of the Middle East has a large variety of species, giving the Red Sea a feel and thrill distinct from seas around the rest of the world.
Then having made the most of the stunning marine life which lives below the waves, we'll begin the return journey along the coasts of Hurghada, returning finally to the hotels.

Description:
Fancy a dip in the warm waters of the Red Sea? Try snorkelling off the wild island of Tiran, and enjoy a unique experience in an Egyptian diving paradise.
 Tiran Island 
 Snorkelling off Tiran Island 
 
 
Itinerary
We'll pick you up from your hotel in Sharm El Sheikh at around 8:15 am, making our way to the port area.
Then we'll climb on board a boat, and make our way in the direction of Tiran island, where we'll arrive after approximately an hour. Its turquoise and crystal clear waters make this one of the best places in the world to try diving.
The island is uninhabited, meaning we'll be able to enjoy its magnificent virgin beaches to try our hand at snorkelling. But you won't be alone: any number of multicolour fish species will accompany you beneath the waves.
Having enjoyed the natural beauty of the island, we'll have lunch on board, consisting of salads, fish, rice and kofta, a typical Middle Eastern dish made with minced meat.
The boat will then head back to the Sharm El Sheikh port, from where we'll return to your hotel around 4:15 pm.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protection and safety, to help avoid the spread of Covid-19. Specifically, the provider of this tour will apply the following measures:
Tours or activities will not consist of more than 10 people per group.

Description:
Discover Estonia's capital city with this Tallinn Free Walking Tour. The beautiful medieval location boasts a combination of historic architecture and rich culture.
 Tallinn old town 
 Medieval towers in the city 
 Tallinn's traditional buildings 
 St. Nicholas Church 
 Enjoying the free tour of Tallinn 
 Visit the city centre 
 Wandering past Toompea castle 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Tallinn Free Walking Tour
We'll meet at 11 am on Niguliste Street. From this central point in Tallinn, we'll start the walk through one of the best preserved Baltic medieval towns.
The heart of the centre is the Old Town Square. Here, we'll stop in front of the Raeapteek, the oldest pharmacy in Europe. We'll continue the free tour next to the St. Nicholas church, dedicated to the patron saint of fishermen and sailors. Following on, we'll admire another of the city's great religious monuments, the Alexander Nevsky Cathedral.
Nearby is the Toompea Castle, one of the monumental symbols of the Estonian capital. While we walk around the outside of the castle we'll learn about its origin. The bastion has witnessed countless anecdotes and curiosities ranging from the Middle Ages to the Soviet period, through many other stages.
The Tallinn towers are another symbolic part of the city, have guarded the city for centuries and acting as an impressive viewpoint for the city.
At 1 pm, the free tour will conclude at the starting point.
Groups
On this Tallinn Free Walking Tour, reservations for more than 8 people are not available. If you would like to see the Estonian capital in a group exclusively for you and your partner, family or friends, you can contact us. 
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protection and safety, to help avoid the spread of Covid-19. Specifically, the provider of this tour will apply the following measures:
Tours or activities will not consist of more than 25 people per group.
A safe distance of one metre between clients will be maintained whenever possible.
The use of masks is obligatory. The client must bring their own mask.
Alcohol gel will be available before, during, and after the service.
Handing out of printed material such as maps or brochures will be avoided.
Alcoholic drinks are not available.

Description:
The City Sightseeing Bus in Tallinn is the perfect way to explore all the main places of interest in the capital city of Estonia. Plus, you can hop-on and hop-off as much as you want to explore the city at your own pace.
 Sightseeing bus in Tallinn 
 Old town of Tallinn 
 Toompea Castle 
 TV tower in Tallinn 
 
 
 
 
Tallinn Sightseeing Bus
The sightseeing bus in Tallinn has 3 different routes with 38 stops in the most incredible places in the city.
Red line: explore the historic centre and old town, with stops at the Russalka Monument and Toompea Castle.
Green line: this route connects the highest part of Tallinn with the city's port and has stops in emblematic places such as Maarjamäe Castle and the Botanic Garden.
Blue line: perfect if you want to discover the city's main areas of entertainment, such as the zoo, the Open Air Museum and the Rocca al Mare Shopping Centre.
You can check the different routes and stops ​here.
All the buses are equipped with an audio-guide in English, so you can become true experts about the city.
How Does It Work?
The ticket is valid for 1 or 3 consecutive days after being used for the first time. During this time you can hop-on and hop-off the buses as much as you wish.
Although when you book you'll be asked to select a start day, you can start using the service within 3 months from the selected date.
After you book we will send you a voucher via email which you must hand in on the first bus that you take.
Times and Frequencies
The sightseeing bus in Tallinn runs every day every 30-60 minutes.
Red line: runs every day from 10:30 am to 3:50 pm. On Saturdays from June to August, it runs until 5 pm. The complete route, with no stops, takes 50 minutes.
Green line: runs every day from 11 am to 2:15 pm. From June to August it runs until 4:30 pm. The complete route, with no stops, takes 75 minutes.
Blue line: runs every day from 12:05 to 3:30 pm. On Saturdays from June to August, it runs until 5 pm. The complete route, with no stops, takes one hour.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Fancy enjoying a myriad of water activities in Fiji? This cruise from Pacific Harbour to Yanuca Island is all you need. Sunbathe, go for a swim, snorkel, paddleboard and much more. 
 Enjoying paddleboarding 
 Snorkelling on Yunaca Island 
 Exploring the underwater world in Fiji 
 
 
 
Yunaca Island Cruise
After meeting at The Pearl Resort in Pacific Harbour at 8:30 am we'll head to the pier. At 9 am we'll board the catamaran and set sail for Yanuca Island, a fun-filled day is in store for us!
When we arrive at our destination, you'll have a wide range of activities to choose from, all included! If you're passionate about nature, you're sure to enjoy snorkelling in the Pacific Ocean, where you'll marvel at the magnificent underwater reefs. Or do you prefer a little more adventure? Kayaks, paddleboards and surfboards are waiting for you to take them out for a ride. 
If you prefer a more relaxing plan, you can unwind sunbathing in a hammock. Close your eyes, and listen to the sound of the sea... what more could you need?
And that's not all. The boat crew will treat you to a full-course meal, which will include freshly-harvested coconuts from the palm trees of Yanuca Island. You'll also attend a Kava ceremony to learn a little more about traditional life in Fiji. You'll learn all about this ancient ritual and will even get the chance to taste the kava, the drink that comes from this ceremony.
At the end of the trip, we'll sail back to Pacific Harbour. Arrival back at the starting point is scheduled for 4 pm. 
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Get a great introduction to the history and culture of the Finnish capital, discovering Helsinki's most important monuments and districts on this guided English-language tour. What's more, it's FREE!
 Senate Square 
 Helsinki's Market Square 
 Uspenski Cathedral 
 Upsenski Eastern Orthodox Cathedral, Helsinki 
 
 
 
 
Free Walking Tour of Helsinki
Begin your guided walking tour of Helsinki at the steps to the imposing Neoclassical Cathedral. Located in the central Senate Square, the distinctive green-domed church overlooks the Government Palace, home to Finland's Prime Minister's office and other state departments.
Your free walking tour will continue to the Bank of Finland, before you reach one of Helsinki's most beautiful landmarks: the Uspenski Cathedral. Admire the striking contrasts between this dramatic red-brick Eastern Orthodox church with the white Lutheran Helsinki Cathedral you saw earlier. It is said to be one of the largest Orthodox churches in Western Europe.
After exploring the iconic religious site, continue your route to Market Square, a hub of activity in the daily lives of the Finnish capital's inhabitants. Learn all about their customs and traditions, as well as Helsinki's history, as you admire the different monuments of "The White City of the North".
Important information
It is not possible to reserve this free walking tour if you're a group of more than 6 people.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Visit the coastal city of Porvoo from Helsinki and discover one of the oldest cities in Finland. This tour will show you authentic Finland!
 Typical red houses of Porvoo 
 Historical centre of Porvoo 
 Lutheran Cathedral of Porvoo 
 
 
 
Porvoo Walking Tour from Helsinki
We will meet at the indicated time at Esplanadi Park, where a bus will be waiting to take us to the coastal city of Porvoo, connected to Gulf of Finland via the river Porvoo. Our journey will take you into the heart of this ancient city, famous for its red colored riverside houses. 
Once we arrive at this idyllic city, we will begin our walking tour where you will learn all about the history of this town which has been the inspiration for so many Finnish artists.
We head back to a different era, discovering the tranquil cobbled streets crammed with wooden houses dating back to the middle ages. You will also see the pretty town square and Porvoo’s Cathedral where you will hear about its shocking history. Did you know that this Basilica has survived five fires?
After having toured these streets, you will have free time to try the local gastronomy, take a rest in a café, or continue exploring Porvoo by yourself.
Finally, we return to Helsinki on the bus.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Discover the attractions of Finland’s beautiful capital on this sightseeing bus tour of Helsinki. Your 24-hour ticket will allow you to hop on and off the bus as many times as you want for an entire day.
 Helsinki Cathedral, the Evangelical Lutheran Church of Finland 
 Uspenski Cathedral, Helsinki 
 Seeing the sights of Helsinki 
 Helsinki tourist bus 
 
 
 
 
Helsinki Tourist Bus Route and Stops
The Helsinki tourist bus follows a route of 22 stops at the most important locations around the historic city centre of the capital of Finland.
From the open top bus, you will have prime views of the city’s best locations such as Senate Square, the Lutheran Cathedral, and the Uspenski Cathedral. Your bus pass will also give you different discounts on various attractions around Helsinki. You can consult the map of all the bus stops on the route, and all the discounts included with the ticket, via the following link: 
Map and discounts of the sightseeing bus of Helsinki
On board the bus you will have access to an English language audio guide, which will tell you all about the locations you are observing along the journey.
How does it work?
When you board the bus for the first time, at any of the designated stops, your ticket will be activated. From this moment, you will have 24 consecutive hours to hop on and off the bus as many times as you want.
Times and frequency
The Helsinki tourist bus runs at the following times:
May to September: daily departures every 20 minutes between 9:40 am and 4 pm.
April and October: Saturdays and Sundays at 10:15 am , 10:45 am, 11:30 am, 12:15 pm, 12:45 pm, 1:30 pm, 2:15 pm, 2:45 pm and 3:30 pm.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Sail around some of the Helsinki’s islands and discover the city from the water. This one hour and a half cruise along the Baltic sea will help you to explore Helsinki in a unique way.
 Helsinki Market Square 
 Suomenlinna Sea Fortress 
 
 
Itinerary
We will board the boat at the Market Square in the city center, before heading out onto the Baltic sea to sail around just some of the more 300 islands which make up Helsinki.
You will see Korkeasaari island, home to the largest zoo in the Finish capital, and the islands of Kulosaari and Vartiosaari.
We will pass the incredible maritime fort of Suomenlinna, which began construction in 1748 across six islands, and which served as a form of protection against Russian invasion.
After a cruise of about an hour and a half, we will return to the harbor next to Market Square.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Explore downtown Helsinki when you take our fantastic panoramic bus tour. You will discover the most iconic cathedrals, parks, and monuments of the captivating Finnish capital. 
 The Lutheran Catherdral of Helsinki 
 Uspenski Cathedral 
 Temppeliaukio Church 
 The panoramic bus tour of Helsinki 
 
 
 
 
Helsinki Sightseeing Bus
We board the Helsinki Panoramic Bus Tour at the pretty Esplanadi Park. Onboard, you will enjoy English language audio commentary telling you all about the fascinating history of the city. 
We will visit the historic city center, first passing through the central Senate Square, where you will see the Government Palace and the iconic Lutheran Cathedral. We will also pass the principle eastern orthodox church in Finland: Uspenski Cathedral.
Our tour continues, passing the idyllic Kaivopuisto park, before we head to the west of the capital where we encounter the magnificent Temppeliaukio church. Known as the 'Church of the Rock', this shrine was built directly into the surface of the land.
Our panoramic bus tour through Helsinki ends by returning again to Esplanadi Park.
Important information
If on the day of your tour the Temppeliaukio church is closed, we will visit the Sibelius Monument instead. This is located in the park of the same name and was built in homage to the Finnish composer Jean Sibelius.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
They say that seeing the Northern Lights is something you will remember all your life. Make the most of your trip to Finland and enjoy this unique experience with this tour from Levi. 
 Aurora Boreal in Levi 
 Enjoying the Aurora Boreal 
 During the Northern Lights tour 
 Colourful show of lights 
 Views of Levi during the Aurora Boreal 
 Arriving at the woods in Levi 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Northern Lights Car Tour
At 9 pm we'll meet at the tourist information centre in Levi and get on a minibus to start the search for the northern lights. As we move away from the city centre, we'll explain what this natural phenomenon is and hopefully catch a glimpse of what everyone dreams of seeing at least once in their lifetime. 
The darkness of the Finnish night will be our ally to enjoy this show of light and colour. In the areas chosen for the sighting, you'll have the opportunity to enjoy the Northern Lights, also known as "Aurora Boreal". It is a moment that will remain in your memory forever!
While you enjoy this magical natural phenomenon, the guide will take photos of you with the Northern Lights dancing above you. It'll be a unique souvenir to take home and to remember this enchanting experience by. 
After having enjoyed the Northern Lights, we'll get on the minibus again and return to the starting point in the centre of Levi, arriving at 11 pm. 
Northern Lights
Because it's a natural phenomenon, it's impossible to guarantee that we'll be able to see the northern lights, although we'll do our best.

Description:
Did you know that extreme cold and heat are very beneficial to your body? It's been a Nordic custom for centuries. Discover it with this Lake Jeris Sauna & Ice Swimming Experience - a unique experience!
 Levi's Artic World sauna 
 The Jeris Ice Lake 
 Levi's snowy landscapes 
 Sauna facilities 
 Levi's Sauna Room 
 Typical Finnish sauna 
 Jeris ice lake at sunset 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Lake Jeris Sauna & Ice Swimming Experience
At 5 pm we'll pick you up at the Levi information centre and go by minibus to the Pallas-Ylläs National Park, where the Arctic Sauna World complex is located. After 30 minutes we'll reach our destination, a sauna in the purest Finnish style.
After explaining to you what this historic Nordic tradition is all about, it's time for you to experience its benefits for yourself. The Artic World sauna is located on the shores of Lake Jeris and is divided into four thermal areas, each dedicated to an element of nature. Thanks to the carefully designed interior, you can also discover touches of Finnish mythology.
Once your body has warmed up and you're completely relaxed, the most daring of you'll have the opportunity to prove your worth with one of the most unique customs in Finland, swimming in the ice!
Just a few metres from the sauna is the Jeris ice lake, perfect for diving into its icy waters at 0°C. Did you know that exposure to heat and cold is very beneficial to the immune system? You'll find out!
At the end of the bath and with the body completely renewed, we'll head back to Levi, arriving at 8 pm.

Description:
Go on an electric bike tour through the Pyhä Luosto National Park and discover Lappish landscapes as you pedal past snow-capped Taiga trees.
 Pedalling around the park 
 Pyhä-Luosto National Park tour 
 Riding electric bikes around the park 
 Enjoying the snow 
 Pyhä-Luosto National Park 
 Snowy landscapes 
 Admiring the landscapes 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Pyhä-Luosto National Park Electric Bike Tour
We'll meet at the time of your choice at the Pyhätunturi Hotel and start off by receiving an introduction from the guide on how to ride the bikes in the snow. 
Then we'll delve into the Pyhä-Luosto National Park and cycle along its trails. As we explore this winter wonderland we'll learn all about its history and discover Finnish plants and wildlife. We'll pedal through snow-covered Taiga trees and admire magnificent snowy landscapes. 
After a two and a half-hour ride, we'll head back to the starting point.  
Important Information
You can also book the Pyhä-Lu National Park Electric Bike Tour from Luosto.

Description:
On this bike ride to the Pyhä-Luosto National Park, you'll cycle through a snow-covered Taiga forest and discover a winter wonderland.
 Cycling around the Pyhä-Luosto National Park 
 Discovering the Pyhä-Luosto National Park 
 Bike ride in the Pyhä-Luosto National Park 
 Cycling through the snow 
 Enjoying the winter landscapes 
 Touring the Pyhä-Luosto National Park 
 Enjoying the tour 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Pyhä-Luosto National Park Bike Tour
We'll meet at the time of your choice at the Pyhätunturi Hotel and start off by receiving safety instructions from the guide on how to ride the bikes in the snow. 
We'll cycle into the heart of Pyhä-Luosto National Park to admire the gleaming white Lappish landscapes. As we pedal along its trails we'll get lost in the images of snow-covered branches and the fascinating Finnish flora. And when we start to feel the cold of this winter wonderland, we'll enjoy a hot drink to warm up!
After two and a half hours, we'll head back to the starting point to end the tour.
Important Information
You can also book the Pyhä-Lu National Park Bike Tour from Luosto.
If you prefer, you can also book this tour with an electric bike.

Description:
Join us on a fantastic trip to the Lampivaara amethyst mine onboard an electric bike. You will search for your own gemstones and enjoy the winter landscape of Luosto.
 Amethyst 
 The Lampivaara mine 
 The Amethyst Mine at Lampivaara 
 The landscapes seen from the mine 
 A precious stone 
 The electric bike 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Amethyst Mine Electric Bike Tour
We will meet up at the scheduled time at the Amethys store in Luosto where you will receive all the necessary equipment to do the activity. For the three-hour trip, you will ride a brilliant electric bicycle through the idyllic snowy landscapes.
We set off and head to the fascinating Lampivaara amethyst mine, one of Lapland's most iconic landmarks. The stunning location is worth the effort in itself. You'll enjoy unforgettable views from the top of the mountain!
While admiring the spectacular landscapes of Pyhä-Luosto National Park, we will regain our strength sipping a tasty hot drink next to a warm fire. Then it's time to leave the electric bikes behind and head into the Lampivaara mine. There we'll discover the most famous gemstone in Lapland: the amethyst. This beautiful, precious stone is a violet-colored type of quartz.
Part of the route through the mine will take us to the excavation area. You will even have the opportunity to dig for amethysts yourself and take home a precious souvenir of your visit.
Finally, we get back on the bikes and return to the original departing point.

Description:
Make the most of your stay in the Southern French city with this free walking tour of Aix-en-Provence. You'll explore the rich culture, peaceful streets and beautiful terraces.
 Paul Cézanne statue 
 Saint-Sauveur Cathedral 
 La Rotonde Fountain 
 
 
 
Aix-En-Provence Free Walking Tour 
Discover the beautiful town of Aix-en-Provence noted for its artistic culture and elegance. After meeting at 4 pm in Place de la Rotonde, in front of the statue of Cézanne, we'll begin wandering through the narrow picturesque streets and admiring the beautiful fountains and squares of the city.
Our first stop will be Cours Mirabeau, a square filled with fountains and 19th century mansions where we'll find the Café Les Deux Garçons, a popular meeting place of the 18th century bourgeoise. We'll then continue onwards to visit the Church of St John of Malta, famous during the Crusades, and the Fountain of the Four Dolphins.
Afterwards, we'll stop to discover the ancient ruins of the Roman city of Aquae Sextiae and La Place des Prêcheurs, the centre of city life in Medieval Aix-en-Provence.
As we explore the beautiful streets on our free walking tour, our guide will tell us all about its history, including what happened in the city during World War II. We'll make a stop to admire the 17th century City Hall before ending the tour in front of the impressive Aix Cathedral at around 6 pm.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Have a unique experience in the Arctic! On this tour you'll learn how to start a fire in the cold and you'll ice fish like a true local. 
 Ice fishing in Rovaniemi 
 Drilling a hole in the snow 
 A fish on the line 
 Ice fishing tricks 
 Ice fishing 
 
 
 
 
 
Rovaniemi Ice Fishing Itinerary
We'll come and pick you up from your hotel at the selected time and head to one of the prettiest areas in the Arctic circle. During the approximately half an hour journey we'll enjoy the snowy scenery and fir tree forests of northern Rovaniemi. The natural beauty of the world's coldest city will leave you lost for words!
Having found the perfect spot on the lake, we'll dig a hole in the ice and wait for a fish to bite onto the hook. During the winter months, the layer of ice in northern Rovaniemi can reach a depth of up to one metre. Our guide will tell you all about the technique and tricks needed to fish in the Arctic ice. All you need to worry about is being patient and enjoying the unique surroundings.
The guide will then head to find some wood to prepare a lakeside bonfire, and you'll learn how to start a fire; a complicated task in the frozen forests of Lapland! When the fire's lit we'll cook our catches and enjoy the warmth. What a treat!
Throughout the tour not only will we enjoy unique, magnificent landscapes, but we'll also go home with some incredible photos of us ice fishing in Lapland as well as a cultural insight into the local lifestyle! Having been christened as expert fishermen in some of the most difficult conditions around, we'll take you back to your hotel in Rovaniemi.

Description:
Relax on board a floating Finnish sauna as you cruise on a lake in Rovaniemi surrounded by the spectacular landscapes of Lapland. An unforgettable experience!
 Enjoying the floating sauna in Rovaniemi 
 Inside the sauna boat 
 Cruising on the floating sauna boat 
 Finnish sauna boat 
 
 
 
 
Sauna Boat River Cruise: what to expect?
Having been picked up from your hotel in Rovaniemi at the scheduled time, you'll be taken deep into the mysterious forests that surround Lapland's capital ready for a unique experience that you'll never forget. What will it be? We'll reveal all below!
Arriving at the side of a lake, you'll see typical Finnish saunas, but with a twist: they're floating! Constructed in summer 2012, these curious structures were designed to bring a new concept to the traditional bathing ritual. Intrigued? Climb on board to see how it works!
You'll cruise on the lake on your sauna-boat, which is equipped with a traditional wood cabin in which you'll be able to relax and unwind in the heat. There are also benches on the boat deck for you to sunbathe and take in the beautiful views, or - depending what time you choose to do your activity - admire the incredible phenomenon of the midnight sun!
Hopefully you've worked up an appetite, because you'll also be treated to a barbeque of sausages and corn, accompanied by salad, served on board the floating sauna boat. A truly unparalleled experience!
At the end of your special cruise on the lakes of Finland, you'll be taken back to Rovaniemi and dropped off at your hotel.
What will I need?
You'll need to bring a swimsuit for this floating sauna experience, however, if you need to, you can hire a swimming costume at the sauna for €15.00.
Can children participate?
Children under 14 years old must always be accompanied by an adult.
Hotel pick up
After making your reservation, you'll be contacted by the local provider to confirm your exact pick up time. Hotel pick up is included from accommodation located within a 6 mile (10 km) radius of Rovaniemi city centre.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protection and safety, to help avoid the spread of Covid-19. Specifically, the provider of this tour will apply the following measures:
Tours or activities will not consist of more than 8 people per group.
Alcohol gel will be available before, during, and after the service.
All those running the service (guide, driver etc...) will wear a mask throughout its duration.
Handing out of printed material such as maps or brochures will be avoided.
The temperature and wellness of all those taking part in the service will be monitored daily, excluding and maintaining in quarantine any who display fever or symptoms.
The transport used will be disinfected before and after each service and deep-cleaned every 24 hours.
Showing your voucher on your phone will be enough, and it is not necessary to print anything.
Alcoholic drinks are not available.

Description:
Do you want a full polar experience? On this tour we'll glide through the forests of Rovaniemi on a snowmobile and go ice fishing on the frozen lake. 
 Snowmobiles in 
 Snowy forest in Rovaniemi 
 Ice fishing 
 Waiting for the fish to bite the bait 
 Arriving at the lake on the snowmobiles 
 Enjoying the snowy landscape on snowmobiles 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Snowmobile Ride & Ice Fishing
Enjoy the landscapes of Lapland on this incredible tour. We'll pick you up from your hotel in Rovaniemi at the selected time and set off for its snow-covered forests.
We'll hop on a snowmobile to begin this polar adventure and zoom across the snowy landscapes that are so characteristic of this stunning part of the planet! We'll make a couple of stops along the way to enjoy the peacefulness of the environment. After an hour and a half, we'll pull up at a magnificent frozen lake.  
Time to go fishing! The guide will show us how to prepare our rods and make a hole in the ice. Now all you need is a bit of luck and patience! Will they take the bait?
And for a real Lappish experience, we'll start a fire and sit around it to enjoy a hot drink and grilled sausages. After this adventurous day, we'll return to Rovaniemi and drop you off at your hotels.
Pick up 
Pick up is from hotels located within 5 miles (8 km) of the centre of Rovaniemi. If your hotel is further away we'll contact you to propose an alternative meeting point.

Description:
Do you want to try some of the most fun and iconic activities in Lapland? Join this snowshoe hike and learn how to ice fish in Rovaniemi.
 Enjoying ice fishing 
 Fishing 
 Snowshoeing in Rovaniemi 
 Lighting a fire 
 Ice fishing lesson

Showshoeing & Ice Fishing
We'll pick you up in a minibus from your hotel in Rovaniemi at 10 am and head to the forests of Lapland.
Once we arrive at our destination, we'll set off on a snowshoe hike. We'll walk among snowy pines and firs to discover beautiful white landscapes. 
The trail will lead us to a frozen lake where we'll have a short lesson on main ice fishing techniques. We'll learn how to make a hole in the ice and cast the rod. All that's left is to wait for the fish to take the bait!
During the fishing activity, the guide will light a fire so we can cook some delicious sausages and the catch of the day. 
Afterwards, we'll head back to Rovaniemi and drop you off at your hotel at 2 pm.

Description:
Cross the Finnish border and travel to Sweden for an unforgettable experience. You'll sail the Bothnian Sea on an ice-breaker ship and even get to float in the icy waters!
 Icebreaker ship moored 
 Enjoying the floating experience 
 Icebreaker ship 
 The captain 
 The incredible icebreaker ship 
 Walking on the ice 
 Inside the ship 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Icebreaker Cruise 
Three and a half hours before the ship sails, we'll pick you up from the meeting point of your choice. Then we'll leave Rovaniemi behind us and set off on a bus journey to the Swedish town of Båtskärsnäs, where the icebreaker ship will be waiting for us. 
We'll climb on board and listen to our English audio guide as we explore the different rooms such as the engine room and the captain's bridge. We'll also get to watch a short informative video about icebreakers all over the world.
During the cruise, you can relax inside with a hot drink or go for a walk on the frozen sea when we stop. The icebreaker will break through the ice to make an area where we can take a dip in the icy water in a special flotation suit.
After the experience, we'll sail back to the dock and then drive to your hotels.
Pick up
The tour includes pick up from the following locations: Arctic Treehouse Hotel, Santa Claus Holiday Village, Santa Claus Hotel and Rovaniemi Train Station. When you book, you'll need to let us know where you want to be picked up from.

Description:
Climb on board in Ajaccio for a trip to the Scandola nature reserve, a breath-taking area of unparalleled landscapes. On this trip, you will also sail around the Gulf of Girolata and encounter the rock formations of Piana.
 Gulf of Girolata 
 Nature reserve in Scandola 
 Beach at the Gulf of Girolata 
 The Calanques of Piana 
 
 
 
 
Itinerary
Early in the morning, the boat will set off on our glorious trip along the western coast of Corsica island.
Along the maritime trip, you will enjoy impressive views of the strange rock formations that this coastline is famous for. This corner of the island is also a sanctuary for a large variety of birds, such as the peregrine falcon and the osprey.
The boat will reach the peninsula of Scandola, a land and marine nature reserve which was declared a UNESCO World Heritage site in 1983. This area is formed by volcanic rock which rises up from the sea in extraordinary shapes and colours. You will cruise beneath the grottos that have been shaped from millennia of wind and sea erosion. The sight of the striking red and yellow tones contrasting against the deep blue Mediterranean will only leave you awestruck.
The boat continues its journey to the Gulf of Girolta, a beautiful setting featuring the 18th century Genovese tower which dominates the fishing village of Girolta. We will make a two hour stop for you to explore the tiny picturesque streets and have some delicious local food in one of the restaurants.
On the return journey, you will pass the pretty coves of Piana and gorgeous Cape Rosso which, like Scandola, forms parts of an area of amazing volcanic landscapes.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Sail to the formidable medieval cliff-top city of Bonifacio with our tour. Visit magical caves and the wonderful King of Aragon Steps on this fairy tale island.
 Bonifacio 
 The Centre of Bonifacio 
 Sailing through San Antonio Cave 
 
 
 
Bonifacio Boat Trip
After boarding early in the morning at the port of Ajaccio, we will start our delightful trip along the coast of Corsica towards the south of the island. Along the way, you will see a variety of amazing natural wonders. One of them will be the “Lion of Roccapino”, a rock formation that appears to be keeping watch over the Mediterranean Sea.
As the boat approaches the city of Bonifacio, you will find yourself in front of the formidable limestone island cliffs and the famous rock formation known as ‘the grain of sand’. You will also encounter the magnificent San Antonio cave which is only accessible from the ocean.
Once you are in the luxury port of Bonifacio, you will have 4 hours of your own free time to tour this pretty medieval city. It was founded in 833 by the margrave of Tuscany and occupied by the Genoese in 1195. During this time, you can visit the amazing King of Aragon’s Stairway and stroll through picturesque streets.
You will also have the chance to eat in a restaurant in the city center. Finally, we will return to Ajaccio around 6:30 pm.
Important Information
The train which takes you to the citadel and back to the outskirts of the city leaves every 30 minutes.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Music and wine under the glorious Mediterranean setting sun. Let yourself be seduced by the incredible sight of the Sanguinaires Islands at sunset when you take this cruise. The reason this is such a magical place will all become clear when you witness it in the last glowing embers of daylight.
 Sunset over the Sanguinarias Islands 
 Wine tasting 
 Live music 
 
 
 
Sunset boat cruise
With this boat tour around the Gulf of Ajaccio, you will fall in love with this enchanted part of Corsica tinged in the warm red tones of dusk.
During the trip, you will enjoy a tasting of typical wines from this area of France. You will also be treated to a large choice of delicious Corsican dishes, while accompanied by the rhythms of the live band of local musicians.
If the Sanguinaires Islands are famous for anything, it is the warm reddish hue that is cast over the rocks as the night falls.
Get your camera ready because you will want to capture this glorious scene a thousand times. The magnificent natural light that occurs at this time of the day is simply not to be missed!

Description:
No trip to Corsica is complete without visiting the beautiful Sanguinaires Islands. With this cruise, you will sail along the coast from Ajaccio and be mesmerized by the famous red tones of the rocks.
 The Tower of Parata 
 Cruise of the Sanguinarias Islands 
 Ajaccio port at sunset 
 
 
 
Sanguinaires Islands Boat Cruise
The tour leaves from Ajaccio at midday, heading out towards the famous Sanguinaires Islands. The route will take us west along the Corsican coast, passing the house of Tino Rossi, the celebrated French actor and singer who was born in this region. The port of Corsica’s capital was named after him in honor of his life and work.
On this route, you will also encounter the ‘Chapel of the Greeks’, constructed by refugees in the Greek settlement of Paomia in the 18th century before they relocated to the north of the island.
Then we arrive at the Sanguinaires Islands, the main attraction on this cruise. From the boat, you will see the iconic tower of Parata. This Genoese turret was created in 1608, dominating the area from its high vantage point. You will understand where these islands get their name when you see the astonishing rocks that seem to bleed reddish tones. This is due to the jasper rock which prevails in this region.
Then, we will make a stop on the main island of Mezumare for 1 hour so you can take a swim, or walk to the Alphonse Duadet lighthouse at the summit. In Mezumare, also known as the ‘Grand Sanguinaire’ you can also explore the ruins of a ‘lazarreto’, an isolated islet which was used as a quarantine station for fishermen and sailors, but which is now home to curious birds.
At approximately 5:05 pm, we will return to the port of Ajaccio where the trip finishes.
Important information
If you want, you can reserve the boat trip of the Sanguinaires Islands from Porticcio.

Description:
When you take this private boat trip you will enjoy the best views of the Côte d'Azur from an exclusive vantage point from the water. This brilliant experience is just for you and your family or friends.
 The private boat of Beaulieu-sur-Mer 
 Enjoying the boat trip 
 Villa Kerylos 
 Ephrussi Rothschild 
 Views from the boat 
 Sailing along the Cote d'Azur 
 
 
 
 
 
 
What to expect
We will meet at the port of Beaulieu-sur-Mer at the time of your choosing, before starting a one-hour trip on an ecological boat along the Côte d'Azur, France's Riviera.
During the crossing, we will pass numerous luxury houses and hotels of the Saint-Jean-Cap-Ferrat peninsula. We will see the famous Villa Kerylos, listed as a National Historic Monument, and the Villa Ephrussi de Rothschild, which is known for its extensive gardens. The captain of the boat will even show you how to pilot the boat if you want.
On the way back to port, we will see the picturesque village of Eze and also Monaco and the coast of Italy in the distance. Our brilliant boat trip finishes back at the original departure point.

All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Discover the iconic monuments of the most western city of France with this fantastic guided tour of Brest.
 Brest Castle 
 The Commandant-Malbert wharf 
 Albert Louppe bridge 
 Brest 
 The tram of Brest 
 The port of Brest 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Walking Tour of Brest
We will meet up at Liberty Square at 10 am to begin our fantastic guided tour of Brest. Get ready to learn about 17 centuries of fascinating history!
We will start walking around the most western city of France. You will quickly realize that this town is very different from the typical French city. During two hours and accompanied by a professional guide, you will learn about important moments that were experienced in these streets, such as the bombings during World War II.
The resistance of the inhabitants of Brest has been an example to the world. This is reflected in some of the places that we will visit, such as the vibrant quay of the Commandant-Malbert, the Albert Louppe bridge, or the Castle, the oldest monument of the city.
We will cross the Penfeld River and admire the Capuchin Workshops, 19th-century buildings used for shipbuilding, which have become an essential cultural and commercial center for the current citizens of the city.
We will finish the tour in the Capuchin neighborhood at 12 pm.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Beautiful architecture, fascinating history and one of the world's most famous wine regions: discover the best of Bordeaux on this guided walking tour. What's more, it's FREE!
 Place de la Bourse, one of Bordeaux's most recognisable sights 
 Wandering the streets of Bordeaux 
 Porte Cailhau, built in the 15th century 
 Bordeaux's Grand Théâtre 
 Exploring Bordeaux 
 
 
 
 
 
Free Walking Tour of Bordeaux Itinerary
This free walking tour of Bordeaux starts in Place des Quinconces, one of Europe's largest city squares and home to a magnificent fountain, a monument to the Girondists who fell victim to the Reign of Terror during the French Revolution.
Throughout the walking tour, your English-speaking tour guide will tell you all about the history of this city, one of the most important in France and the world capital of the viticulture industry, with wine having been produced here since the 8th century.
Bordeaux's historic centre has been recognised as a UNESCO World Heritage Site for its incredible architectural beauty. Walking through the streets of the old town, you'll discover iconic buildings such as the Bordeaux Cathedral, first consecrated in 1096; the Grand Théâtre, with its impressive Neo-Classical façade; Porte Cailhau, the gateway that remains from the ancient fortified city walls; and the Utopia cinema, which is housed in a former church. 
Learn the legends and history surrounding the city, get to know local customs and discover the importance of the wine industry for Bordeaux and the area surrounding the Garonne river.
Your walking tour of Bordeaux will finish in Place de la Bourse. This large square is a perfect example of French 18th century classical architecture and was constructed to reflect the city's wealth.
Important information
It is not possible to reserve the Free Walking Tour of Bordeaux if you are a group of more than 6 people.
If you'd prefer to visit the city with your own exclusive English-speaking guide, check out our Private Tour of Bordeaux instead.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protection and safety, to help avoid the spread of Covid-19. Specifically, the provider of this tour will apply the following measures:
Tours or activities will not consist of more than 15 people per group.
A safe distance of one metre between clients will be maintained whenever possible.
The use of masks is obligatory. The client must bring their own mask.
Alcohol gel will be available before, during, and after the service.
All those running the service (guide, driver etc...) will wear a mask throughout its duration.
All those running the service (guide, driver etc...) will wear gloves throughout its duration.
Handing out of printed material such as maps or brochures will be avoided.
The temperature and wellness of all those taking part in the service will be monitored daily, excluding and maintaining in quarantine any who display fever or symptoms.
Showing your voucher on your phone will be enough, and it is not necessary to print anything.
Alcoholic drinks are not available.

Description:
Ride through the town on the French Riviera with this Cannes Segway Tour. Discover the main points of interest in this beautiful city on the Côte d'Azur, known for its film festival.
 Enjoying the Cannes Segway Tour 
 Next to the Palais des Congrès de Cannes 
 In the Old Port of Cannes 
 Touring Cannes by Segway 
 Group of friends on the Cannes Segway Tour 
 Couple travelling around Cannes by segway 
 Port Vieux, Cannes 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Cannes Segway Tour
When you make your reservation you can choose a 1 or 2 hour tour. In both cases, the departure will be at the time of your choice from 16 Boulevard Jean Hibert in Cannes. The activity will end at the same point.
1 hour tour
Before starting the Cannes tour, we'll have a short practical training to learn how to ride the segways safely. Once prepared, we'll tour the area of the beautiful Vieux Port. Our next stop will be the Boulevard de la Croisette to see the entrance of the Palais des Festivals et des Congrès. We'll feel like real stars of the Seventh Art, as this place hosts the Cannes Film Festival every year.
The tour will continue to the Port Canto and its romantic gardens, where we'll take in the sweet aromas of the rose garden.
2 hour tour
After following the same itinerary as the 1 hour tour, we'll continue the tour by segway through Cannes in the exclusive area of Palm Beach. You'll surely be surprised by the luxurious yachts that are moored next to this beach!
The next stop will be at the popular Rue Meynadier. If you take the tour in the morning, we'll also stop at the Marché Forville so you can see the colourful fruit stalls at this market. Before returning to the starting point, we'll visit the picturesque medieval quarter of Le Suquet, undoubtedly one of the most beautiful in Cannes!
Covid-19 Measures

Description:
The beautiful peninsula of Scandola and the gorgeous bay of Girolata await you on this boat trip along the west coast of Corsica. You will be amazed by the striking contrasts of the red tones of the rocks and the crystal blue waters of the Mediterranean.
 Beach on the bay of Girolata 
 The peninsula of Scandola 
 The Gulf of Girolata 
 
 
 
Scandola and Girolata Boat Tour
After boarding the boat at the port of Cargese, you will start a journey along the west coast of the island of Corsica. On this route, you can admire the impressive cliffs that characterize this region of France.
The first point which we visit on this trip is the peninsula of Scandola. Once we come to the enormous rock formations of red and ochre colors, you will know that we have arrived at the unique nature reserve which covers both land and sea. This beautiful region was declared a UNESCO World Heritage site in 1983. You will also sail into spectacular grottoes which have been formed by centuries of wind and sea erosion on the rock surface.
Later, we will head to the bay of Girolata, an idyllic location where we will stop for 2 hours and a half, for a rest, to eat in a local restaurant, and to explore the tiny beach coves. The highlight of this corner of the island is the 18th-century Genoese tower which dominates the village and which can only be reached by sea.
Then, we will return on the boat to begin our return journey. On the way back to the port, we will pass the Calanques of Piana and Cabo Rosso, which form part of the breath-taking volcanic landscape and which give the area a unique character.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Discover the villages of Hautvillers and Mareuil-sur-Ay, considered to be the birthplace of French champagne with this E-bike Champagne Day Tour & Lunch - a truly unique experience!
 Enjoying the electric bike tour 
 Riding an electric bicycle next to the vineyards 
 The electric bike tour 
 Views of Mareuil-sur-ay 
 Capturing photos of the vineyards 
 Enjoying a traditional French lunch 
 Panoramic view of the vineyards 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
E-bike Champagne Day Tour & Lunch
We'll meet at 9.45 am at 20 Avenue de Champagne, in front of the Dom Pérignon sculpture which presides over the entrance to the Moët & Chandon wineries. From this central point in Épernay, we'll travel by minibus to the picturesque town of Mareuil-sur-Ay.
In this beautiful village, considered to be a birthplace of French champagne, we'll stop at a country house, Le Clos Corbier. From this traditional house, we'll start an electric bicycle tour through the surrounding vineyards. During this route, we'll see the famous champagne terroirs, the plots where the vines grow.
Do you know how the grapes used to produce sparkling wines are grown? To discover it, we'll pedal to a family winery in the area. Inside its facilities we'll see how this drink is produced and taste 3 homemade champagnes.
The bike route will continue to the village of Hautvillers, to see the church containing the remains of Dom Pérignon, and we'll explain why this 17th century monk revolutionised champagne-making! We'll then ride along the banks of the Marne River canals.
The tour will end returning to Le Clos Corbier in Mareuil-sur-Ay, where a succulent traditional French three-course lunch awaits us - delicious! After lunch, we'll go by minibus to another family winery to taste their sparkling wines. What more could you ask for?
The tour will end by returning to the starting point in Épernay, arriving at 5:45 pm.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Discover the Côte d'Azur in an elegant Ferrari or Lamborghini with this French Riviera Sports Car Tour from Èze. You'll choose whether to enjoy this unforgettable experience as a driver or as a passenger.
 Travel in a Ferrari along the Cote d'Azur 
 Drive a Ferrari in the south of France 
 The luxury sports car tour 
 Enjoy the Ferrari experience 
 The impressive Lamborghini 
 Experience the French Riviera in style 
 Views of the beautiful Cote d'Azur 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
French Riviera Sports Car Tour
We'll meet at the time of your choice at 158 Avenue de Verdun, in the heart of the French town of Èze. From here, we'll leave in a luxurious sports car. 
Choose between a route lasting 15 minutes, 30 minutes or one hour in a Ferrari or a Lamborghini. You can also choose to drive the car yourself or be the co-pilot. Don't worry, a guide will accompany you at all times to take you to the most famous spots on the Côte d'Azur.
During the route we'll pass through different points of interest along the coast between Nice and Monaco, adjusting the itinerary to the length of the journey you're going to make. You'll feel the breeze of the Cote d'Azur while you enjoy the powerful sound of the car - it'll be a unique experience!
The tour will end by returning to the starting point.
The car models
When making your reservation you can choose one of the following cars:
Ferrari: the route will be done in a Ferrari F430 Spider or a Ferrari California T. Please note that the Ferrari F430 Spider only has two front seats and the Ferrari California T has a total of four seats.
Lamborghini: you'll enjoy a trip in a Lamborghini Gallardo 560 LP Spider. This car has two front seats: one for the driver and one for the co-driver.
 
Who can participate
To drive the vehicles, you must be over 18 years old and have a valid driving licence. In order to enjoy the experience as a passenger, the minimum age is 5 years old.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protection and safety, to help avoid the spread of Covid-19. Specifically, the provider of this tour will apply the following measures:

The transport used will be disinfected before and after each service and deep-cleaned every 24 hours.

Description:
Discover Lyon in an original way, when you climb on board a fabulous tuk-tuk. A guide will take you through the streets of the beautiful French city in comfort and style. You can even choose the route that you prefer!
 Enjoying the Tuk Tuk tour 
 Exploring the city in a Tuk Tuk 
 On board the Tuk Tuk 
 Stolling through Lyon 
 Touring Lyon by Tuk Tuk 
 
 
 
 
 
Options
When making the reservation, you can select the route that you like best:
Tour of the Old Town
At your chosen time, we will meet up at Place Bellecour square, where the fantastic tuk-tuk vehicle will be waiting for you. Once on board, we'll begin our wonderful one-hour tour through the historic center of Lyon. What was once a beating heart of the Renaissance is now a UNESCO heritage site.
We will pass the most famous monuments of the Old Town, including the Cathedral of Saint-Jean, the Torre Rosa (Pink Tower), and the hill of Fourvière, also known as the "mystical mountain". You will also learn all about the famous traboules, architectural features which are particular to Lyon.
The Tuk Tuk tour finishes back at the original starting point.
Tour of the Old Town and Peninsula
If you want a more complete experience, you can choose to book a two-hour tuk-tuk tour which takes in both the Old City and the Peninsula. This route also departs from Place Bellecour square and goes past some of the most emblematic landmarks of the Old Town, stopping in front of the Cathedral of Saint-Jean or the Torre Rosa.
This route, however, will also take you to the Presqu'île de Lyon - an elegant central area of restaurants, luxury departments stores, and cultural centers, situated between the Rhone and Saône rivers. In this popular tourist hotspot, you will find elegant Place Terreaux, home to the historic City Hall. Before finishing, we will also make our way through the famous Place des Jacobins medieval square, and admire the wall murals of this charming neighborhood.
The Tuk Tuk tour ends back at the original starting point.
Opening times
Please bear in mind that the opening hours change depending on the option that you reserve:
Tour of the Old Town: the tour departs at 10 am, 11:30 am, 2 pm, 3:30 pm, and 5 pm.
Tour of the Old Town and Peninsula: the tour leaves at 10 am, 2 pm, 4:30 pm, and 7 pm.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protection and safety, to help avoid the spread of Covid-19. Specifically, the provider of this tour will apply the following measures:
Tours or activities will not consist of more than 6 people per group.
A safe distance of one metre between clients will be maintained whenever possible.
Alcohol gel will be available before, during, and after the service.
All those running the service (guide, driver etc...) will wear a mask throughout its duration.
The transport used will be disinfected before and after each service and deep-cleaned every 24 hours.
