Description:
Discover the best of Lyon exploring its most important monuments and delving into its history accompanied by an expert local guide.
 Saint-Nizier Church 
 Place Bellecour in Lyon city centre 
 Lyon's Place des Jacobins 
 Lyon Cathedral 
 
 
 
 
Lyon Free Walking Tour Itinerary
Your free walking tour of Lyon will begin in Place de la Comédie, a square located in the heart of the city centre, where you'll find the Hôtel de Ville, or City Hall, and the Opera House. From there, you'll wander over to the Musée des Beaux-Arts, one of France's most important museums and largest collections of fine art.
Continue exploring Lyon on foot, reaching the Saint-Nizier Church, whose impressive Gothic-style façade will leave you in awe. The next stop on your route will be Place Bellecour, one of Europe's largest open squares, where you'll arrive after strolling through the famous Place des Jacobins, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and home to one of the city's most photographed fountains.
Walk alongside the River Saône, entering Vieux Lyon, the Old Town, where you'll be immersed in the city's fascinating Medieval architecture. Discover the history and curious facts surrounding the legendary traboules, historic passageways used to get around the city, as you admire the pink tower of the Traboule de la Tour Rose.
Finally, you'll visit Lyon Cathedral, dedicated to John the Baptist, located at the foot of Fourvière hill.
Important information
It is not possible to book this free tour of Lyon for groups of more than 6 people.
Children must be accompanied by an adult. There is a maximum of 3 children permitted per adult.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Ride along the Rhône and Saône rivers while discovering the history of Lyon and its transformation over time with this Lyon Bike Tour. A fantastic time to share with family or friends!
 Enjoy a bike tour in Lyon 
 Cycling around Lyon 
 Place Bellecour in Lyon 
 Basilica of Our Lady of Fourvière 
 Lyon cathedral 
 Lyon Traboule 
 Explore the city 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Lyon Bike Tour
At the agreed time, we'll meet at 23 Quai Romain Rolland, in the old town, in order to start the bike tour of Lyon. You'll find yourself in the Vieux Lyon, an area which charms countless tourists every year. It's undoubtedly the most authentic and charming area of the city. You'll ride through the old town to discover the historical heart of Lyon.
Not far from the banks of the Saône and the Quai Saint-Vincent is the Fort Saint-Jean. You'll go to this stone citadel which overlooks the Saône River at an altitude of 40 metres.
The visit will continue to the Croix-Rousse tunnel. This is a fun attraction which allows you to go from the banks of the Rhône to the banks of the Saône.  You can experience the digital, visual and sound works of art scattered all along the tunnel.
You'll also go to the Parc de la Tête d'Or, one of the most beautiful and largest urban parks in France. It was inaugurated in 1857, inspired by English gardens, and covers an area of 105 hectares. 
The tour will also take us to one of the favourite places for locals, the banks of the Rhône. These banks offer a natural, mineral and urban atmosphere for people to meet and relax. 5 km of pure happiness where the watchword is conviviality!
The next stop will be at Place Bellecour, the 3rd largest square in France. This symbolic square in the city is a place for social exchanges and reunions as well as political gatherings. It's the setting for the city's landmark events.
Finally, you'll return to Old Lyon, after two hours of touring, to end the guided tour of Lyon.
Important
No physical condition is required. On the other hand, cycling is necessary.
Electric bikes are available for those over 135 cm.
However, the activity is open to children in child seats for an extra charge of € 5 (US$ 5.90).
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protection and safety, to help avoid the spread of Covid-19. Specifically, the provider of this tour will apply the following measures:
A safe distance of one metre between clients will be maintained whenever possible.

Alcohol gel will be available before, during, and after the service.
All those running the service (guide, driver etc...) will wear a mask throughout its duration.
The transport used will be disinfected before and after each service and deep-cleaned every 24 hours.
Showing your voucher on your phone will be enough, and it is not necessary to print anything.

Description:
Discover the Sanctuary of Our Lady of Lourdes and its historic centre with this guided tour of one of the most important centres of Marian devotion in the world.
 Sanctuary of Our Lady of Lourdes 
 Entrance to the Sanctuary of Our Lady of Lourdes 
 Grotto of Massabielle 
 Lourdes Virgin Mary Statue 
 Panoramic view of Lourdes 
 Basilica of Our Lady of the Immaculate Conception 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Lourdes Walking Tour
We'll meet at the time of your choice at Place Peyramale. From here we'll set off on a guided tour of the old town of Lourdes. As we explore, the guide will give you an overview of the history of Bernadette Soubirous, a nun who witnessed a series of Marian apparitions in the 19th century.
After strolling along the banks of the Ousse River, we'll continue our tour of the sanctuary of Lourdes. This pilgrimage centre houses a large monumental complex made up of three main basilicas. First, we'll visit the Basilica of St. Pius X. Did you know it's built underground? We'll find out why on the tour!
Next, we'll visit the Basilica of Our Lady of the Rosary, where we'll marvel at its magnificent mosaics. Behind it is the Basilica of Our Lady of the Immaculate Conception, whose stained glass windows tell fascinating stories of the apparitions. Then we'll head to the Grotto of Massabielle: the cave where, according to legend, Bernadette Soubirous saw the Virgin Mary.
Next to the cave are the fountains where we can drink Lourdes' famous healing water. We'll also learn about Lourdes' miracles, some of them recognised by the Church.
After a two and a half hour walking tour, we'll end the activity at the main entrance of the sanctuary.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Discover the Green Venice of France on this boat ride through the Marais Poitevin marshland and admire the spectacular scenery of this Regional Nature Park.
 Flowers in the Marais Poitevin marshland 
 Boat ride in Magné 
 Marais Poitevin 
 Boat ride through Marais Poitevin 
 Canals 
 Green Venice 
 Rowing through Magné 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Magné Boat Ride
We'll meet at the time of your choice in Avenue de la Repentie before walking to the Magné pier. Here we'll hop into our boats and start to row through the waters of this French town. 
During the ride, we'll enjoy the spectacular scenery of Magné from the canal as we enter the Marais Poitevin marshland. As we row through this beautiful Regional Nature Park, we'll admire the magnificent elms, ashes and willow trees.
If we're lucky, we might see wildlife such as carp, swans, ducks and maybe even beavers! Don't forget your cameras!
At the end of the activity, we'll make our way back to the starting point.

All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Drive around the capital of Haute-France in one of the country's most symbolic vintage cars with this Lille Classic Car Tour. You'll explore the city and its must-see locations in a Citroen 2CV.
 Enjoy touring Lille in a classic car 
 Drive a citroen around the city 
 The famous cars 
 Drive a Citroen 2CV 
 Explore the centre of Lille 
 Lille's historic centre 
 Lille Opera 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Lille Classic Car Tour
At your chosen time, we'll pick you up at your hotel or at Place Rihour to start this Lille classic car tour. The Citroen 2CV is one of the most well-known models made by the French car company.
You can choose different durations for this route, in which we'll pass by the most famous points of Lille's historical centre. Its most iconic monument is the Chamber of Commerce's Beffroi Tower, whose architecture follows the pattern of the bell towers of Belgium and northern France, declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
From the classic car, you'll also see other famous buildings, such as the Old Stock Exchange, the Municipal Opera, the imposing headquarters of the Museum of Fine Arts, and the Porte de Paris, among other architectural gems around the city.
During the tour, we'll also pass by the most outstanding temples of worship in the old town, including the Church of Saint-Maurice and the Cathedral of Notre-Dame-de-la-Treille, whose construction was not completed until 1999.
The tour will end by returning to your hotel in Lille or Place Rihour.
Enjoy a glass of champagne
If you wish, you can complete your experience by enjoying a glass of French champagne on board the Citroën 2CV. A toast in the heart of Lille!

Description:
If you are staying at Disneyland Paris and would like to visit the City of Light then we have the perfect tour for you. We will head directly from the theme park to the main landmarks in the city and you will even climb the Eiffel Tower and enjoy a cruise on the Seine.
 Panoramic view of the Arc de Triomphe 
 The 2nd floor of the Eiffel Tower 
 Palais Garnier Opera Theatre 
 The Eiffel Tower next to the river Seine 
 
 
 
 
Paris Tour, Eiffel Tower, and River Cruise
We will meet up at the scheduled time before driving to Paris from Disneyland. Once we arrive, we will board an open-top bus and head into the historic center of the French capital.
The route around the city takes an hour and a half. There, we will tour the main streets and avenues for an hour and a half, admiring places such as the Palais Garnier Opera Theatre, the Louvre Museum, and the Arc de Triomphe. You can listen to the fascinating onboard audio commentary that explains all the architectural and historical details of these monuments as we pass them.
After having seen the main points of interest, you will then have your own free time to eat in the surroundings of the Louvre before you enjoy a fantastic boat trip on the Seine. During this one-hour Parisian river cruise, we will discover the wonders of the city from another point of view and pass the Île Saint-Louis and the Île de la Cité, where the Cathedral of Notre Dame is located.
When we return to the mainland, we will go to the base of the iconic Eiffel Tower. After admiring the impressive structure from the ground, it is time for one of the highlights of the day: we will climb up to the second floor of the Eiffel Tower to enjoy the brilliant panoramic view of Paris.
We finally return to the Disneyland Paris area and bid farewell in front of the NewPort Bay Club Hotel at 8 pm.
Meeting point
This trip includes hotel collection from two different meeting points:
At 9:45 a.m, pick-up will take place at the NewPort Bay Club Hotel, located on Robert Schuman Avenue.
At 10 am, pick-up will take place at the Vienna House Dream Castle Hotel, located on Fosse des Pressoirs Avenue.
Paris in one day + Ticket to the Louvre
If instead of climbing the Eiffel Tower and enjoying a boat trip along the Seine, you would prefer to enter the Louvre Museum, you can book a day tour of Paris with entry to the Louvre from Disneyland which includes entrance to the museum complex. In addition, the tour has a panoramic tour of the main points of interest in the French capital.

Description:
Explore the beautiful French capital at your leisure with this self-guided trip to Paris departing from Disneyland. You will also enjoy a romantic cruise on the Seine River.
 Eiffel Tower, the iconic monument of Paris 
 Arc de Triomphe, next to the Champs Elysees 
 Paris Opera 
 Alexander III Bridge over the Seine 
 Detail of the Eiffel Tower in Paris 
 Views of the River Seine 
 Panorama of París 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Paris Trip and River Cruise
Between 10:15 am and 10:35 am, we will pick you up at Disneyland Paris. From this famous theme park, we then drive by bus to the French capital, one of the most visited destinations in the world.
During the trip to Paris, which lasts approximately one hour, an English-speaking guide will explain everything you can do in the city. You will also receive your tickets so that you can enjoy a romantic one-hour cruise on the Seine River in your free time.
The bus trip ends at Port de Suffren, located at the foot of the famous Eiffel Tower. From then on, you can enjoy Paris at your leisure. We recommend taking a walk through the most iconic areas of the city, such as the Place du Trocadéro, the Tuileries Gardens, and the Avenue des Champs Elysées, where you will encounter the colossal Arc de Triomphe.
The enchanting bohemian quarter of Montmartre is also worth a visit. This area has been a source of inspiration for so many artists who often exhibit their paintings at the foot of the Sacré-Cœur church, where the view of Paris is extraordinary!
Finally, at 7 pm, we will meet again at Port de Suffren and head back to Disneyland Paris, arriving one hour later.
Pickup times and locations
This trip includes pick up at the following times and locations in Disneyland Paris:
Magic Circus Hotel parking lot: at 10:15 am
Disney's Hotel Santa Fe parking lot: at 10:25 am
Disney's Newport Bay Club Hotel car park: 10:35 am

Description:
This sightseeing bus tour of Marseille is a convenient way to explore the oldest city in France. You can climb on and off at any of the stops, allowing you to visit all the essential sights at your own pace.
 The Sightseeing in Marseille 
 Touring the Old Port of Marseille on board the ColorBus 
 Notre Dame de la Garde, the catholic basilica in Marseille 
 
 
 
Route and Stops
This tourist bus service follows two different routes with 14 stops around the main attractions of France’s second largest city. Throughout the journey on board the open-top double-decker bus, you can enjoy English language commentary about the monuments, museums, gardens and other important locations around the coastal city.
Some of the essential stops on the route are the Notre Dame de la Garde Cathedral, Les Catalans, the bay of Vallon des Auffes, Fort Saint Nicolas and the seafront Corniche.
You can consult the routes and all the stops on the map by clicking on this link:
Route and list of stops on the tourist bus of Marseille
How does it work
The ticket is valid for 1 single day. So, if you activate a ticket at 3 pm, the ticket will only be valid until the end of that same day. During this time, you can hop on and off the bus as many times as you want. We recommend activating the card as early as possible to enjoy its full potential.
Timetable and frequency
The tourist bus in Marseille operates every day and leaves every half an hour between 10 am and 5 pm from the Old Port of the city.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Explore the beautiful historic centre of Montpellier and delve deep into its legendary Medieval past on this guided walking tour of the southern French city. What's more, it's FREE!
 Montpellier's Opéra comédie 
 The Porte du Peyrou, a triumphal arch in Montpellier 
 Montpellier Cathedral 
 Tour de la Babotte, preserved from Medieval fortifications 
 
 
 
 
Free Walking Tour of Montpellier Itinerary
Begin your free walking tour of Montpellier in the central Place de la Comédie. Elegant buildings with cafes spilling out into the square make this one of the most beautiful places in the city. After admiring the Three Graces Fountain, you'll stroll over to the nearby Opéra comédie, home to the Montpellier National Opera. Do you know what shows have proved to be the greatest successes? And which ones have been booed the most?
Not far from the theatre, you'll reach the Tour de la Babotte, one of the most important architectural structures that still remains from the fortified city walls of Medieval Montpellier. Over the ensuing centuries, the watchtower has had many different uses, and it was even the site of one of science's most revolutionary inventions... can you guess which?
Continue your walking tour to Montpellier's Cathedral, the Cathédrale Saint-Pierre. This imposing place of worship may remind you more of a fortress than a church! A short walk away you'll find the triumphal arch known as Porte du Peyrou. See if you can spot the differences and similarities between this archway and the iconic Parisian Arc de Triomphe. 
Finishing up your free tour of Montpellier, you'll return back to your original meeting point in Place de la Comédie.
Important information
It is not possible to reserve this free walking tour of Montpellier if you are a group larger than 10 people.
Children must be accompanied by a parent. There is a maximum of three children permitted per adult.
This tour does not enter any of the monuments on the route.

Description:
Discover one of the pearls of the Côte d'Azur with this Nice Free Walking Tour. Learn about its exciting history, accompanied by an English speaking guide through the old town of the French city. 
 Garibaldi Square 
 Promenade du Paillon fountains 
 Place Massena 
 Nice cathedral 
 
 
 
 
Nice Free Walking Tour
We'll meet at 10:55 am at Place Masséna, more precisely in front of the Fontaine du Soleil to start this free tour in the city of Nice.
After admiring the fountain, one of the most beautiful examples of baroque classicism and enjoying the atmosphere around one of the city's favourite squares, you'll leave to explore the most important places and monuments of the city.
Accompanied by the guide, you'll stroll through the narrow streets of Vieux-Nice to immerse yourself in the life in south-east of France. Following on, the tour will lead us past some of the most important places in the city such as the Cours Saleya, the main pedestrian street in Vieux-Nice. Then, you'll approach Colline du Chateau while listening to the many stories the guide will tell you.
Of course, during this free visit, you'll also stroll along the Promenade des Anglais, one of the most famous avenues in the world. 
The free tour of Nice will end between 1 pm and 1.30 pm on the hillside Nice's castle.
Groups
We don't accept reservations for more than 6 people. If you're a larger group, you must book a private tour of Nice with an English speaking guide.

Description:
This sightseeing bus service in Nice is a convenient and fun way to tour the capital of the French Riviera. You can climb on and off at any of its stops to explore the city at your own leisure.
 The tourist bus in Nice 
 Enjoying the hop on hop off bus 
 Promenade des Anglais 
 Port of Nice 
 
 
 
 
Route and stops
The tourist bus in Nice follows a route of one hour and fifteen minutes and takes in 12 stops at the main tourist attractions of this lighthouse city on the Côte d'Azur. Throughout the journey, on board the open-top double-decker bus, you will have access to recorded English commentary about the monuments, museums, gardens, and other notable locations around the city.
Some of the essential stops on the Nice sightseeing bus route are the Promenade des Anglais, Villefranche and the St Nicholas Russian Orthodox Cathedral.
You can consult the route and all the stops on the map by clicking on this link:
Route and list of stops of the Nice sightseeing bus
How it works
The ticket is valid for 1 single day or 2 consecutive days. So, if you activate a 1-day ticket at 3 pm, the ticket will only be valid until the end of that same day. During this time, you can hop on and off the bus as many times as you want. We recommend activating the card as early as possible to enjoy its full potential.
Timetable and frequency
Buses run on Mondays, Wednesdays and Saturdays from 10 am to 5 pm. They pass every two hours from Monday to Wednesday and every hour at weekends
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Discover the capital of the French Riviera with this unique tuk tuk tour. You'll be driven past the most symbolic locations around Nice.
 Nice Opera 
 Nice tuk tuk tour 
 Nice Cathedral Facade 
 Les Ponchettes 
 Dukes of Savoy Palace 
 Enjoying a tuk tuk ride around Nice 
 The bright streets of the French Riviera capital 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Nice Tuk Tuk Tour
We'll pick you up at your chosen time at your hotel in the centre of Nice, and start the route around the Côte d'Azur capital on a tuk tuk. Our first sighting will be the vibrant Place Masséna, where we'll admire the Sun Fountain.
The next stop will be Ópera, which has seen many historical figures pass through its doors. We'll also visit the famous market square Cours Saleya and the symbolic Dukes of Savoy Palace.
Following on, we'll head to the old town to explore the Palais de Justice, built in the 19th century on the site of a former Dominican convent.  We'll also admire the important 11th century Cathedral and take a drive along the seafront Promenade des Anglais.
If you think you've seen everything in Nice, just wait until we reach Les Ponchettes. The famous street full of colourful houses was converted into galleries hosting contemporary art exhibitions. 
After 30 minutes we'll accompany you to your hotel or your preferred place in the city centre to finish the tour. 
Important Information
Upon booking, you can extend your tuk tuk tour route. All routes include the 30 minute tour itinerary, or you can enhance the experience in the following ways:
40 - 45 minute tour: We'll explore the pedestrian area around Nice, and visit Le Jardin Albert I. We'll visit the Memorial and stop to take a photo with the #ILOVENICE sign.
60 - 70 minute tour: This route includes stops at the Port, Place Garibaldi, Promenade du Paillon and the Modern Art Museum. 
1 hour 30 minutes - 1 hour 45 minutes tour: We'll see the symbolic Negresco Hotel, the Notre Dame Basilica, the Orthodox Cathedral and the Musicians Quarter. 
 
Prices
The price stated is for the tuk tuk. Each vehicle has capacity for 2 adults and 2 children under 7 years old, as long as they are accompanied by their parents.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protection and safety, to help avoid the spread of Covid-19. Specifically, the provider of this tour will apply the following measures:
Tours or activities will not consist of more than 2 people per group.
A safe distance of one metre between clients will be maintained whenever possible.
Alcohol gel will be available before, during, and after the service.
The transport used will be disinfected before and after each service and deep-cleaned every 24 hours.
Showing your voucher on your phone will be enough, and it is not necessary to print anything.

Description:
Let yourself be seduced by the charm elegant French city on the Côte d'Azur with this Nice Electric Bike Tour. You'll ride through the most symbolic areas around this beautiful location.
 Sign next to the Quai Rauba Capeu in Nice 
 Enjoying the electric bike tour around Nice 
 Electric bikes in Nice 
 Cycling through Nice on an electric bicycle 
 E-Bike in the centre of Nice 
 Touring the Promenade des Anglais 
 Electric bikes parked in Nice 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Nice Electric Bike Tour
At 9:30 am, we'll meet at 2 rue Halévy. From this central point in Nice, we'll start an electric bike tour along the famous avenues of the Promenade des Anglais, Quai des États-Unis and Quai Rauba Capeù.
We'll also stop by the famous I Love Nice sign, where you can take a photo to remember the moment. The tour will continue to the top of the Castle Hill, to enjoy the best views of Nice. 
The tour will continue along the quays of Port Lympia, where we'll climb up to the Mont Boron Hill. You'll be surprised by the exceptional views, and we'll contemplate the bay of Nice in all its splendour. While we enjoy the panoramic views, we'll also tell you some curiosities about this beautiful corner of the Côte d'Azur.
Then we'll visit the Cimiez district. Did you know that this area of Nice is home to the Matisse Museum, Roman baths and a medieval monastery? In addition, the district has other jewels of monumental heritage that we'll reveal to you during the tour.
Finally, the tour will end at 12 pm returning to the starting point.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protection and safety, to help avoid the spread of Covid-19. Specifically, the provider of this tour will apply the following measures:

The transport used will be disinfected before and after each service and deep-cleaned every 24 hours.

Description:
Climb on board a boat which will take you to Saint-Tropez, the jewel of the French Riviera. Relax and enjoy the blue sea in the heart of the Côte d'Azur.
 Saint Tropez 
 Boats in Saint Tropez 
 Beaches in Saint Tropez 
 
 
 
Itinerary
We'll pick you up at your hotel, and make our way to Sainte Maxime, where we'll take a boat along the Saint-Tropez bay. Once there you'll be able to explore the city at your own pace, discovering how a fishing village became popular in the 1950s after the film "And God Created Woman", starring Brigitte Bardot.
Pasaremos a recogeros a vuestro hotel para trasladarnos hasta Sainte Maxime, donde cogeremos un barco que nos llevará hasta la bahía de Saint-Tropez. Una vez allí, podréis pasear libremente por este pueblo. Descubriréis que Saint Tropez es un pueblo de pescadores que se hizo popular en la década de 1950 con la película "Y Dios creó a la mujer", protagonizada por Brigitte Bardot.
See the magnificent Saint Tropez Old Town, characterised by its narrow streets and its citadel. It's a city eternally bound to the sea, so of course, it has its own fish market, the smallest in the world. You can see for yourself why the beaches of Saint-Tropez are legendary, and there are few greater pleasures than taking in views of the castle as you swim or sunbathe.
Regresaremos de nuevo al barco para iniciar el camino de regreso a vuestro hotel en Niza.

Description:
On board our boat, you will discover the best corners of Scandola and Girolata. You will also sail around the spectacular volcanic rock formations of the Calanques de Piana. Your camera is an essential item if you want to capture these unique landscapes forever!
 The nature reserve at Scandola 
 The bay in the gulf of Girolata 
 Views of cabo Rosso 
 
 
 
Scandola and Girolata Cruise
The coast of Corsica hides its greats treasure on the peninsula of Scandola and you can discover these jewels for yourself with our boat trip.
The nature reserve of Scandola will be the first breath-taking landscape that we visit. The cliffs, with mysterious red tones, spread out along the coastline. If that isn’t enough to impress you then surely the rich abundance of animal species will.
Overwhelmed by so much natural beauty, we will sail to the town of Girolata, a fishing city surrounded by an immense gulf where you can enjoy a good swim. You will have two hours of free time before we start the return journey.
The Calanques of Piana and Cabo Rosso will be the last beautiful locations in the itinerary. These dizzying volcanic landscapes hide many surprises.
Around 6 pm we will arrive back at Porticcio.
Important information
If you want you can also reserve the boat trip to Scandola and Girolata with departures from Porto, Ajaccio, Cargese, and Sagone.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Feel like a real explorer with this boat tour of the Sanguinaires islands. Be enchanted by the crystal blue waters and spectacular sunset as it casts the sky in deep red tones.
 The boat on Sanguinaires Islands 
 Taking a stroll on the island of Mezzumare 
 The bay of Porticcio 
 
 
 
Islands Cruise
The Sanguinaires Islands were formed by a volcano and today are home to exotic species of plants and animals. The 4 Sanguinaires Islands are a unique space of natural beauty on the Corsican coast, and on this trip you can explore them and even bathe in their pristine waters.
After gathering at the meeting point, we will climb aboard the boat to take us to the famous archipelago. From the port of Porticcio, you will already spot our first stop on the horizon - the coast of Ajaccio. We will moor at the city’s waterfront to explore the bustling maritime life of Napoleon Bonaparte’s birthplace.
We will visit the chapel of the Greeks, the Santa María Magdalena de Pazzis Cemetery, and the citadel. You will feel the spirit of the Emperor and the echoes of the past as you tour the narrow streets of the historic center.
Before docking at Mezzumare (the largest island), you can enjoy the views of the Parata Point hill peninsula and its tower which watches out over the coast from the highest point. Once on the island, you will have free time to take a dip and discover the oldest areas such as the ruins of Lazareto.
If you are looking for an unusual experience, do not miss the flower-lined walkways which are home to rare animals. This is a treat for your senses which you will remember forever.
Around 5:30 pm we will return to Porticcio and there we will finish our maritime adventure.
Important information
If you prefer, you can reserve the cruise around the Sanguinaires Islands which departs from Ajaccio.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Discover a fairy tale city nestled in the clifftops. Defy gravity by taking a stroll around the citadel and explore the enchanting parts of Bonifacio when you take this boat trip.
 The city of Bonifacio perched on the clifftops of Corsica 
 The boat passing through Bonifacio 
 Pertusato lighthouse 
 
 
 
Bonifacio Boat Cruise
A remote, difficult to reach city, which defies the laws of gravity. The sight of Bonifacio is breath-taking. Best of all it is almost inaccessible, which means you can enjoy this beautiful location without stifling crowds of tourists.
After collecting you at the dock, we will board the boat that will take us to the city. From the deck of the boat, you will witness the incredible coastline panorama flanked by a medieval fort. Once in Bonifacio, an enjoyable mini train will take you to the citadel from where you can tour the city at your own pace and visit the most interesting sights.
If you want the best views, we recommend hiking to the lighthouse of Pertusato. Although it is a steep walk, the panorama across the coast and the island of Sardinia is well worth the effort. If you look carefully, you will also spot the beautifully intense colors of the corals that are characteristic of the Bonifacio coastline.
After a 4-hour self-guided visit, we will return on the boat to start the return journey to Porticcio.​
Important information
You can board the train that will take you to the citadel and to the outskirts of the city every 30 minutes.
If you prefer, you can also reserve the boat trip to Bonifacio which departs from Ajaccio.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
The sun is setting over the Mediterranean, you are listening to the melodic guitar sounds whilst sipping a glass of delicious wine. On this boat tour around the Sanguinaires Islands, you will see the majestic beauty of Corsica at dusk.
 The Sanguinaires Islands at sunset 
 Wine tasting 
 Live music on board 
 
 
 
What to expect on the sunset boat tour
The intense red sunset signals the start of our cruise. The guitar chords welcome you onto the boat and once aboard, you will taste the best flavors of Corsica.
You can try typical wines and food as the sun goes down on the horizon. The low torchlight ambiance onboard will transport you to a magical place where time seems to stand still.
You will feel the gentle bob of the boat on the ocean waves as you gaze out across the beautiful Sanguinaires Islands and later, the impressive Gulf of Ajaccio.
Around 10 pm we will end the tour back at Porticcio.
Important information
If you want, you can also reserve the boat tour around the Sanguinaires with a departure from Ajaccio.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Sail along the coast of Scandola and discover the nature reserve and its hundreds of species of flora and fauna. You can only gaze in wonder at the incredible panoramic landscape of rocks and mountains. The jewel of Corsica awaits you!
 The coast of Scandola 
 The nature reserve of Scandola 
 Views of Cabo Rosso 
 
 
 
Scandola Boat Trip
Pods of dolphins, seals, giant seagulls and other marine birds have already been accommodated in the nature reserve of Scandola. Not only will the variety of plants and animals leave you breathless, but the incredible landscapes which draw closer as the boat approaches will also enchant you.
After collecting you at the marina in Porto, we will head towards this jewel of Corsica. If you previously had any doubts about the volcanic origins of Scandola, the intense red rocks sculptured for millennia by the ocean the wind will be enough to show you it’s true.
We will sail to almost inaccessible natural caves and we will see steep breath-taking cliffs. Then we stop for half an hour in the Gulf of Girolata to admire the beautiful emerald waters. Above all, however, the rock formations which surreally rise out of the water will astound you.
With this picture postcard landscape as our backdrop, we will start our return trip to Porto and arrive back at the dock around 1:30 pm.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Sail around the Calanques de Piana, one of the Corsica’s most secret corners. Drift alongside the magical sea-carved cliffs and the distinct red stone columns.
 The Calanques de Piana 
 Cabo Rosso 
 The City of Cargese 
 
 
 
Boat Trip to Calanques de Piana
There are no words that do justice to the Calanques de Piana, mythical rock formations in a magical part of Europe. These cliffs, sculpted in peculiar forms, are one of the greatest landmarks of Corsica. Are you ready to start our adventure?
After collecting you from the dock at Porto on the island of Corsica, we will start our route towards the almost inaccessible Piana. Here it will feel like you are in a different world surrounded by pillars shaped from volcanic rock. These cast everything around them in intense red tones.
At its side, you can see rock outcrops in pink, ochre, and red tones which become intense colors when cast in direct sunlight. Prepare your camera if you want to capture this special moment forever! During the trip, you will make a brief 30-minute stop in Girolata.
After our journey of one hour and a half, we will take you back to the marina in Porto.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Discover the origin of the famous French delicacy with this Electric Bike Champagne Tour around Hautvillers and Mareuil-sur-Ay, two beautiful towns near Reims.
 Cycle past the vineyards 
 Explore on an electric bike 
 Mareuil-sur-Ay 
 Capturing shots of the vineyards 
 Enjoy a delicious lunch 
 Le Clos Corbier 
 Have fun on the electric bike tour 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Electric Bike Champagne Tour
At 9 am, we'll meet in front of Rheims train station. From here we'll take a minibus to the picturesque village of Mareuil-sur-Ay, one of the main locations for French champagne.
In this beautiful town, you'll find one of the region's traditional houses, Le Clos Corbier. Here we'll get off the minibus to go on an electric bike tour of the surrounding vineyards. During the route, we'll discover the 'Champagne Terroirs'. In addition, we'll stop at a family winery to taste three different kinds of handcrafted champagne.
The electric bike tour will continue to the nearby village of Hautvillers, where we'll visit the church where Dom Pérignon is buried. Did you know that this 17th-century monk is considered the inventor of the champagne-making process? After learning about his history, we'll pedal along the canals of the Marne River.
The electric bicycle route will end at Le Clos Corbier, where a delicious traditional French lunch will be waiting for us, including three dishes. After lunch, we'll travel by minibus to a traditional local winery to visit its facilities and taste its sparkling wines.
At the end of the visit, we'll return to Reims train station, arriving at 6:30 pm.
Covid-19 Measures

Description:
With this tour, you will tour the crystal blue waters of the west coast of Corsica while admiring the spectacular nature reserve of Scandola. You will also stop in the bay of Girolata where you can explore the beautiful beach coves and eat lunch in a local restaurant.
 Calanques de Piana 
 Bay of Girolata 
 A beach in the bay of Girolata 
 
 
 
Boat Trip to Scandola and Girolata
In the morning, we will set sail from the port of Sagone to start our boat trip around the west coast of Corsica. On this route, your eyes will feast on the glorious sight of the unusual rock formations that spread out across this part of the island.
The first point of interest on the route will be the Scandola peninsula, a land and marine nature reserve which was declared a UNESCO World Heritage site in 1983. This area is made up of huge volcanic rocks which rise up from the Mediterranean sea in spectacular shapes and colors. On this tour, you will cruise around the caves which have been shaped by wind and sea erosion. 
Then, we head to the Gulf of Girolta, where you will make a stop of 2 hours and a half to explore the beautiful coves and eat at a traditional local restaurant. The striking attraction of this location is the village, which is dominated by a Genoese tower constructed in the 18th century and which can only be reached by sea.
On the return journey, you will encounter the pretty Calanques of Piana and Cabo Rosso which form are part of the amazing volcanic landscapes characteristic of this region.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
This free walking tour of Paris breathes life into "The City of Lights" and its long storied history: discovering the Louvre, the Seine and Notre Dame. And best of all is the price!
 Notre Dame Cathedral 
 Pont Neuf 
 Tuileries Garden 
 
 
 
Free Walking Tour of Paris
Standing on the banks of the Seine, 'Paname' (as the locals call it) is built upon over two thousand years of history. From Gallic origins to Roman conquest, through decadence, revolution, war, occupation, liberation and more. The French capital has lived a thousand lifetimes, and hand in hand with an expert local guide you'll learn about the living history of the city.
Beginning in Place Saint-Michel, on the banks of the Seine, this free tour will take in the most emblematic sights Paris has to offer: Notre Dame Cathedral (famous throughout popular culture and one of the finest examples of French Gothic architecture), The Louvre (perhaps the world's most famous museum, and home to da Vinci's Mona Lisa), Palais Justice, Musée d’Orsay, Latin Quarter and much more.
Throughout the tour, our expert guide will inform about the history of the city. From its beginnings as a medieval village to the capital of Napoleon's empire and from the French Revolution to La Belle Époque and Nazi occupation; our guides breathe life into the city and the history of Paris.
Important Information
The tour has an average length of 2.5 hours, usually ending at the Louvre Museum. However, the guides with whom we work will vary their route depending on the best interests of your group.
This tour is designed for small groups and individual travellers. If you are a group of more than 9, please take a look at our private tours of Paris.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
A Hop On Hop Off bus tour is one of the most comfortable and enjoyable ways of exploring Paris. Discover the city on the various lines and hop off and back on at any of its stops, appreciating the sights from an open top deck accompanied by interesting commentary in English.
 The Eiffel Tower from the bus 
 Driving past the Moulin Rouge 
 Driving past the Eiffel Tower 
 Discovering Paris on the sightseeing bus 
 Arc de Triomphe 
 Champ de Mars, next to the Eiffel Tower 
 Covid-19 prevention 
 Hand cleaning on all buses 
 Distance between seats 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Watch the video 
Hop On Hop Off Bus Paris
The Hop-On Hop-Off bus route has 15 stops in total: throughout the tour, you'll discover Paris and its top landmarks on an open top double decker bus. 
Some of the most popular stops are: Eiffel Tower, Opera Garnier, Louvre Museum, Notre Dame and Champs-Élysées. During the bus ride enjoy pre-recorded commentary in English, as well as in another 10 languages.
Check out the different stops on the tourist bus route via the following links (currently only red line in operation):
Route and stops
Types of tickets
Choose the type of ticket that adapts best to your needs: 
1 Day Ticket: Offers unlimited access to the Big Bus Hop-On Hop-Off buses for 1 day.
2 Day Ticket: Offers unlimited use of the Big Bus Hop-On Hop-Off buses for 2 days. 
2 Day Ticket & Cruise: As well as unlimited use of the Big Bus Hop-On Hop-Off buses for 2 days you will also enjoy a cruise down the Seine.
How it works
A bus ticket is valid for 1 or 2 complete days from the first time you use it. Meaning that a 2-Day Ticket used for the first time on Monday at 3 pm will be valid for the rest of Monday and all of Tuesday. 
During the chosen period, you can get on a Hop-On Hop-Off bus as many times as you want and explore Paris.
Although when making the reservation you will be asked for a start date, you can use the service over the twelve months following the start date. When you have made your reservation, we'll send you a voucher you must hand in on the first bus you get on.
Schedule and frequency
Tourist bus: every day from 9:15 am to 6:30 pm, every 5-15 minutes. The complete tour takes 2 hours 20 minutes. 
Seine river cruise: April - September, departures every 30 minutes between 10 am and 10:30 pm. From October to March, departures every hour between 10:30 am and 10 pm. The cruise leaves from the Eiffel Tower pier (stop 1) and makes a return journey to Notre Dame.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protection and safety, to help avoid the spread of Covid-19. Specifically, the provider of this tour will apply the following measures:
A safe distance of one metre between clients will be maintained whenever possible.
The use of masks is obligatory. The client must bring their own mask.
Alcohol gel will be available before, during, and after the service.
All those running the service (guide, driver etc...) will wear a mask throughout its duration.
Disinfected radio units will be provided, and headphones will be single-use.
Handing out of printed material such as maps or brochures will be avoided.
The temperature and wellness of all those taking part in the service will be monitored daily, excluding and maintaining in quarantine any who display fever or symptoms.
The transport used will be disinfected before and after each service and deep-cleaned every 24 hours.
The capacity of all means of transport will be reduced to 50% of their maximum capacity.
Showing your voucher on your phone will be enough, and it is not necessary to print anything.
Alcoholic drinks are not available.

Description:
Drifting down the Seine River on a panoramic river boat during the day or at night-time is an unforgettable experience and offers unparalleled views of Paris. The cruise also includes interesting commentary in English.
 Cruise down the Seine 
 Sailing down the Seine on a river boat 
 Crossing under Pont Alexandre III 
 Sailing past the Eiffel Tower 
 The beautiful River Seine 
 Pont Alexandre III 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Watch the video 
Seine River Cruise
The river boat departs from the Eiffel Tower pier, at the foot of this remarkable monument. The one-hour cruise will sail down the Seine River to the Île Saint-Louis and will return and disembark at the same pier.
On this unique journey, you’ll see some of the city’s most impressive landmarks, including Les Invalides, the French Parliament, the Musée d’Orsay, Notre-Dame Cathedral, Louvre Museum, the Gran Palais, among many other interesting sights.
During the cruise, you’ll be handed an English audio guide (you can also have it in 13 other languages) with intriguing facts about The City of Light, its monuments and architecture. Moreover, there will also be a guide on board that will offer up to date information about the city, its events and festivals, so you can make the most of your holidays in this fascinating city.
River boat
The river boat is a glass-covered trimaran with an exterior corridor, ideal to enjoy incomparable views of Paris’ main attractions from the water.
Timetables and frequency
The boats leave every hour. These are the schedules for the 2020-2021 season:
From 8 to 16 October: Fridays and Saturdays from 14:00 to 20:00; Sundays, from 12:00 to 17:00
From 17 October to 29 October: Wednesdays, Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays from 12:00 to 19:00; Sundays, from 12:00 to 17:00.
From 30 October to 16 December: the boats do not operate during this period.
From 17 December to 22 December: Fridays and Saturdays, from 14:00 to 20:00; Sundays, between 12:00 and 17:00.
From 23 December to 3 January: Wednesdays and Saturdays, from 12:00 to 20:00; Thursdays and Sundays, from 12:00 to 17:00. On Friday 25 December and Friday 1 January, the boats operate from 14:00 to 20:00; on Thursday 31 December, the boats make the crossing from 14:00 to 23:00.
From 4th January to 11th February: the boats do not operate during this period.
​
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Take a tour through the narrow streets oozing with history in this most cultural and artistic of Paris' districts, one which artists such as Picasso and Van Gogh sought out for inspiration.
 Sacré-Cœur 
 Montmartre by Night 
 Moulin Rouge 
 
 
 
Montmartre Walking Tour
Montmartre typifies all things Parisian, from terrace cafes to romping bars and clubs, drunken can-can dancers to street artists and performers. This tour passes through tiny cobblestone streets to take in bourgeois-bohemian apartments and discover what made Van Gogh, Lautrec, Monet, Picasso and Dali want to call this most libertine of Parisian districts home.
The tour begins on the outskirts of Montmartre by the infamous Moulin Rouge and from there will climb the hill to seek out the artist's studios, Café des Deux Moulins (from the movie Amélie), Paris' last windmill and learn of the legend of headless Saint Denis. 
At the top of the hill, at Paris' highest point and offering spectacular views of the city sits the Basilica Sacré Coeur. It is adorned by two statues of French national heroes Joan of Arc and King Saint Louis IX, and the basilica has both gardens with a fountain, and a dome open to tourists: Offering a breathtaking panorama which vies with the Eiffel Tower for the title of best view in Paris.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Admire Paris’s remarkable waterfront monuments lit up while you savor a gourmet dinner on a panoramic river boat. Drifting along the Seine River at nighttime is an unforgettable experience and a great way to discover Paris.
 Sailing along the Seine River 
 One of the Marina river boats 
 Trying the desserts 
 Cruising past the Conciergerie 
 Notre Dame from the Seine 
 Paris at night 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Itinerary
This nighttime 2-hour sightseeing cruise sets sail at 9:15pm and disembarks at 11:30pm.
The river boat will navigate under several of the city’s most beautiful bridges and past emblematic landmarks such as Notre-Dame, Louvre Museum, Eiffel Tower, the Conciergerie and the National Assembly.
Options
When making your reservation you can choose from the following options:
Menu without drinks
As well as your meal, you'll enjoy a cup of coffee or tea, as preferred.
Romantic meal
If you would like the ultimate romantic evening, you can also choose the “romantic menu”, served with champagne. The menu includes an individual table decorated with rose petals and you’ll have an exceptional view of the Seine and the city’s waterfront buildings. At the end of the evening, you’ll be able to take a photo of you enjoying this unique experience.  
Children’s menu
Children under 10 years old can have a separate menu that includes a starter, main course, dessert and one beverage.

Description:
Admire Paris’ most famous landmarks during a panoramic city bus tour, followed by a one-hour scenic cruise along the Seine and climb to the top of the Eiffel Tower with priority access. It is the ideal way to explore Paris for the first time. 
 Boat next to the Eiffel tower 
 Les Invalides 
 River boat on the Seine 
 Views from the Eiffel Tower 
 Orsay Museum 
 
 
 
 
 
Paris City Tour, Seine Cruise & Eiffel Tower
Get on board a panoramic coach and enjoy a pleasant ride along the city’s main neighborhoods, squares and bridges. Gaze at Paris’ top sights including Place Vendôme, the Opera House, Luxembourg Palace and Gardens, the Pantheon, Orsay Museum, Place de la Concorde, the Champs-Elysées, the Arc de Triomphe and Les Invalides.
Once you get off the coach, you’ll head to the water and embark on one of the legendary Bateaux Parisiens for a one-hour scenic cruise down the Seine. The river boat offers unparalleled 360º panoramic views of the city’s main waterway and waterfront-buildings such as Notre-Dame, the Louvre Museum, the Eiffel Tower and the Conciergerie.
The sightseeing tour continues with skip the line access to Paris’ most emblematic symbol: the Eiffel Tower. Walk straight in and take an elevator to its second level observation deck at 150 meters. You’ll admire breath-taking views over Paris. Then, discover this monument at your own leisure.
The excursion ends at the Eiffel Tower.
Skip the line ticket
This ticket allows you to skip the lines that usually form at the Eiffel Tower ticket offices. However, you will still have to queue to go through the security controls at the entrance to the monument.
Meeting points
Between 1st September 2020 and 31st March 2021
The tour starts at the tourist office located at 36 Avenue de la Bourdonnais.
Between 1st April 2021 and 31st October 2021
The tour starts at the quay of the Port de la Bourdonnais, located next to the Pont d'Iéna.
Important information  
Although it doesn't often happen, sometimes, due to lack of availability, the visit to the Eiffel Tower may be changed for a visit to the Tour Montparnasse. If this happens, you will be contacted on the day of the tour and you can cancel the tour for free.
The order of the activities may vary, for example, sometimes the Eiffel Tower visit may take place first, and the cruise afterwards. In the case that the cruise takes place last, you can choose whether to enjoy it at the end of the tour or at a later time. You'll receive a ticket that is valid until 9:30 pm, and boat depart once an hour.
If you want to explore the Eiffel Tower's third level, you must buy your ticket at the ticket office on the ground floor. 
The boat tour may be cancelled due to unfavorable weather conditions. 
Third Floor Access
If you like, you can also reserve the option that includes heading up to the third floor of the Eiffel tower in a lift, from where you'll be able to enjoy some unbeatable views of Paris!

Description:
Sail along the Seine River on board a Batobus, Paris’ hop-on hop-off boat, and disembark and embark as many times as you wish for 24 or 48 hours.
 Sailing along the Seine on a batobus 
 Batobus boat on banks of the Seine 
 Paris Batobus 
 Tuileries Garden 
 Notre Dame 
 Banks of the Seine 
 Eiffel Tower 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Batobus Paris
The Batobus boats offer incredible 360⁰ degree views. If it’s nice outside, you can also marvel at the sights from an outdoor area at the back of the boat. The boat drifts past the city’s iconic landmarks, including the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame Cathedral or the elegant buildings housing the Louvre Museum and the Orsay. The whole journey takes approximately 2 hours.
The Batobus is also the perfect way to get around the city center, avoiding the frequent traffic jams! All boats are air-conditioned, which makes this the perfect means of transport all year long.
Route and stops
The Batobus stops at the following eight piers in central Paris:
Eiffel Tower
Musée d'Orsay
Saint-Germain-des-Prés
Notre-Dame
Jardin des Plantes / Cité de la Mode et du Design
Hôtel de Ville
Louvre
Champs-Élysées
Check a map with the route and approximate duration of each journey, from one stop to the next.
Paris Batobus route
How does it work?
Within the time frames indicated per season, you can head to any of the eight stops and get on a Batobus whenever you want.
From the time of first use, you can get on and off any boat as many times you want for the duration of the ticket. For example, if you have booked a 24-hour ticket and you use it for the first time on Monday at 1 pm, your ticket is valid until Tuesday at 12:59 pm.
Schedule, frequency and boarding points
The boats sail from Monday to Thursday from 10 am to 5 pm and from Friday to Sunday from 10 am to 7 pm. The frequency of passage of the boats is 25 minutes.
You can board at any of the following docks:
Eiffel Tower pier
Musée d'Orsay pier
Notre-Dame cathedral pier
Paris City Hall pier (Hôtel de Ville)
From the 31st of August 2020 to the 30th of September 2020, please take the following into account:
Boats run from Wednesday to Sunday, and do not run on Monday or Tuesday.
Boats run every 30 minutes.
The first departure is at 11:40 am and the last at 6:30 pm, from the Eiffel Tower pier.
During this period, the Eiffel Tower, Musee d'Orsay, Notre-Dame,Hôtel de Ville and Place de la Concorde Batobus ticket offices will be the only ones available.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
The Eiffel Tower tickets offer you fast track entry to the observation decks where you can admire breathtaking views of Paris. Then, head down to enjoy a relaxing sightseeing cruise down the Seine River.
 View of the Eiffel Tower from the river boat 
 Eiffel Tower 
 View of Paris from the Eiffel Tower 
 Views of Paris 
 The Eiffel tower from the cruise 
 Cruise on the Seine 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Eiffel Tower Tickets
Accessing the Eiffel Tower at the bottom of the North Pillar, you'll enjoy skip-the-line entry. On the first floor, a glass platform allows a close view of the structure of the monument - you'll feel like you’re walking on air! Although the construction of the Tower was controversial when it opened for the 1889 World’s Fair, it is now the symbol of both Paris and France.
The observation deck on the second floor offers unparalleled views of the city and you’ll be able to spot the Champ de Mars, Trocadéro, and the Montmartre neighbourhood with the Sacré-Coeur Basilica in the background. Feel the city of lights at your feet!
Seine Cruise
After enjoying breath-taking views of one of the most romantic cities in the world, walk down to the pier located just in front of this world-renowned tower. Here you'll take a riverboat that will take you on a one-hour scenic cruise down the Seine River. You will be handed an English audio guide with interesting commentary about the waterfront buildings, including the Statue of Liberty on l’Île aux Cygnes, the Grand Palais, the Louvre Museum, Notre-Dame Cathedral on l’Île de la Cité, among many others.
After a one-hour sightseeing journey, the riverboat completes the cruise returning to the Eiffel Tower Pier.
Where do you pick up the tickets?
Between 28th July 2020 and 31st March 2021
Tickets are collected from the tourist office located at 36 Avenue de la Bourdonnais.
Between 1st April 2021 and 31st October 2021
The tickets are collected from the quay in the Port de la Bourdonnais, located next to the Pont d'Iéna.
Important information
Please note that the price of this activity is more expensive than a normal Eiffel Tower ticket, as it guarantees priority access to the attraction. 
The tour itinerary may vary depending on the time of access to the Eiffel Tower. It is possible that you'll enjoy the cruise on the Seine first and then go up the Eiffel Tower. 
It is not possible to buy tickets to access the third floor of the Eiffel Tower on the tower's second floor. These tickets must be purchased in the ticket office.
The boat tour can be cancelled due to unfavourable weather conditions. 
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protection and safety, to help avoid the spread of Covid-19. Specifically, the provider of this tour will apply the following measures:
Tours or activities will not consist of more than 8 people per group.
A safe distance of one metre between clients will be maintained whenever possible.
The use of masks is obligatory. The client must bring their own mask.
Alcohol gel will be available before, during, and after the service.
All those running the service (guide, driver etc...) will wear a mask throughout its duration.
Disinfected radio units will be provided, and headphones will be single-use.
Handing out of printed material such as maps or brochures will be avoided.
The transport used will be disinfected before and after each service and deep-cleaned every 24 hours.
The capacity of all means of transport will be reduced to 50% of their maximum capacity.
Showing your voucher on your phone will be enough, and it is not necessary to print anything.
Alcoholic drinks are not available.

Description:
An exquisite dinner in the Eiffel Tower with magnificent views of Paris, an enjoyable sightseeing cruise at night-time and tickets to one of the most famous shows in the world make this an unforgettable experience. 
 The famous Moulin Rouge 
 Sightseeing cruise at night-time 
 Views from the Eiffel Tower's restaurant 
 The Moulin Rouge 
 The Eiffel Tower at sunset 
 Boat on the Seine 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Itinerary
The evening begins at 6:15 pm when you board an air-conditioned vehicle that will drive you to the Eiffel Tower, where you’ll have a table waiting for you on the tower's terrace, the best place to enjoy French gastronomy as you admire Paris from on high.  You’ll enjoy a delicious meal with beverages included.
After dinner, you’ll embark on a one-hour cruise down the Seine to admire the French capital’s views from the water. The riverboat will sail past remarkable landmarks such as the Musée d’Orsay, Notre-Dame, Louvre Museum and the Eiffel Tower. 
Once you disembark, you’ll be taken to Pigalle, a neighbourhood located at the foot of Montmartre, which has become one of the most peculiar areas of Paris.
Enjoy an unforgettable experience in the Moulin Rouge, the most famous Parisian cabaret in the world. Watch the famed “Fairy” show, a beautifully coloured and original music show at 11 pm while you enjoy a bottle of champagne (per couple).
At the end of the show, we'll take you to whichever of the following tourist areas you selected when booking: Opéra Garnier, Arc de Triomphe, Montparnasse or Bastille. From here you can take a taxi back to your hotel.
Menu
Your dinner menu includes:
A selection of cold cuts.
Soup or truffade.
Fruit tart, or cakes such as tropezienne or Paris-brest
Beer, white, red or rosé wine.
If you prefer, you can also have a vegetarian menu or a gluten-free menu, suitable for gluten intolerant. If so, you must let us know when you book the activity. 
Eiffel Tower Restaurant
From the 1st of September 2019 until the 31st of March 2020, the Restaurante 58 Tour Eiffel will be closed for renovation.
Moulin Rouge
You must dress smartly for the Moulin Rouge show.
Children under the age of 6 will not be allowed to participate in this tour.
Important Information
The tour may be altered due to weather conditions and the river itself.

Description:
Enjoy a delectable 3-course meal on a glass-enclosed boat and admire the panoramic views of Paris from the Seine River for one hour and a half. It is the perfect way to discover one of the most romantic cities in the world.
 Exquisite meal 
 Sailing down the Seine River 
 
 
Lunch Cruise on the Seine Itinerary
The cruise embarks at 12:15pm near the Musée d’Orsay. Once on board, relax and enjoy stunning views of Paris’ waterfront buildings and landmarks such as the Eiffel Tower, Louvre Museum, Notre-Dame Cathedral, National Assembly and the Conciergerie as the river boat navigates along the Seine River for one-hour-and-a-half.
While you admire the sights, you’ll be served a fine cuisine lunch:
Menu
The exquisite 3-course fine cuisine meal is subject to modification.   
Starters (to choose)
Block of duck foie gras, mango-pineapple compote, crisp raspberry chips
Or: Assortment of starters:
Mozzarella and basil cream, parmesan crisps, small fresh tomatoes
Duck foie gras with salt crystals, mango-pineapple compote
Verrine of quinoa, yuzu flavored butterfly shrimp
Crusty bread with tapenade, fillet of red mullet, vegetable sprouts.
Main course (to choose)
Poultry leg, baby roast potatoes, mini new vegetables
Steamed hake steak, artichoke cream and slow-cooked yellow carrots
Rump steak, pan-fried mixed vegetables, potato rosette (+7€)
Desserts (to choose)
Chocolate-flavored crisp praline feuilleté, raspberry coulis
Or: Assortment of desserts
Banana-salted butter caramel tart
Vanilla custard and candied apricot
Dark chocolate macaroon, crisp Mikado
Variety of strawberries, whipped cream and mini marshmallows.
Menu With Drinks
Si reserváis el menú con bebidas, tendréis incluido café o té (a escoger uno de los dos) y una copa de champán, además de un asiento reservado junto a la ventana y una mini-tableta por persona de chocolate francés.
If you choose the menu with drinks, you'll have a choice of coffee or tea included and a glass of champagne, as well as a reserved seat next to the window and a mini bar of French chocolate per person.
Vegetarian Menu
You can also order a vegetarian menu and change some of the courses if you prefer something else.
Menu for children
There is a special menu for children under the age of 11. The menu consists of a starter, a main course to choose from, chocolate mud cake and beverages. You can opt for this menu on the boat itself.
Temporary Changes
Due to the flooding of the Seine River, from 8th March, and until further notice, dinner will be served with the boat moored at the Port of Bercy (75012 Paris), located on the right bank of the Seine between the Boulevard Poniatowski and the Bridge of Bercy.

Description:
Spend a fun-filled day cycling through the French capital with an expert English-speaking guide and discover the City of Lights’ most emblematic landmarks on this bike tour of Paris.
 Discovering Paris by bike 
 Admire the Eiffel Tower on your bike tour 
 The iconic Louvre Museum 
 Enjoying a tour of Paris by bike 
 Touring Paris by bike 
 The Centre Pompidou 
 Cycling around Paris 
 Explore the French capital by bike 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Paris Bike Tour
We will begin the tour on Avenue Foch at the selected time, ready to discover the most important monuments in the City of the Lights. You'll have the choice between doing the tour of Paris by standard bike or electric bike.
Whether you've just arrived in Paris or you know every corner of the French capital perfectly, this bike tour is the ideal way to see a new side of the city.
Pedal along the charming streets of the capital of France accompanied by your expert guide and admire the Eiffel Tower, the Arc de Triomphe, Place de la Concorde, the Centre Pompidou and the famous Louvre Museum.
By the end of the bike tour, you’ll be cycling around Paris like a true Parisian!
Child Seats and Trailers
Children under 8 may only participate by riding in a bike seat or trailer by paying an additional supplement on the day of the activity.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protection and safety, to help avoid the spread of Covid-19. Specifically, the provider of this tour will apply the following measures:

Description:
Explore the magnificent Palace of Versailles, the main residence of the French Royal Family from 1682 until 1789, on a full day-tour by bike! 
 Versailles gardens 
 Apollo Fountain in Versailles 
 Palace of Versailles 
 Inside the Palace of Versaille 
 
 
 
 
Itinerary
Greet your expert English-speaking guide and the rest of the group in a small park in Paris and set off to Versailles on a comfortable train.
Upon arrival in the quaint town of Versailles, hop on a bicycle and peddle to the renowned city market, where you will choose your picnic supplies (not included in the tour price). Next, you will ride to the Palace of Versailles and discover its beautiful grounds, packed with pretty tree-lined paths and winding trails. During the bike tour, you will stop numerous times to learn about the fascinating history of one of the most famous monuments of world heritage.
Once you get to the Grand Canal, park your bike and enjoy a delicious hand-picked picnic. With your energy restored, cruise through the grounds to visit Marie Antoinette’s Hamlet and the Petit Trianon, a small château commissioned by Louis XV of France. Afterwards, make your way to the Palace of Versailles, where you will be handed skip the line entrance tickets, so you can avoid the endless queues and walk straight in. Visit its striking rooms and learn about the beginning of the French Revolution with your English language audioguide. Then, discover the wonderful Hall of Mirrors, where the Treaty of Versailles was signed to end the First World War.
After an unforgettable day at one of the most famous palaces in the world, you will take the train back to Paris.
Important information
Activity level: Athletic cycling.
The bike tour will take place rain or shine, so please dress accordingly. If you don’t have a waterproof coat, you can purchase a rain poncho at our office.
All participants over 12 years old must be able to ride a bike. 
All participants under 18 must be accompanied by an adult. 
Please write in the comments section if you need special equipment for your children. 
If you are able please, bring a backpack to carry your food for our picnic lunch. We will visit the market upon our arrival (price of picnic are not included in tour price) to the town of Versailles and then stop for lunch several hours later. Please bring Euro cash for market supplies as well. 
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Flying over Paris is a truly unique experience and an incredible way to discover the captivating French capital from a new perspective. Enjoy unforgettable views of the Palace of Versailles, the Seine, the Bois de Boulogne and the Eiffel Tower from the air.
 The Eiffel Tower from the helicopter 
 Seeing the iconic French capital from a helicopter 
 Discover Paris's landmarks from the air 
 Paris by helicopter 
 A selfie with the helicopter 
 Landing after the helicopter ride 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Route
Your helicopter tour will first take you over the west of Paris, where you'll see the Bois de Boulogne, a huge public park whose natural greenery contrasts strikingly with the great city that surrounds it. Continue over the Longchamp Racecourse and the Parc de Saint-Cloud, until you reach the beautiful Palace of Versailles and its stunning gardens, one of the most visited places in France. The memory of this incredible bird's-eye view will stay with you forever!
You'll make a quick stop behind the palace, in Saint-Cyr l'Ecole, where your pilot will give you a quick theoretical lesson on flying a helicopter, as well as entertaining you with interesting facts about it.
Climb back into the helicopter to return to the heart of Paris. During your flight, you'll have the most amazing views over the City of Lights. Admire the French capital's world-famous sights from above, including the river Seine, the Montparnasse Tower and the Champ de Mars, before finishing off your tour with an incomparable panoramic view of the iconic Eiffel Tower.
Important information
We do our best to respect the time selected when the reservation is made. In case this is not possible, we will modify your booking to the nearest possible time and inform you of this by email.
The helicopter has a maximum capacity of 6 people plus the pilot.
Each person must carry their photographic ID.
The maximum weight limit per person cannot exceed 264 pounds (120 kg). If a passenger's weight exceeds 264 pounds (120 kg), to be allowed to fly they must pay for an additional seat at the aerodrome.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protection and safety, to help avoid the spread of Covid-19. Specifically, the provider of this tour will apply the following measures:
The use of masks is obligatory. The client must bring their own mask.
Alcohol gel will be available before, during, and after the service.
All those running the service (guide, driver etc...) will wear a mask throughout its duration.
The temperature of all attendees will be taken, and admission will be denied to those with a temperature of more than 37 degrees Celsius (99 Fahrenheit), and a full refund applied.

Description:
Spend an unforgettable evening contemplating the beautifully lit landmarks of Paris on this 4.5-hour bike tour, including a boat cruise along the River Seine.
 Latin Quarter at night 
 Île de la Cité at nighttime 
 Louvre Museum at night 
 
 
 
Itinerary
Greet your expert English-speaking guide and the rest of the group outside the Dupleix station of the Paris Métro as the sun is setting. After a brief safety explanation, hop on your bicycle and make your way to the lively Latin Quarter.
Ride through the picturesque streets of this vibrant area packed with pretty cafés and bistros and witness its great nightlife. Next, head to the Île de la Cité, a natural island in the Seine and centre of Paris. Here, you will stop for a mouthwatering ice-cream at Berthillon, the most famous ice cream shop in the capital.
With a full belly, marvel at the colorful sunset sky over the buildings’ rooftops as you cross the Pont des Arts Bridge. Keep peddling and enjoy magnificent views of the Louvre illuminated and then board a river boat and relax as you cruise along the city’s main waterway. Contemplate the waterfront monuments as you sip on a glass of wine or soft drink.
Once the night bicycle tour of Paris is finished, you will return to the starting point.
Important information​
This tour does not include entry to the monuments you ride past.
The bike tour will take place rain or shine, so please dress accordingly. If you don’t have a waterproof coat, you can purchase a rain poncho at our office.
All participants over 12 years old must be able to ride a bike. 
All participants under 18 must be accompanied by an adult. 
Please write in the comments section if you need special equipment for your children. 
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Ever been on a Segway? Spend a fun-filled two hours discovering the City of Lights on a two-wheeled electric vehicle with a guide.
 Segway 
 Alexander III Bridge 
 
 
Itinerary
After meeting the rest of your group at the indicated time, your specialized English-speaking guide will hand you a helmet and Segway and we’ll be ready to go.
Spend the next two hours cruising effortlessly along the fascinating streets of Paris and admiring its iconic landmarks. As you roll along, listen to stories about the French capital and its legends from your expert guide. Head to the Eiffel Tower, the most-visited monument in the world, and marvel at its wrought iron lattice structure from below.
Continue the tour to the École Militaire, a large complex for military training in central Paris. You will be astonished by the buildings’ elegant façades as you glide past. Find out from your guide what mysteries are hidden behind its walls.
Visit the tomb of Napoleon Bonaparte, the world-known military leader originally from Corsica, and then head to the Seine River, where we will cross the Pont Alexandre III, a beautifully decorated bridge with golden colored statues.
We will conclude our Segway tour of Paris by visiting the exterior of the Grand Palais, a striking edifice next to the Champs Elysées, which forms a monumental complex with the Petit Palais, and the Pont Alexandre III. Afterwards, we will return to the starting point.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

We currently don’t have any scheduled dates for this activity.
Check out all the activities in Paris 
Merry Christmas! Or as the French would say, Joyeux Noël! Explore the city of light during the most special time of year with this Paris Christmas Bike Tour.
 Christmas in Paris 
 Cycling around Paris 
 Christmas decorations around the city 
 Arch de Triomphe 
 Christmas market 
 Skating rink near the city hall 
 Christmas market next to the Eiffel Tower 
 Champs Elysees at Christmas 
 Enjoying the special time of year 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Paris Christmas Bike Tour
We'll meet at 7 pm at Avenue Foch to collect the bikes and go on a very special tour of Paris. Our first stop will be cycling around the Arc de Triomphe.
During the tour, we'll see the city's main monuments and find some Christmas trees. We'll visit the Eiffel Tower from the Trocadero viewpoint, admire the Louvre's facade, and pass by the National Palace of Les Invalides. The tour will also take us through the Christmas markets such as the Champ de Mars. 
We'll stop at a central square to enjoy a glass of mulled wine while we toast to Christmas and discover some curiosities of this season in France. 
The tour will end by crossing the famous Champs-Elysees while we take in the beautiful sight of it its millions of glistening lights. At 10 pm we'll arrive back at the starting point. 
Important Information
Children under the minimum age may participate as a companion in a seat by paying an additional supplement on the day of the activity.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protection and safety, to help avoid the spread of Covid-19. Specifically, the provider of this tour will apply the following measures:
Tours or activities will not consist of more than 10 people per group.
A safe distance of one metre between clients will be maintained whenever possible.
Alcohol gel will be available before, during, and after the service.
All those running the service (guide, driver etc...) will wear a mask throughout its duration.
Handing out of printed material such as maps or brochures will be avoided.
The transport used will be disinfected before and after each service and deep-cleaned every 24 hours.
Showing your voucher on your phone will be enough, and it is not necessary to print anything.
