Description:
Sample the local cuisine while touring past the must-see sights of the city of lights with this Paris Gourmet Bus Tour. You'll explore the French capital onboard a luxurious bus and enjoy a delicious lunch or dinner.
 Sightseeing with a twist 
 The city's impressive monuments 
 Inside the bus 
 Enjoy the dining experience 
 Pass by the Eiffel Tower 
 Watch the sunset over Paris 
 Sample the local cuisine 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Paris Gourmet Bus Tour
During the tour onboard this luxury moving restaurant you'll enjoy a delicious gourmet menu. You'll also have an audio guide in English that will reveal the history of the main monuments around the city.
Options
When making your reservation you can choose to have lunch or dinner on the bus. In both cases, the gourmet bus tour begins and ends at 2 Avenue Kléber, in front of the famous Arc de Triomphe in Paris.
Tour with Lunch (2 hours)
If you choose this option the bus will leave at 12 pm. During the tour, we'll see some of the most important locations in Paris including the Place du Trocadero and its magnificent views of the Eiffel Tower, the Place de la Concorde, the Paris Opera House and the Louvre Museum. 
While you admire the city's famous monuments you'll enjoy a four-course gourmet meal:
Sea bass carpaccio with pickled vegetables
Breaded salmon, pea cream and fennel confit
Marengo Veal
Profiteroles, praline puff pastry, Burbon vanilla ice cream, hot chocolate with golden hazelnut.

The tour will conclude with the arrival at Avenue Kléber at 2 pm.
Tour with Dinner (3 hours)
The tour will start at 7:30 pm. With this route through the centre of the French capital, you can admire how the city's monuments light up. From the bus, you'll see the iconic Avenue des Champs-Elysées, Notre-Dame Cathedral, the Parisian City Hall headquarters at the Hôtel de Ville and much more.
We'll make a 15 minute stop at Place Jacques Rueff so that you can photograph the light show at the Eiffel Tower. 
This option includes a succulent six-course gourmet dinner:
Sea bass carpaccio with pickled vegetables
Fried foie gras escalope with a Parisian-style emulsion of fried mushrooms
Breaded salmon, pea cream and fennel confit.
Marengo Veal
Brie cheese with pistachios
Profiteroles, praline puff pastry, Burbon vanilla ice cream, hot chocolate with golden hazelnut.

The tour will end at 10:30 pm at the same starting point.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Discover the beautiful city of Strasbourg with this fantastic walking tour. Our expert guides will give you a wonderful insight into the city - plus it's free!
 Streets in the centre of Strasbourg 
 Kleber Square 
 Strasbourg Cathedral 
 
 
 
Free Walking Tour of Strasbourg
We'll meet up at 11 am in Place de la Cathédrale, at the corner of Rue Mercière. From here, we'll begin our free walking tour of the centre of Strasbourg, capital of the Alsace region and the first city in France to have had its old town declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
A true jewel of late Gothic style, Strasbourg's Notre-Dame Cathedral was inspired by the cathedrals of Chartres, Paris and Reims. While we admire its impressive façade, our guide will reveal the legends surrounding this historic church, which dates back more than 1000 years.
We'll continue our stroll through Strasbourg and cross over the Ill, the river that surrounds the Grande-Île, the island on which the city's historic centre is located. After passing the city's main monuments, we'll delve into Strasbourg's past as we explore the German Quarter. This is the perfect opportunity to immerse yourself in the history and culture of the Alsatian capital!
During the free tour, we'll walk around some of Strasbourg's most famous squares including Place Gutenberg, Place de la République and Place Kléber. Our guide will also take us to see some of the city's less well-known but equally charming places of interest!
Our free walking tour of Strasbourg will come to an end back in front of the Cathedral.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Discover one of the Alsace's most impressive festive attractions with this Traditional Christmas Market Walking Tour. Enjoy the magical atmosphere around Strasbourg as you wander through the charming streets. 
 The festive atmosphere 
 The Christmas tree at Kléber Square 
 Strasbourg Cathedral 
 Visit the Christmas markets 
 Sample some French mulled wine 
 The traditional market stalls 
 Find some festive gifts 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Traditional Christmas Market Walking Tour
We'll meet at 5 pm at 5 Petite Rue du Vieux Marché aux Vins. From this central point, we'll head to Place Kléber, where one of the most famous Christmas markets in Strasbourg is located.
Here we'll see the giant Christmas tree around which the different stalls are distributed. As we walk around the beautifully decorated stalls and admire the lights, we'll explain the origins and traditions of the Christmas markets in the Alsace region. 
Place Kléber's Christkindelsmärik is the oldest Christmas market in Europe, dating back to 1570! In fact, from late November to early January, Strasbourg is considered the Christmas capital. During the tour, we'll find out which products are the most popular, and you can't miss out on sampling the vin chaud (mulled wine) and the kugelhopf cake.
The tour will continue by visiting the Notre-Dame Cathedral market, where you'll see the most sought after Christmas toys and decorations. As the region sits on the border between France and Germany, you'll find that most of these products represent a fusion between both cultures.
At 6 pm we'll conclude the tour at the cathedral market. From that moment on, you can visit the stalls that you like the most on your own.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
The Loire Valley is home to some of the country's most beautiful chateaux and stately homes. Fly over the Garden of France in a helicopter and enjoy incomparable views of the stunning scenery.
 Chateau d'Amboise 
 Helicopter flight over the castles of the Loire Valley 
 Helicopters ready to fly 
 Chateau Chambord 
 
 
 
 
Route
After meeting at Belleville Heliport near the small commune of Neuvy-le-Roi, you'll climb on board a helicopter and begin your unforgettable flying experience. Take off over some of the Loire Valley's most famous castles, or chateaux.
Throughout your 25 minute helicopter flight, you'll enjoy seeing the luscious French countryside and its magnificent architecture from a new perspective. Fly over the Domaine de la Haute-Barde, the fortress-like Meslay farm, and the Jallanges, Noizay and Amboise Chateaux. The latter, an ancient castle and former royal residence, is home to the Chapel of Saint-Hubert, where Leonardo da Vinci is buried.
Having enjoyed an incredible journey and the spectacular panoramic views of these amazing historic castles, you'll head back to the heliport where your tour will end.
Important information
We do our best to respect the time selected when the reservation is made. In case this is not possible, we will modify your booking to the nearest possible time and inform you of this by email.
The helicopter has a maximum capacity of 6 people plus the pilot.
Each person must carry their photographic ID.
The maximum weight limit per person cannot exceed 264 pounds (120 kg). If a passenger's weight exceeds 264 pounds (120 kg), to be allowed to fly they must pay for an additional seat at the aerodrome.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protection and safety, to help avoid the spread of Covid-19. Specifically, the provider of this tour will apply the following measures:
The use of masks is obligatory. The client must bring their own mask.
Alcohol gel will be available before, during, and after the service.
All those running the service (guide, driver etc...) will wear a mask throughout its duration.
The temperature of all attendees will be taken, and admission will be denied to those with a temperature of more than 37 degrees Celsius (99 Fahrenheit), and a full refund applied.

Description:
Discover the best of beautiful Toulouse on this guided walking tour of the "Pink City". You'll see its most important monuments, landmarks and squares. What's more, it's FREE!
 The Capitole de Toulouse, or City Hall 
 Views of Toulouse over the Saint-Jérôme Church 
 The Garonne River 
 
 
 
Toulouse Free Walking Tour Itinerary
Immerse yourself in the history, culture and architecture of the French city of Toulouse, exploring its elegant streets and squares with an English-speaking guide. You'll begin your free walking tour in the Place du Président Thomas Wilson, before making your way to the Cathédrale Saint-Étienne de Toulouse, the Toulouse Cathedral. Marvel at its striking mix of architectural styles, including Gothic, Romanesque and Baroque, the result of its many centuries of history and the fact that it was originally two separate churches! 
Not far from the Cathedral, you'll reach Toulouse's Fine Arts Museum, the Musée des Augustins. Housed in a former Augustine Monastery, the 14th century Gothic-style building is as much a piece of art as the more than 4000 works on display inside.
Continue your free walking tour to the magnificent Hôtel d'Assézat, a 16th century Renaissance palace that now houses an art gallery, before strolling down to the banks of the Garonne River to take in the views of the famous Pont Neuf, or New Bridge, which - despite its name- is almost 500 years old. 
Wandering alongside the river, you'll soon arrive at the enormous Church of the Jacobins, an iconic building whose incredible 13th century vaulted ceiling has been named "The Palm Tree" for its unique design.
Finally, you'll visit the largest Romanesque church in the world, the Saint Sernin Basilica, where your guide will reveal the myths and legends surrounding the building, before your tour comes to an end.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Discover the most important places of interest in the Georgian capital on the Tbilisi Tourist Bus and hop on and off to explore the historic centre at your leisure.
 Tbilisi Tourist Bus 
 Exploring Tbilisi's historic centre by bus 
 Freedom Square, Tbilisi 
 Tbilisi Old Town 
 Bridge of Peace 
 Metekhi Church 
 Historic centre of Tbilisi 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Tbilisi Tourist Bus Route & Stops
The Tbilisi Tourist Bus follows a comprehensive route around the monumental centre of the picturesque Georgian capital. The tour includes a total of 11 stops and you can choose whether you want to complete the route in full, which takes an hour and a half, or get off at the stops to explore the city on foot at your own pace.
Along the route, you'll see Liberty Square, Rustaveli Avenue, the Dry Bridge, the Tbilisi Opera House, the Metekhi Church and the Sulphur Baths. What's more, you'll learn fascinating facts about the history of the monuments and landmarks you pass thanks to a free English-language audioguide on board the bus.
The route that the bus will take is the red line. You can consult all the stops on the route via the following link:
Route & stops on the Tbilisi Tourist Bus
How does it work?
Once you get on the bus for the first time, your ticket will be activated. From that moment on, you can use the Tbilisi Tourist Bus for the next 24 hours, hopping on and off at your leisure at any of the 11 stops on the route.
Schedule & frequency
The Tbilisi Tourist Bus runs every half an hour during the following times:
November to February: between 10 am and 8 pm.
March to October: between 10 am and 9 pm.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Travel along the unique railway line from Borjomi to the village of Bakuriani with this Kukushka Train Day Trip from Tbilisi. Admire the mountain terrain and the beautiful rainforest.
 Kukushka railway 
 The Lesser Caucasus 
 Borjomi Natural Park 
 Kukushka train 
 Travel between Borjomi and Bakuriani 
 Bakuriani ski resort 
 The landscape around Bakuriani 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Kukushka Train Day Trip
At 9 am we'll meet at the Avlabari metro station in Tbilisi to begin a fascinating excursion to Borjomi, two and a half hours away. Once there, we'll take you directly to Kukushka train station for a journey to Bakuriani.
We'll board this legendary train which dates back to the 19th century. Did you know that it was the Romanov family who ordered its construction? It was carried out because of the reduced accessibility through the mountains and it was difficult to reach Bakuriani.  
We'll cross the Lesser Caucasus landscape, its amazing forests and the Tsemistskali River, whose bridge was designed by Gustave Eiffel. You'll be surprised!
After the train journey, we'll go to the Bakuriani ski resort, which is the most famous in Georgia! If you wish, you can do some winter sports or have lunch. 
At 4:30 pm we'll leave Bakuriani. On the way back to Tbilisi we'll stop for an hour at the Borjomi Nature Park. You'll have the opportunity to sample the natural water.
We'll arrive back in Tbilisi at 9 pm.
 
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Discover the capital of Georgia as comfortably as possible with this Tbilisi Tourist Bus & Boat + Mtskheta Tour. See the city's main monuments, enjoy the views from the water and visit the former capital.
 Kartlis Deda sclupture in the Sololaki district 
 Tbilisi tourist bus 
 Explore the city centre 
 Enjoy the boat tour 
 Metekhi bridge 
 Turtle Lake 
 Metekhi Church 
 Views of Mtskheta 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Tbilisi Tourist Bus & Boat + Mtskheta Tour
This combo gives you access to three bus lines, plus a boat ride in Tbilisi.
Tbilisi Tourist Bus
The Tbilisi tourist bus follows the red line route, with 11 stops in total and you can choose whether you want to complete the tour in an hour and a half, or get off and on while you discover the city at your own pace. On board you'll visit the Dry Bridge Market, the Metekhi Temple, the Peace Bridge and much more.
Tbilisi Panoramic Tour
The second route follows the green line, with a panoramic tour in which you'll spend three hours discovering the area around the Holy Trinity Cathedral, the Turtle Lake and the Mtatsminda Park. From this last point, you'll get a perfect view of the city centre.
Mtskheta Tour
The last route follows the blue line and will take you on a tour of Mtskheta, a UNESCO World Heritage city. The three-hour tour includes an English speaking guided tour around this former Georgian capital and a wine tasting.
Boat Tour
We'll enjoy a 30 minute boat ride admiring the city from a unique perspective. You won't stop taking pictures!
Tourist Bus route and stops
You can check all the routes here: Route and stops of the Tbilisi tourist bus 
How it works
Once you board the tourist bus for the first time, your ticket will be activated. From then on, you can use the Tbilisi tourist bus red line for 48 hours. You can get on and off the bus as many times as you like at any of its stops.
The green line, blue line and the boat can only be used once. When you book you should indicate when you want to participate in the panoramic tour, Mtskheta tour and the boat ride. 
Timetable
Tbilisi tourist bus red line passes by all stops every 30 minutes at the following time:
November to February: 10 am - 8 pm
March to October: 10 am - 9 pm

Description:
Sail down the Kura River and enjoy the incredible views of Georgia's capital city from a unique perspective with this Tbilisi Boat Tour. You'll pass by cliffs, the Metekhi church, Rike Park and more. 
 Enjoy the boat ride 
 Explore Tbilisi by boat 
 Metekhi Church 
 The Bridge of Peace 
 Metekhi Bridge 
 Cruise along the Kura River 
 Discover the city 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Tbilisi Boat Tour
We'll meet at 44 Kote Abkhazi Street, in the heart of Tbilisi's historical centre. From this point, we'll show you how to get to the pier located a few minutes walk away. 
The boat will be waiting for you by the Metekhi bridge and start cruising along the Kura River contemplating the steep relief of the banks.
We'll visit the 13th century church of the Assumption in Metekhi, the King Vakhtang Gorgasali sculpture, the Royal Baths, Rike Park... The tour will also take us to the Peace Bridge, one of the most symbolic bridges in Tbilisi due to its modernist style in an environment full of history. If you choose to sail at night you'll enjoy the incredible view of the illuminated buildings. 
The tour will end by returning to the original dock, next to the Metekhi Bridge, after half an hour sailing through Georgian waters.
Timetable
The boats operate every day between 11 am and 10 pm with a frequency of between 20 and 25 minutes.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Explore the capital of Georgia in the most comfortable way with this Tbilisi Bus Tour that will take you around the city's main monuments and tourist attractions. You'll pass by the Holy Trinity Cathedral, the Michael Meskhi Stadium and much more.
 Ethnographic Museum in Tbilisi 
 The historic centre

Tbilisi Bus Tour
After meeting at the time indicated, we'll board the sightseeing bus in which we'll enjoy a tour around Tbilisi's main tourist attractions. 
We'll pass through the old town, the Independence Square, the embassy district, the Michael Meskhi Stadium, the open-air Ethnography Museum, the Svaneti Tower and much more. Accompanied by the guide you'll find out many interesting facts relating to these locations. 
The route will also have three stops lasting 25 minutes each. You can get off the bus to take pictures and walk around the Holy Trinity Cathedral, Turtle Lake and Mtatsminda Park. From Mtatsminda Park you'll have a perfect view of downtown Tbilisi.
The tour will end by returning to the meeting points after three hours.
Pick up

24 Rustaveli Avenue: 11:10 am or 3:10 pm, for the afternoon tour

Description:
Discover the monuments, streets and squares of Berlin with this tour, ideal to get to know the German capital at first glance. What's more, it's FREE!
 Berlin Cathedral 
 The Brandenburg Gate 
 The Holocaust Monument 
 
 
 
Berlin Free Tour
The tour begins at the Brandenburg Gate, a fitting location as one of Berlin's most emblematic sights. It is one with a long history, from its origins in the 18th century built by Prussian king Frederick William II, it was the entry to Unter den Linden, the renowned boulevard of linden trees, which led directly to the royal palace.
And the tour continues to take in the pivotal locations in Berlin's storied history, such as Checkpoint Charlie, (the best known crossing point between East and West Berlin and symbol of the Cold War) The Berlin Wall itself, the Führerbunker, the Luftwaffe HQ (the German airforce headquarters) and the book burning memorial. This tour will illuminate how Berlin shaped the world in the 20th century, and turned from a symbol of division into a symbol of unification and hope.
Important Information
The tour has an average length of 2.5 hours, usually ending at Bebelplatz. However, the guides with whom we work will vary their route depending on the best interests of your group.
This tour is designed for small groups and individual travellers. Larger groups are not permitted. If you are a group of more than 6, please take a look at our private tours of Berlin.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protection and safety, to help avoid the spread of Covid-19. Specifically, the provider of this tour will apply the following measures:
Alcohol gel will be available before, during, and after the service.
Handing out of printed material such as maps or brochures will be avoided.
Showing your voucher on your phone will be enough, and it is not necessary to print anything.

Description:
Sail along the River Spree that weaves through Berlin’s historic centre on a one-hour boat cruise. Enjoy the breath-taking views of the city’s iconic landmarks, including the Reichstag and the Museum Island from the water.
 Cruise boat next to the Reichstag 
 Sailing past the Berliner Dom 
 Enjoying a cruise down the Spree 
 Berlin's TV Tower 
 Paul Löbe Building 
 Berlin from the river 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Berlin Boat Tour
The river cruise departs from the following 2 piers:
Nikolaiviertel, in front of the Museum Island.
Friedrichstraße, next to the Weidendammer Bridge.
Take a seat either inside or outside and marvel at the impressive riverfront edifices like the enormous Reichstag building, the various elegant institutions on Museum Island and Fernsehturm, the legendary Television Tower located in Alexanderplatz.
While you sail down the river, listen to the interesting pre-recorded commentary in English and learn about the history of Berlin and its main sights.
Schedule and frequency
From the Nikolaiviertel pier:
January and February: 11 am and 3:30 pm
From 9th of March to 24th of December: 11 am, 12 pm, 12:30 pm, 1:30 pm, 2 pm, 3 pm, 3:30 pm and 4:30 pm
From the Friedrichstraße pier:
From 1st of April to the 3rd of November: from 10:30 am to 5:30 pm every half hour.
From 9th of March to 24th of December: 11:55 am, 12:50 pm, 1:25 pm, 2:25 pm, 2:55 pm and 3:55 pm
25th and 26th December: 1:25, 2:55 and 3:55 pm
How Does it Work?
During the available time slots, you can embark on a boat whenever you want from any of the two piers we mentioned previously. You must simply show an employee your printed voucher and enjoy a one-hour cruise along the Spree.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Enjoy a 3.5-hour cruise down Spree River and Landwehr Canal, and discover Berlin from a different point of view. This is a must experience when visiting the capital of Germany!
 Sailing along Landwehr Canal 
 Enjoying a river cruise in Berlin 
 Oberbaum Bridge 
 Charlottenburg Palace 
 Landwehr Canal 
 Berlin Cathedral 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Berlin Spree and Landwehr Canal Boat Tour
Go aboard the cruise boat at Pier Jannowitzbrücke and sit back while you drift along the city’s main waterway that runs through the Old Town.
The boat cruise sails along the impressive Spree River that flows along Germany and the Czech Republic. Marvel at the unique Museum Island, the Reichstag building and the iconic Oberbaum Bridge, one of the most famous overpasses in Berlin.
This Berlin river boat cruise will also navigate down part of Landwehr Canal, which was established in the nineteenth century and stretches for 10 kilometres. It connects Spree and Charlottenburg, so you will sail past the striking Charlottenburg Palace.
Your audioguide will reveal the history of this fascinating city and of the main monuments, you go past as you enjoy one of a kind panoramic views. After a memorable cruise, you’ll be dropped off at your starting point.
Timetables 
The boats leave the Jannowitzbrücke quay daily at 10 am, 11 am, 2 pm and 3 pm.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
The tourist bus of Berlin stops at all the main landmarks around this beautiful city. Enjoy the German capital from a unique perspective thanks to this comfortable double decker open top vehicle.
 The tourist bus of Berlin 
 Berlin Cathedral 
 On the top deck of the bus 
 Bradenburg Gate 
 Gendarmenmarkt 
 Reichstag 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Routes and stops
The Berlin sightseeing bus makes two 120-minute routes through the historical city. During the journey, you will hear recorded commentary on the iconic places that you see. Some of the most interesting stops are the Olympic stadium, Neptune fountain, and Brandenburg Gate.
You can consult the different routes and stops on the map by clicking on the following link:
Routes and stops of the Berlin tourist bus
How it works
You can hop on and off the bus service as many times as you want during the contracted period of time. This means you can discover the Brandenburg Gate, Checkpoint Charlie, Television Tower, the Holocaust Memorial, and East Side Gallery - a small part of the Berlin Wall.
Important information

After you have made the booking, we will send you an email with a voucher attached. You must show this voucher on the first bus that you take.

Wall Tour: every day, every 30 minutes, between 10 am and 4 pm.

Description:
Enjoy a relaxing 2,5-hour evening boat cruise along the winding Spree River in Berlin and admire the beautifully lit buildings and streets on either side of the river.
 Sailing past Berliner Dom on a night cruise 
 Enjoy the night river cruise in Berlin 
 Charlottenburg Palace 
 Spectacular sunset over Berlin 
 Sailing down the River Spree 
 Views from the boat cruise 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Berlin Evening Boat Cruise
Discover Berlin’s emblematic landmarks lit up from the water on a night river cruise along the city’s main waterway.
Depart from Pier Friedrichstraße and find a comfortable seat on the vessel’s glass covered deck. Gaze at the capital’s most famous buildings, including the Reichstag building, the impressive Bellevue Palace, official residence of the President of Germany and the colorful Berlin Cathedral (in German: Berliner Dom).
Sail down Landwehr Canal (Landwehrkanal) that connects River Spree with Charlottenburg and gaze at the stunning Charlottenburg Palace. It really comes to life at night!
While you revel in this romantic and unique tour of Berlin, linking its past and its present and immersing you in the history of all the monuments you sail past.
After an enjoyable cruise, the route finishes at Pier Friedrichstraße.
Illumination of monuments
Although this boat trip takes place in the evening, it is not always possible to see the monuments of Berlin illuminated: it depends on the time of year in which you take the tour. In the German capital it usually gets dark early between the end of October and the beginning of April. During the rest of the year the city has more hours of daylight.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Explore Berlin on two wheels on this free bike tour! You'll explore the most emblematic places in the city, and learn all about them thanks to our expert, English-speaking guide.
 Cycling by the Reichstag in Berlín 
 Enjoying the free Berlin bike tour 
 Cycling by the Brandenburg Gate 
 Bikes on Museum Island in Berlin 
 Gendarmenmarkt Square in Berlin 
 Unter Den Linden 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Free Berlin Bike Tour
Our free bike tour of Berlin will start outside the central Hotel Eurostars on Friedrichstraße street at 10:30 am. From here, we'll cycle to the nearby Museum Island, which will be the first stop on our route.
On Museum Island, known in German as Museumsinsel, there's so much to be seen! You'll be able to admire the impressive 20th-century Berlin Cathedral, located on the banks of the River Spree. Plus, as we continue cycling, you'll see the Altes Museum (Old Museum), the Neues Museum (New Museum) and the Pergamon Museum. 
Next, we'll pedal our way to the Unter den Linden. At the end of this historic street, you'll find the Bebelplatz square and the Gendarmenmarkt, where you'll see two twin buildings. Do you know the history behind them? There's far more history to discover, as we carry on past the Berlin Wall, Potsdamer Platz and the Holocaust Memorial. We'll stop at all of these, and our expert guide will help you to gain a deeper understanding of some of the most significant events of the 20th century.
We'll continue cycling through the Tiergarten park, Berlin's green heart, and in this area, you'll be able to see many more of the city's emblematic monuments, including the Brandenburg Gate and the Reichstag parliament building.
After three hours, this free bike tour will come to an end back at Friedrichstraße.
Important Information
Before starting the tour, you must pay a € 15 (US$ 17.80) deposit per person. This will be returned to you in full at the end of the tour providing the bike has not been damaged at all. 
You must be at least 16 years old to take part in this tour.
This free tour is not available for groups of more than 6 people. If you're part of a larger group, why not check out our private tour of Berlin.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protection and safety, to help avoid the spread of Covid-19. Specifically, the provider of this tour will apply the following measures:
A safe distance of one metre between clients will be maintained whenever possible.
The use of masks is obligatory. The client must bring their own mask.
All those running the service (guide, driver etc...) will wear a mask throughout its duration.
Handing out of printed material such as maps or brochures will be avoided.
The transport used will be disinfected before and after each service and deep-cleaned every 24 hours.
Showing your voucher on your phone will be enough, and it is not necessary to print anything.
Alcoholic drinks are not available.

Description:
Discover Berlin at your own pace, on two wheels. Exploring the city on bicycle is a comfortable, quick, and unique way to see every hidden treasure.
 Making a stop during the bike route 
 Touring Berlin on bicycles 
 
 
Berlin Bike Rental
You can collect your bike simply by attending the reception of Hotel Eurostars Berlin between the hours of 9 am and 1 pm.
You can then spend the day exploring the beautiful city of Berlin in a comfortable and unique way on two wheels. The city is designed especially for this fun form of transport with more than 380 miles of bike lanes!
To really get a feel for the city and its history, we recommend that you follow a route along the Berlin Wall which takes a total of 5 hours. If you prefer a gentler ride and would like to see some nature, you can pedal alongside the Spree river, or around the sprawling Tiergarten park in the heart of the city.
A good option for history lovers and culture vultures is the route through East Berlin. This itinerary departs from Alexander Platz and continues along the Karl Marx Allee boulevard taking you past the most historically and architecturally important landmarks.
At the end of the tour, all you need to do is drop the bikes back at the original pick up point.

Description:
Discover a different side to Cochem as you cruise along the River Moselle. Enjoy picturesque views of a medieval castle, vineyards, fairytale-like houses and so much more! 
 Cochem castle 
 Views of the city from the River Moselle 
 Views of Cochem 
 
 
 
Cochem River Cruise
We'll meet at the chosen time at Moselpromenade jetty ready to board the tourist boat. Once on board, we'll start our cruise of the River Moselle.
From the river, you'll have unique panoramic views of the medieval city of Cochem, which enchants tourists and locals alike with is fairytale-like houses surrounded by a luscious green valley. Plus, you'll be able to admire the city's most important monument: the castle. Also known as Reichsburg, this fortress stands tall on the hilltop, looking over the city with its neo-gothic towers.
On this peaceful river cruise, you'll have views of the colourful, wooden houses with pointed roofs which will make you feel like you've travelled back in time to when the city was founded in the year 866.
As you relax on board, you'll also see the vineyards that surround the city. Did you know that some of the best wines in Germany are made here? You'll also learn more about the city thanks to an audio-guide in English.
Finally, we'll sail back to the initial meeting point at Moselpromenade and the river cruise will come to an end.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Discover the secrets of the biggest city on the Rhine on this free tour of Cologne's unmissable sights. Be seduced by the charm of the historic Town Hall, the Rheingarten, the Cathedral and much more.
 The historic centre of Cologne 
 Fischmarkt 
 The Cologne Cathedral 
 
 
 
Free Walking Tour of Cologne
The tour meets in Domtreppen, the cathedral stairs located in front of Cologne Central Station. From there, we'll head to the Heinzelmännchenbrunnen fountain, so named after some curious gnomes connected to the city of Cologne... mysterious!
Following our route, we'll see more of the city's most iconic monuments, like the Rathaus or City Hall, the Rheingarten, a park beside the River Rhine, and the Fischmarkt or Fish Market Square.
The next stop will be next to a curious monumental fountain known as Willi Ostermann Brunnen, before we stroll past two of Cologne's most outstanding museums, the Wallraf - Richartz and the Kolumba. Wandering onwards, we'll reach Dufthaus 4711. Did you know that this shop is one of Cologne's most famous perfumeries?
We'll then make a stop in front of the EL-DE Haus, former headquarters of the Gestapo. Our free tour will come to an end near the Kölnisches Stadtmuseum and the Römerbrunnen fountain, which also has an intriguing history that we'll discover on the day.
Important information
Groups of over 6 people will not be allowed to participate in the Cologne Free Walking Tour.
Children must be accompanied by an adult. There is a maximum of three children per adult.
This free walking tour does not enter any monument, just visiting the outside.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protection and safety, to help avoid the spread of Covid-19. Specifically, the provider of this tour will apply the following measures:
Tours or activities will not consist of more than 12 people per group.
A safe distance of one metre between clients will be maintained whenever possible.
The use of masks is obligatory. The client must bring their own mask.
Handing out of printed material such as maps or brochures will be avoided.
Showing your voucher on your phone will be enough, and it is not necessary to print anything.

Description:
Discover Cologne on an unforgettable boat trip along the River Rhine. You'll learn about the city's fascinating history while admiring its most famous monuments.
 Boat trip around Cologne 
 Enjoying a boat ride along the Rhine 
 The Rhine River 
 
 
 
Boat Trip in Cologne
After arriving at the Frankenwerft dock, just five minutes from the famous Cologne Cathedral, we'll sail off on our boat trip along the River Rhine. 
Cologne is one of the oldest cities in Germany and dates back to the establishment of a Roman colony in the 1st century AD. During this magical boat trip along the Rhine, you'll be able to listen to an audio guide in English and seven other languages on the history of Cologne and interesting facts about the city's main monuments. 
This cruise will allow you to enjoy panoramic views of Germany's fourth most populated city. We'll stroll along the wooden Frankenwerft promenade and admire the traditional coloured houses that stand tall in the Fischmarkt square. We'll visit the Hohenzollern bridge, which is crossed by over 1,200 trains every day, the Cologne Cathedral and Twelve Romanesque churches of Cologne in the old quarter.
After an hour's boat trip around Cologne, we'll head back to our starting point.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
This sunset boat trip on the Rhine is the perfect romantic option for you and your partner whilst visiting Cologne. You will enjoy unforgettable views as the last warm rays of the setting sun cast this beautiful city in a gorgeous warm glow.
 Hohenzollern bridge and Cologne Cathedral 
 Cologne at sunset seen from the boat 
 Enjoying the sunset boat cruise 
 A panoramic view of Cologne in the evening 
 
 
 
 
Sunset Boat Cruise on the Rhine
We set sail from the Frankenwerft jetty, and head out onto the Rhine as the warm sunset light stains the buildings and bridges of Cologne.
For the next 2 hours, we will drift along this enigmatic river admiring the medieval buildings of the old town and the silhouette of the magnificent Hohenzollern bridge that dominates the cityscape. As the sun begins to fall behind the horizon, you will see the beautiful cathedral and the illuminated bell towers rising from the illuminated Romanesque basilicas. We will pass the colorful houses of Fischmarkt square and enjoy the views of the tree-lined promenade that runs along the river bank.
The sunset cruise will allow you to contemplate Cologne from an exclusive perspective. If you want, you can also have a drink or snack at the onboard bar (not included) while admiring the urban panorama.
At the end of the boat ride, we will return to the starting point.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Get to know the ancient pearl of European Baroque with a Free Walking Tour of Dresden, where you'll wander through the centre of a city hit by the Second World War.
 Zwinger Palace 
 Semper Opera 
 Holy Trinity Cathedral 
 Fürstenzug 
 Zwinger Palace gardens 
 Frauenkirche church 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Free Walking Tour Dresden
King John I of Saxony will welcome us from his pedestal at Theaterplatz, one of the most important squares in the capital of Saxony. The tour will start from the meeting point under the statue and in front of the famous opera Semper.
Here, we'll learn more about the Wettin dynasty that inspired the culture, architecture and art in this German city. We'll also admire the opera house's elegant facade, which was completely rebuilt after the bombings during World War II.
Our next stop will be Zwinger Palace, known worldwide as a true Baroque jewel. Surrounded by beautiful fountains and the scene of majestic royal parties, this building was built on a site where a fortress once stood. Following on, we'll see Dresden Palace, which houses the treasures of the Saxon monarchy.
The tour will continue through the old town to the Holy Trinity Cathedral, Hofkirche, the largest religious building in Saxony, and along a curious street where we'll come across the Fürstenzug. Did you know that this is the longest tiled mural in the world?
The tour will finish in front of the symbolic Church of Our Lady, Frauenkirche, a clear example of the reconstruction of the city after the devastation of the Great War.
Important Information
We won't go inside any of the monuments mentioned in the description.
Reservations for more than 6 people are not available. If you are a larger group, you can book a private tour of Dresden.
Minors must be accompanied by an adult. The maximum allowed is 3 minors for each adult.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Dresden Tourist Bus
The Dresden Tourist Bus goes on a two-hour route around the city with over 22 stops at the main tourist attractions in Saxony's capital, so you can find out why it's one of Germany's most visited cities. During the tour, you'll have an audio guide available in English.
The bus runs through the old town of Dresden and some of its most interesting stops are the Zwinger Palace, the Semperoper Opera House, Dresden Castle and the Albertinum.
Check out the route and the stops on this map.
Validity
The ticket is valid for 1 day from the time it is first used. During this time you can get on and off the buses as many times as you like to see the most emblematic places in Dresden.
If you use your ticket for the first time after 4 pm, it will also be valid for the following day.
Timetable and Frequency
The Dresden Tourist Bus departs every day at the following times:
April to October: 9.30 am to 10 pm every 15-30 minutes.
November to March: from 9:30 am to 8 pm every 30-60 minutes.

Description:
The city of Düsseldorf is so much more than a modern business hub. Discover the secrets buried in its historic centre and the beautiful buildings hidden in its ancient streets.
 Pretty buildings in the historic centre of Düsseldorf 
 Aldstadt 
 
 
Itinerary
Explore the most iconic sights of Düsseldorf's old town: at the heart of the metropolis lie historic churches and buildings that managed to survive the bombings of World War II.
The tour will start right in the centre of Altstadt, or the Old Town, where you'll see the curious twisted spire of the Gothic Sankt Lambertus church. The Roman Catholic church dates back to the 14th century, and is home to relics of Apollinaris, the patron saint of Düsseldorf.
Pass by the equestrian statue of Jan Wellem in the Markplatz, where the Rathaus, or town hall, is also located. The sculpture is one of the city's most famous, and is dedicated to an extremely important figure in Düsseldorf's history.
You'll continue your tour through Burgplatz, one of the most charming areas of this German city. Admire the impressive Schlossturm tower, a 33 metre tall building on the banks of the Rhine that is the only remaining part of the city's old palace. From here, wander along the river promenade to enjoy stunning views of Düsseldorf.
If you get thirsty at any point on the tour - no problem. This area of the city is also known as the longest bar in the world, as it boasts as many as 300 bars, restaurants, cafes and pubs within a half square mile radius.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protection and safety, to help avoid the spread of Covid-19. Specifically, the provider of this tour will apply the following measures:
A safe distance of one metre between clients will be maintained whenever possible.
The use of masks is obligatory. The client must bring their own mask.

Description:
A boat trip on the beautiful Rhine river is one of the best ways to get to know Düsseldorf. On this cruise, you will discover the captivating old town and the modern port district.
 The boat cruise of Dusseldorf 
 Dusseldorf's old town 
 Enjoying the ride along the Rhine 
 The Rhine Tower and buildings designed by Frank Gehry 
 The riverside walkway 
 
 
 
 
 
Boat Tour of Dusseldorf
Setting off from the jetty in the center of Düsseldorf, we will head out onto the enigmatic Rhine river that runs through the city.
Düsseldorf is one of Germany's financial hubs and is considered one of the most pleasant cities to live in. During this one hour cruise, you will learn about all the important landmarks and the history of the city, thanks to the onboard audio guide.
This fantastic boat trip around Düsseldorf lets you enjoy the most exclusive views of the city. In the port district on the banks on the Rhine, the headquarters of international companies are housed in impressive modern buildings designed by famous architects such as Frank Gehry and Norman Foster. In this are, you will also see the iconic Der Rheinturm, (Rhine Tower), the unmistakable symbol of the city.
As we pass through the old town, we will admire the stylized tower of the Basilica of St. Lambertus and the historic Rathaus (the City Hall), two Renaissance buildings that resisted the destruction of World War II, which was heavily felt in Dusseldorf.
The Rhine river cruise ends by returning to the original departure point.

Description:

 Düsseldorf boat ride 
 Düsseldorf 
 Rhine River 
 Sunset cruise in Düsseldorf

 Düsseldorf at night 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Düssledorf Sunset Cruise
At 8 pm we'll meet at Burgplatz wharf near the Old Town of Düsseldorf and board a boat that will take us on a two-hour cruise to admire this iconic German city from the Rhine River.
As we sail along the river we'll discover some of the most important architectural gems of Düsseldorf such as the Media Harbour, the Rhine Tower, Saint Lambert's Basilica and the Rathaus, the old City Hall. What's more, the city skyline is even more beautiful when it's lit up by the glow of the sunset!
Throughout the tour, you'll also have an audio guide that will tell you fascinating information about the city and its monuments.
At the end of the boat ride, we'll sail back to the departure point for around 10 pm.

Description:
Discover the old town of one of Germany's largest cities on this Frankfurt Free Walking Tour. You'll see how its wooden houses combine perfectly with its imposing skyscrapers.
 St. Bartholomaus Cathedral 
 Frankfurt Skyline 
 The European Central Bank 
 Frankfurt Opera 
 
 
 
 
Frankfurt Free Walking Tour
We'll meet in the centrally located St. Bartholomaus Cathedral, which in the 18th century received the title of "Imperial Church", as the Germanic emperors were crowned here. From there we'll begin our guided tour of the most symbolic spots around the European Union's financial capital, such as its city hall.
In this beautiful and colourful corner, we'll tell you the German city's origins and how it has evolved. As we discover Frankurt's past we'll walk around the old town past its small pastel-coloured houses with wooden frames.
The tour will then continue on to St. Paul's Church, which was chosen as the seat of Frankfurt's Parliament in the mid-19th century because of its oval shape. We'll carry on through the city's financial district, and encounter its impressive skyscrapers. Did you know that this area is nicknamed "Mainhattan"? The European Central Bank, the financial headquarters of the European Union, is located there, and the euro monument is located at its entrance.
The Frankfurt Free Walking Tour will end at the Main riverbank, at the Eisener Steg. The bridge is famous for its panoramic view of the city's skyline. 
Important Information
This tour doesn't accept bookings for groups of more than 6 people. If you're a group of more than 6, you should book the Private Tour of Frankfurt.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
A boat trip on the river Main is one of the best ways to see the elegant city of Frankfurt. On this cruise, you will discover the captivating medieval quarter, and admire the modern skyline of the city, from a unique point of view.
 Cruise on the Main River 
 The financial district of Frankfurt seen from the boat 
 The boat trip through Frankfurt 
 
 
 
Boat Cruise from Frankfurt
Setting off from the jetty in the center of Frankfurt, we will begin a fantastic boat trip along the beautiful Main River that runs through Frankfurt.
Frankfurt is the financial center of Europe and is famous for its skyline, the variety of museums that line the banks of the river (Museumsufer), and St. Paul's Church (Paulskirche) - a desecrated shrine that now hosts exhibitions and events. During the hour-long cruise, you will learn all about the principle landmarks that you can see from the boat and the fascinating history of Frankfurt by listening to the onboard audio guide.
The boat ride in Frankfurt will let you enjoy the best views of the city whilst drifting under its fantastic bridges. You will admire the beautiful medieval buildings of the medieval quarter next to the River Main, which was rebuilt after being bombed during World War II. You will also see the spectacular skyline of the modern financial district.​
The Main River cruise ends when we return to the original departure point.

Description:
Explore the top locations of Frankfurt in a comfortable and entertaining way, on board this tourist bus. You will discover the charms of the capital of Hesse while you enjoy the breathtaking panoramic views across the city.
 The skyline of Frankfurt 
 The medieval neighbourhood of Romer 
 The Opera house 
 
 
 
Routes and stops
The Frankfurt tourist bus makes follows a complete route through the principal places of interest around the city. During the route, you will enjoy the audio commentary about the locations that you are passing. From its panoramic roof, you will have unique views across the entire city!
Some of the most interesting landmarks included in the 13 stops on the itinerary are Central Station (one of the largest in Europe), Embankment, the Central European Bank, St. Peter's church, the Römer building, and the financial district.
You can consult the different routes and stop on the map by clicking on this link.
How it works
When making the reservation you must choose the duration of the ticket for the tourist bus.
The one hour ticket allows you to ride the bus for 60 minutes and take a comprehensive tour of the most important monuments around the city.
If you choose a one day ticket, you can climb on and off the buses as many times as you want during the chosen day.
After you have made the reservation, we will send you an email with a voucher that you must present when you use the bus service for the first time.
Times and frequency
This sightseeing bus of Frankfurt departs every 30 minutes between 9:15 am and 6 pm. The duration of the complete route is approximately one hour.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protection and safety, to help avoid the spread of Covid-19. Specifically, the provider of this tour will apply the following measures:
A safe distance of one metre between clients will be maintained whenever possible.
The use of masks is obligatory. Masks will be given to those clients who do not have their own.
Alcohol gel will be available before, during, and after the service.
All those running the service (guide, driver etc...) will wear a mask throughout its duration.
Disinfected radio units will be provided, and headphones will be single-use.
Handing out of printed material such as maps or brochures will be avoided.
The transport used will be disinfected before and after each service and deep-cleaned every 24 hours.
Alcoholic drinks are not available.

Description:
Discover both the fascinating past and exciting future of the European Union's financial capital, when you take our brilliant tour of Frankfurt. Towering skyscrapers, medieval buildings, and museums on the banks of the river Main all await you.
 During the panoramic tour 
 In the central area of Romer 
 The skyline of Frankfurt 
 
 
 
Panoramic Tour of Frankfurt
We will meet in Wiesenhüttenstraße, in the heart of Frankfurt, to begin our guided tour of the city of Main. On this two-hour tour, you'll discover the contrasts of the city, that is now the financial capital of the European Union.
From the bus, you'll see one of the city's most iconic buildings: the central station, one of the largest train stations in Europe! You'll also see the Embankment Museum, the picturesque Old Sachsenhausen neighbourhood, the River Main, the medieval buildings in Römer Square and the financial district with its impressive skyscrapers.
We will then take a stop in Römer Square to take a walking tour of the historic heart of the city. In this medieval district, you will encounter the Town Hall, the Church of St. Paul and numerous guild houses.
The tour will continue on board the bus, giving you the chance to see the Old Opera House and we'll finish by the Congress Center Messe Frankfurt.

Description:
Discover the charm of Hamburg on this free walking tour of the city centre. Learn all about its history from pirates to World War II bombardments as you explore its most important monuments.
 The Hamburg Town Hall 
 The urban canals in the city 
 Deichstrasse, Hamburg's oldest street 
 
 
 
Free Walking Tour of Hamburg
The tour meets in the Hamburg Town Hall Square - beginning our free tour by getting to know the town hall itself - a neo-renaissance building with more than 640 rooms. As we wander through the narrow Hamburg streets, we will reveal the details of operation Gomorra, the bombardment of the city during the Second World War.
One of Hamburg's most notable characteristics is the large number of urban canals which cross the metropolis known as the "City of Rivers". We'll walk along the banks of the river Elba to see Germany's largest port, discovering the exciting story of the pirate Störtebeker.
Jumping into the Middle Ages, we will dive into the details of the Hanseatic League as we visit Sant Petri, Hamburg's medieval church. We wil also pass through one of the most beautiful areas of the city: Deichstrasse - and a collection of narrow streets from the 17th century, making them the oldest streets in Hamburg, which survived the great fire which destroyed a large part of the city in 1842.
To finish our guided tour we will visit the church of St. Nicholas and through the main streets which leave the Hamburg port. The tour will finish in the HafenCity area, on Am Sandtorkai street on the corner with Kehrwiedersteg. 
Important information
Children under 13 must be accompanied by an adult.
It is not possible to take the free tour if your group is larger than 6 people - in this case, take a look at our  
Hamburg Sightseeing Private Tour

All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Explore Hamburg on board a sightseeing bus and stop at the city’s most emblematic sights. Tour the city in a different way on a double-decker open-top bus!
 Touring the city of Hamburg on a sightseeing bus 
 Hamburg Hop On Hop Off bus 
 Discovering Hamburg by bus 
 
 
 
Route and stops
The Hamburg Hop-On Hop-Off bus offers visitors one route and 15 stops at the main tourist attractions of the city. The best part of this tour is that you can decide where to get off and back on, meaning you can combine visiting Hamburg by foot and discovering it from the bus's open-top deck.
If you wish to sit back and enjoy the whole tour, the bus route takes approximately 1 hour and 40 minutes.
The bus will drive past iconic sights like Hamburg City Hall, an imposing white-colored building with a showy blueish-greenish roof. You can also get off at Speicherstadt, a charming neighborhood, believed to be the world’s largest warehouse district, full of interesting anecdotes you will learn about during the tour.
Visitors can visit these and other landmarks thanks to the Hamburg Hop-On Hop-Off bus. The following link includes information about its route and stops:​
Hamburg sightseeing bus
How does it work?
Once you’ve reserved the Hamburg sightseeing bus, you will be sent a voucher which is valid for up to a year. When you activate your ticket, you can climb on and off throughout the day or until 4:45pm, when the last bus departs.
Timetable and frequency
Depending on the season, the Hamburg sightseeing bus has a different schedule and frequency:
Between 1 May and 30 September, buses run from 9:25am until 4:45pm and depart every 30 minutes.
Between 1 October and 30 April, buses run from 9:25am and 4:45pm, but in this case, depart once an hour.
Important information
Please note that the Hamburg sightseeing bus tour is narrated by a German and English-speaking guide.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Visit Heidelberg with this free tour and fall in love with this charming German town. You'll visit its castle, its squares and its university, all for free! 
 Heidelberg Bridge Monkey 
 Charles Theodore Bridge 
 Heidelberg's University Square 
 University of Heidelberg 
 Heiliggeistkirche 
 Kornmarkt 
 Heidelberg 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Heidelberg Free Walking Tour
At 2:30 pm we'll meet next to the sculpture of the Heidelberg Bridge Monkey, the city's landmark. From there we'll set off on our free tour of this beautiful German town.
We'll begin the tour at the Charles Theodore Bridge and learn about its fascinating history. Built on the Neckar River, it has an enormous gate that once formed part of the city walls. Then we'll head through the old town of Heidelberg until we reach the Heiliggeistkirche, a beautiful Roman Basilica.
Next, our guided tour will continue to the University of Heidelberg. Did you know it's the oldest university in Germany? We'll admire this magnificent building as we listen to interesting anecdotes about the institution and its students over the years.
We'll also visit the Kornmarkt and admire the Madonna statue that stands in the middle. Lastly, we'll admire the Heidelberg Castle in the distance, a magnificent view to end our two-hour free tour.

 A panoramic view of Kiel 
 The City Sightseeing bus of Kiel 
 The equestrian statue of William I 
 
 
 
Routes and stops

Description:
This free walking tour is the best way to get to know Leipzig, one of the most important cities in the German state of Saxony. Immerse yourself in its incredible history, music and culture.
 The German Federal Administrative Court House 
 St. Thomas Church in Leipzig 
 Monument to Bach in St. Thomas Church 
 Leipzig's New Town Hall 
 
 
 
 
Leipzig Free Walking Tour Itinerary
Meet your guide in Augustusplatz, the largest square in Leipzig, ready to begin your guided walking tour of the historic German city. You won't have far to go before you reach your first stop: the world-renowned Oper Leipzig. It is the third oldest Opera House in Europe and is just one example of the great musical tradition entwined in the city, which has seen the likes of Bach and Wagner working here. Continuing along the music theme, you'll arrive at the Gewandhaus, an important concert hall which, along with the orchestra of the same name, is a symbol of the city.
You'll next reach the Leipzig University, the second oldest university in Germany, having opened its doors in 1409, before continuing on to see the New Town Hall and the Federal Administrative Court House, one of the country's five high courts which has the appearance of a royal palace more than a judicial building.
The St. Thomas Church, or Thomaskirche in German, will be the next stop on your tour. The 12th century Gothic church is not only popular with tourists for its historic architecture, but also as the place where Bach worked as a music director over 260 years ago. At the entrance to the church, a statue has been erected in honour of the legendary composer-musician, whose remains are buried here underneath a simple bronze plaque.
After learning more about the life of this great musical figure, you'll head back on your route to Auerbachs Keller, one of Europe's oldest taverns, worth a visit for its spectacular architecture!
Lose yourself in the streets of Leipzig yet again in the direction of Markt, the historic market place. Admire the Renaissance-style buildings surrounding it, including the Old Town Hall. Finally, you'll visit the statue of Goethe and the imposing St. Nicholas Church, one of the oldest in the city, before your free walking tour comes to an end.
Important information
It is not possible to participate in this free tour if you are a group of more than 6 people.
Children must be accompanied by an adult. There is a maximum of three children permitted per adult.
Covid-19 Measures

Tours or activities will not consist of more than 20 people per group.
A safe distance of one metre between clients will be maintained whenever possible.
Handing out of printed material such as maps or brochures will be avoided.
Showing your voucher on your phone will be enough, and it is not necessary to print anything.

Description:
Pass through Munich's many sights, and immerse yourself in German culture and history, discovering all the best points of the Bavarian capital. What's more: it's free!
 In front of the New Town Hall 
 Munich Cathedral 
 Walking through Marienplatz 
 The famous Hofbrauhaus Tavern 
 
 
 
 
Free Walking Tour of Munich
The tour begins in front of Mary's Column in Marienplatz, in the centre of Munich. Marienplatz is home to both the new and old town halls, two of the most beautiful buildings in the city. Here we will stop to see the famous Rathaus-Glockenspiel, and learn the history behind its wooden figures.
Passing through the main shopping streets which surround Marienplatz the tour arrives at Frauenkirche, the Munich Cathedral. Here we contemplate the majestic facade of the city's largest church, built on the site of an ancient Roman basilica, and pass over the recent history of the city. Who were the members of the Bavarian royal family? What is the relationship between the Nazi party and Munich? What happened during Kristallnacht?
Passing through the old market (Viktualienmarkt), the tour arrives at the National Theatre and State Opera (Bayerische Staatsoper) where the famous Bavaria State Orchestra plays. And to end the free Munich tour on a fitting note, we will dedicate the last section of the route to the importance of beer to the city, as well as uncovering the origins of the world's most famous beer festival: Oktoberfest.
To give you a sense of the beer-soaked essence of the city, we will guide the tour to Hofbräuhaus, Germany's most famous beer hall. It is in this strategic spot, that we will give advice on the ways to get the most of your time in the Bavarian capital.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Salzburg is one of the most beautiful places in Austria. With this excursion by train from Munich, you will see the birth city of Mozart in total comfort. A must-see!
 Salzburg Tour 
 The Bavarian Alps 
 Visiting Salzburg 
 Mozart's House 
 Mirabell Palace Gardens 
 Statue of Mozart 
 Salzburg 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Salzburg Day Trip
The tour meets in the Munich Hauptbahnhof station, where we will take a train to Salzburg: enjoying the beautiful Bavarian Alps which separate Germany and Austria over the course of two hours.
Having arrived in Salzburg, we will begin our tour along the banks of the River Salzach, to admire the city's old town. We'll see the Mirabell Palace, and visit its extensive gardens as we learn about the history of this Baroque building. Did you know that the archbishop of Salzburg built it to house his lover?
the tour continues through the old town, where we will get to know some of the main buildings in the city, such as Mozart's house, the city market, the old market and the Salzburg cathedral. During the tour we'll learn about the history of the city and its relation with music: legends such as Mozart, Haydn, Karajan or even the Von Trapp family were born or lived in the city.
After you will have free time to enjoy Salzburg at your own pace, you can eat in one of the restaurants of cafes in the centre, pass through the narrow medieval streets or discover the shops in the city. Then in the evening, we will return again by train, back to the Munich central station, where the tour ends.
VIP Salzburg Excursion
If you would like to take the day trip to Salzburg with a reduced group, you can reserve our reduced Salzburg tour by bus.

Description:
Discover the Bavarian capital's history from the late medieval period to its infamous political past, on this Munich walking tour. You'll explore important locations around the diverse city.
 Marienplatz 
 Hofbräuhaus Beer Hall 
 Odeonsplatz 
 
 
 
Munich Walking Tour
The guide will meet you at 10:15 am at Munich Central Station to start the tour. From here you'll go to notable points of interests around Munich, and discover the secrets surrounding the German Empire, the Weimar Republic and the Third Reich.
The tour around Germany's third largest city will include a step into the past, admiring the famous Rathaus-Glockenspiel in Marienplatz in the heart of Munich. It chimes 2-3 times a day while reenacting stories from the 16th century. We'll get a taste for Bavarian traditions by stopping at the long-standing Munich market, Viktualienmarkt, dating back to 1807 when it was moved after becoming too big for the central Marienplatz. 
Following on, we'll head to the Italian inspired Odeonsplatz central square, where you'll be able to admire the beautiful scenery of the Nationaltheater Opera House ​and the Residenz. Here we'll learn about the monarchy in Munich by visiting the former palace belonging to the Wittelsbach monarchs of Bavaria.  
We'll also stroll along the mile long Maximilianstrasse, one of four royal boulevards in the city. The exclusive shopping avenue was designed to create a new architectural style which combines history with modernity.
Another important stop on the tour will be the world famous Hofbräuhaus, commissioned in the 16th century because beer in Bavaria had become too expensive. In fact, in the 17th century sales from the brewery contributed up to 50% of Bavaria's income, and it was even an important meeting place which bore witness to historical events such as Hitler's presentation of his 25 point programme. 
This walking tour of Munich will last 2 hours.
Important information
It is recommended to wear suitable clothing and comfortable footwear.

Description:
Discover the nature, culture and history of Munich on this bike tour - the most fun way to get to know the city!
 Enjoying the bike tour of Munich 
 Konigsplatz 
 Odeonsplatz 
 Explore Munich by bike 
 Cycling through the English Garden 
 Diana Temple in the Munich Hofgarten 
 Hofgarten 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Munich Bike Tour
After meeting at Munich's Central Train Station, the Hauptbahnhof, at the scheduled time, we'll hop onto our bikes and set off on our cycling tour around the German city.
Did you know that Munich has over 1200 kilometres (745 miles) of cycle paths? There's no better way to explore one of the busiest cities for bikes than by pedalling your bicycle to emblematic landmarks like Königsplatz, Odeonsplatz and the Hofgarten.
During our bike tour of Munich, we'll take a short break to keep up our energy before continuing onwards to more of the city's must-see monuments. We'll visit the English Garden, or Englischer Garten, where we'll see one of the park's main attractions: Eisbach Canal and its artificially created wave frequented by surfers!
The tour will come to an end back at Munich Hauptbahnhof.

Description:
We currently don’t have any scheduled dates for this activity.
Check out all the activities in Munich 
Discover one of the prettiest lakes in Germany: Lake Königssee. Not only will you see this Bavarian treasure, but you'll also visit the Berchtesgaden Salt mine; one of the oldest in the region.
 Lake Königssee 
 Panoramic view of Lake Königssee 
 Berchtesgaden Salt Mine 
 
 
 
Lake Königssee and the Berchtesgaden Salt Mine
We'll meet at the meeting point in Munich and then head south-east, almost until the Austrian border, where Lake Königssee can be found. En route, you'll be able to take in the beautiful Bavarian scenery. 
As soon as we get to Lake Königssee, we'll board a boat (ticket not included) and enjoy a 35-minute sail around some of Germany's most breathtaking natural landscapes. Nestled in the heart of the Bavarian Alps, Lake Königssee has crystal clear waters that are looked upon by St. Bartholomew's Church. To make this trip even more special, there will even be live music on board: a once in a lifetime experience!
We'll then return to solid ground, specifically at St. Bartholomew. This peninsula, with a namesake church, is located in the Berchtesgaden National Park, as is the lake. We'll explore the area for a little over an hour, and you'll have enough time to take some great photos of the surroundings. 
We'll return to our vehicle to take us to the second part of the activity: the Berchtesgaden Salt Mine. With over 500 years of history, these mines were a key element of the country's economic development.
With head into the salt mine (entry not included) and explore this Bavarian treasure before arriving back in Munich at 6:00 pm.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Located in the region of Franconia, Nuremberg is a city with hundreds of stories to tell. Join us on this free walking tour around the historical centre, exploring medieval buildings, squares, fountains, art and a castle.
 Church of Our Lady 
 Hopsital of the Holy Spirit 
 Nuremberg Castle 
 
 
 
Free Walking Tour of Nuremberg
We'll meet in the centre of Nuremberg to start our tour along the banks of the River Pegnitz. You'll only need to look up to discover Hauptmarkt, the city's main market. Did you know that this has been the commercial heart of the city since the Middle Ages? We'll wander through this area full of colours, aromas and flavours, and of course, we won't leave until we've heard the famous chiming of the bells at the Church of Our Lady. Don't forget to make a wish at the Schöner Brunnen fountain!
We'll continue our walking tour through the San Lorenzo neighbourhood, feeling like we've stepped back in time as we discover its fountains, bridges and bourgeois residences. We'll also stop outside the medieval St. Lorenz church which hides a long history...
From there we'll walk to the Hospital of the Holy Spirit, a building on the banks of the river. Here, our expert tour guide will tell us all about Till Eulenspiegel, a popular character among locals.
Our tour won't just be about medieval times, but we'll also discover the city's more recent history, such as the history of the Jewish community at the Hans-Sachs-Platz Synagogue and we'll head into the St Sebaldus neighbourhood to discover its eye-catching church and the new town hall. We'll soon be near the Castle, one of the city's central hubs.
We'll step back in time again and finally reach Albrecht Dürer's House: a  master Renaissance painter, engraver and print maker who changed the concept of art at the end of the Middle Ages. Today his house has become a museum dedicated to his life and works.
Important Information
At the end of the tour, you'll be able to tip our expert guide based on how much you think it was worth.
This walking tour is not available for groups of more than 6 people. If you're a group of more than 6 people you should book the Private Tour of Nuremberg.

Description:
Considered by the Nazis as the "most German of German cities", Nuremberg became an important city during the Third Reich. Discover the places marked by this dark period of history on this guided walking tour.
 Nuremberg Opera House 
 Historic Hauptmarkt, the main market square 
 Ruins of the Medieval Katharinenkirche 
 
 
 
Nuremberg Third Reich Walking Tour Itinerary
Having met your guide in the historic centre of Nuremberg, you'll begin your walking tour around what the Nazis considered to be the "most German of German cities", leading them to hold their annual rallies here. Take in the Medieval buildings lining Hauptmarkt, the main market square: did you know this was the Jewish Quarter before the Second World War began?
Learn all about the persecution of Jews in Nuremberg as you stroll through the city streets towards the monument erected in memory of the former Synagogue. Your guide will also tell you about Kristallnacht, or the Night of Broken Glass, as you explore the old town.
You'll discover the importance of Nuremberg for Hitler and the Nazi Party as you continue on your route, as well as hearing about some of the most notorious figures related to the city, like Julius Streicher. Reaching the ruins of the Katharinenkirche, an important Medieval church which was destroyed during World War II, your tour will take a happier turn, as you learn about the resistance and liberation of the city. Many women played a key role in the reconstruction of the city following the war, earning them the nickname Trümmerfrauen, or "rubble women"!
Visiting St Lorenz, a 13th century Gothic church, you'll learn about the concentration camps and the prisoners interned there, before making your way to one of Hitler's favourite buildings in Nuremberg: the Opera House or Staatstheater Nürnberg. 
The final stop on your tour will be the Way of Human Rights, or the Strasse der Menschenrechte in German, where your guide will explain the postwar Nuremberg Trials and how they marked a turning point in international law.

Description:
Travel back in time on this walking tour through Medieval Nuremberg. Discover the myths and legends surrounding the city as you explore its historic streets and monuments.
 Typical Medieval houses in Nuremberg 
 Nuremberg's Medieval old town 
 Nuremberg city walls 
 
 
 
Medieval Nuremberg Walking Tour Itinerary
After meeting in the emblematic Hauptmarkt, or main market square, you'll begin your walking tour around historic Nuremberg. Having admired the centuries-old buildings and the dramatic 14th century Gothic Cathedral around the square, you'll delve into the streets of the old town, heading towards the west of the city to uncover the secrets hiding around each corner.
Between cobbled streets and stone buildings, you'll discover the city's most feared trade: witchcraft. Return to the 17th century to relive the legendary witch trials, the historic solution to protecting the city from the devil! Ever heard of Dorothea Flock?
During your walking tour, your English-speaking guide will reveal the myths and legends of love, death and madness that shroud some of the city's most famous fountains. And you won't leave Nuremberg without hearing the story of the Flying Horseman! 
Learn about the different trades of Nuremberg's locals during the Middle Ages, and discover the cruel tasks carried out by the city's executioners and torturers. What's more, you'll hear about Gregor Mendel, a scientist considered to be the founder of modern genetics. Do you know how he's related to Nuremberg?
Finally, continuing to the old city walls, you'll reach Weissgerbergasse, the oldest street in the city, where your guide will tell you about Kaspar Hauser. Nicknamed the "orphan of Europe", no one knows how this dishevelled-looking child arrived in Nuremberg... many believe he was of royal descent!

Tour the German city of Potsdam in comfort and at your own leisure with this hop-on hop-off bus. Enjoy spectacular views of all the monuments from the panoramic roof!​

 Orangery Palace 
 Cecilienhof 
 Brandenburg Gate 
 
 
 
 
Routes and stops
This Potsdam sightseeing bus follows a 105-minute route with stops at 12 tourist spots around the city. During the route you will enjoy pre-recorded commentary in English on the locations you can see, such as the Sanssouci Obelisk and the Marmorpalais (Marble Palace).
The bus also makes stops at the Filmmuseum, Cecilienhof, Orangery Palace, and Alexandrowka, the Russian neighbourhood of Potsdam.
You can consult the different routes and stops on the map by clicking on the following link:

How does it work?
For one day, you can climb on and off the bus as many times as you want. This makes it easy for you to discover places such as Luisenplatz, the spectacular Brandenburg Gate, the New Palace and Sanssouci – one of the iconic locations in Potsdam.
After you have made the booking, we will send you a voucher by email that you must present the first time you catch the bus.

The hop on hop off bus in Potsdam operates every day between 9:55 am and 3:54 pm and runs every half an hour.

Description:
On this free walking tour of Athens you'll live and breathe the five thousand year history of the Greek capital, the foundation of European culture itself, in search of the traces of Plato, Archimedes, Athena and Zeus. Even better, it's free!
 Enjoying Athens on the tour 
 A bust of Hadrian 
 Statue to Athena 
 One of the sights on the tour 
 
 
 
 
Free Walking Tour of Athens
Depart with a small team of local experts, as they take you by the hand and back through the years, in the city that birthed the modern world.
Democracy, modern mathematics, and the foundation of Western philosophy are infused in the incredibly well preserved ancient monuments you'll see on the tour. Throughout you'll see the footprints of great gods, as our guides bring to life Greek mythology: mixing together the real and the legend, the ancient and the modern, and the living and the dead, in a way only possible in a city so vibrant and so historic as Athens.
To show you the real face of the city, taking in some of the lesser known spots only possible with a local guide. Sights include the Ancient Agora, the Roman Agora, the Library of the Roman Emperor Hadrian, the Temple of Zeus, the Acropolis, Syntagma Square and the Hellenic Parliament.
But Athens is a city more living than dead, and with much more to offer than thousand-year ruins! As a complete and we will see the changing of the guard, the National Garden, the Zappeion, the modern  Kallimármaro Olympic Stadium, and the Metropolitan Cathedral.
And to make sure you get the most out of your stay in the Greek capital, our very own modern-day Athenians will explain all you need to know about public transport, costs, discounts, and schedules for each site.
The tour ends around Athens' flea market.
Important Information
The tour does not enter any archaeological sites, as these usually involve an extra ticket and are under the purview of official tour guides employed by these sites and museums. Nonetheless, we will see them from afar and speak about their significance.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.
