Explore the capital of Greece with style on a hop-on hop-off sightseeing bus. Learn about the history and culture of Athens on this double decker open-top bus as you admire its striking landmarks.
 Hop-On Hop-Off Sightseeing bus 
 Exploring Athens on a sightseeing bus 
 Temple of Olympian Zeus 
 Parthenon 
 Monastiraki 
 The Parthenon of Athens 
 National Library of Greece in Athens 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Routes and stops
Choose any of the 5 different routes and enjoy interesting pre-recorded commentary in English as you drive past the city’s stunning monuments and neighborhoods. The most important stops are Syntagma Square, Acropolis, Parthenon, Temple of Olympian Zeus, Panathenaic Stadium, National Archaeological Museum of Athens, Omonia Square, Marina of Mikrolimano and the Cruise Port.
Find more information on each route here below:
Orange line: Take this line to discover the Acropolis and the Parthenon and the city’s main attractions. Moreover, the bus also stops at Hadrian’s Gate, Thissio neighborhood and the National Library.
Blue line – Piraeus: The blue line connects the Cruise Port with the city center. Some of its most interesting stops are: Pasalimani, Turcolimani, as well as the new Acropolis Museum.
Yellow line: Explore both the historic center and the new city on this route, including Flisvos Marina, Aghios Kosmas beaches or the alternative neighborhoods of Athens.
Green line: Take this line if you wish to visit Vouliagmeni, an area full of pretty beaches. 
Happiness Train – Piraeus: If you want to discover the port, this is the best line. It will drive past the Municipal Theatre or the Naval Museum.
Check out the various routes and stops by clicking on the following link:
Athens Sightseeing bus routes and stops
How it works
Your ticket is valid for 48 consecutive hours from the first time you use it, meaning that if you get on a sightseeing bus for the first time on a Monday at 3pm, your ticket will be valid until Wednesday at 3pm.
During these 48 hours, you can hop on and off as many times as you wish at any of its stops to visit the city’s top sights, including Syntagma Square, the Acropolis or the Panathenaic Stadium.
After booking this activity, you will be sent an email with your voucher attached. Print the voucher and show it to an employee on the first bus you take.
Schedule and frequency
The Athens sightseeing bus runs every day of the year from 9am until 5:20pm and a bus runs every 30 minutes approximately.
You will find further information on the following link:
Athens Sightseeing bus schedule and frequency

Description:
Explore Athens on an electric bike! With this guided tour in English, you'll discover all the major sights in the city.
 Touring Athens on an electric bike 
 Sundial 
 Syntagma Square 
 The Changing of the Guard 
 
 
 
 
Athens Electric Bike Tour Itinerary
The tour meets at 10 am at number 11 Lempesi street, to begin this electric bike tour of Athens: one of the best ways to get to know the Greek capital
As well as being a healthy and eco-friendly way to get around the city, the many hills of Athens won't be a problem for us on our electric bikes. We'll see the 'modern' part of Athens, passing by the palace and the national gardens, the Temple to Zeus, the Panathenaic Stadium and the Old Town Hall - making up just some of the monuments we'll see on this part of the tour.
We'll pedal up to the Varvakios market, Athens' central marketplace, where you can get a feel for day to day life in the capital. And we'll continue along the Plaka neighbourhood, found in the heart of Athens. Known as the Neighbourhood of the Gods, it's one of the liveliest areas of the city.
Requirements
You must be at least 4'9" (1.45 metres) tall to participate in this activity, as the bicycles are adapted for this height and taller.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Perched on sandstone rock formations, the Meteora Monasteries are spectacular buildings that blend with the natural landscape. Visit them on an excursion by train from Athens.
 Monastery of Great Meteoron 
 Monastery of Roussanou 
 Monastery of St. Stephen 
 Monastery of Varlaam 
 Admiring spectacular Meteora 
 Views of the Monastery of Varlaam 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Meteora Day Trip
Begin your day trip from the Athens railway station at 8:20 am, (7:20 from the 20th of May onwards) when your train will depart at that time to Kalambaka, where you will arrive around 1:30 pm (11:30 am from the 20th of May).
Meet your English-speaking guide who will be waiting for you at the exit of the Kalambaka railway station. Hop on a comfortable bus and you will be driven to the stunning Meteora Monasteries. During the 20-minute trip, your chauffeur will reveal the history of these abbeys, a UNESCO World Heritage site.
Upon arrival at the peaks of these giant rocks, you’ll have four hours of free time to discover the monasteries at your own pace, drinking in the majesty of these religious sites perched high upon the rocks. The complex is made up of a total of six priories: Monastery of St. Nikolaos, Monastery of Holy Trinity, Monastery of St. Stephen, Monastery of Roussanou, Monastery of Varlaam and Monastery of Great Meteoron. All the cloisters are of medieval origin and are built on various sandstone mounds, which dominate the surrounding landscape.
Once the three hours are up, your driver will take you back to Kalambaka station, where you can enjoy a delicious lunch at any of the restaurants near the station. Your train departs at 5:30 pm and you will be back in Athens at around 9:30 pm.
Important information
A few days before the excursion, your local supplier will send you an email with your train tickets. You must print them and make your way to the railway station on the day of the activity.
Your train to Meteora departs at 8:20 am (7:20 am from the 20th of May) from Athens railway station. To make sure you don’t miss the train, we recommend getting there at least half an hour before departure time.
The admission ticket to each monastery is 3 euros per person. This cost is not included in the price of the tour.
All monasteries have a strict dress code: neither women nor men are not allowed to wear shorts or tank tops.
When making your reservation, please take into account that the Meteoro monastery closes every Tuesday. If your reservation is for this day, you will enjoy the monument from the outside.

All those running the service (guide, driver etc...) will wear a mask throughout its duration.

The temperature and wellness of all those taking part in the service will be monitored daily, excluding and maintaining in quarantine any who display fever or symptoms.

The capacity of all means of transport will be reduced to 65% of their maximum capacity.

Description:
Discover three beautiful Greek islands on a full-day cruise to Hydra, Poros and Aegina, and enjoy a peaceful day far from the hustle and bustle of Athens.
 Poros 
 Hydra 
 Aegina, Temple of Aphaia 
 Hydra Coast 
 Egina 
 Orthodox church in Hydra 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Hydra, Poros and Aegina Full-Day Cruise Itinerary
We'll pick you up from your hotel between 6 and 7:15 am and then we'll head to the port. From here, get on a boat and enjoy the views of the coastline as you sail to Poros. During the journey, your English-speaking escort will explain the main characteristics and history of the three islands.
Enjoy the breeze of the Mediterranean on a 2-hour boat ride until you get to the islet, which is the smallest of the three islands. Here, you will have time to explore the sights at your own pace: don't miss visiting Trinzia, the Russian shipyard, and walking along Lemonodassos, a lemon and orange tree grove.
Climb back on the boat and enjoy unparalleled views of the sea on the hour-long journey to Hydra, an old refuge for Saronic pirates. Upon arrival at Hydra’s port you will time to explore its picturesque narrow streets, marvel at its mansions and relax at one of its agreeable cafés. What's more, you'll have the opportunity to make the most of the beautiful beach, sunbathing and enjoying a dip in the sparkling azure sea.
Back on the boat and after lunch, you can relax on deck as we sail to the island of Aegina, a popular getaway destination for Athenians during the summer months. Once on the island, you will have the opportunity to visit the Temple of Aphaia on your own and walk around the city enjoying its tranquillity.
On the way back to Athens, enjoy a traditional Greek dance and music performance.
Once you reach Piraeus Port, you will take a bus back to Athens and arrive at the hotel at around 7pm.
Hotel pick-up
The tour includes hotel pick-up and drop-off from most hotels in the centre and port of Athens. Consult the full list of hotels in Athens for hotel pick up via the following links:
Hotels with a pick-up service in the centre of Athens
Hotels with a pick-up service at the port and coast of Athens
When making your booking, it is very important that you state the hotel you would like to be picked up from.
If you prefer, you can take this tour without hotel pick-up. In this case, you will have to make your own way to the port.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Are you traveling to Athens and don’t know what nearby islands to visit? On this full-day trip to Agistri, Moni and Aegina, swim in crystalline waters and enjoy stunning landscapes. 
 Agistri Island 
 Exploring Moni beach 
 Cruising around Greece 
 Greek lunch 
 Incredibly clear waters around Agistri 
 Enjoying a refreshing bath in Moni 
 Incredible views of the beautiful sea 
 Enjoying the sea 
 Lunch during the cruise 
 Jump into the sea 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Agistri, Moni and Aegina Cruise
Meet your English-speaking guide at the Zea Marina and climb aboard a boat at 8:45 am.
The first stop of this day tour is Agistri, a tiny island surrounded by emerald water and crowned with lovely scented pine trees. This is the ideal place to disconnect and forget about the hustle and bustle of Athens. The Ancient Greeks would sail to this island on their free day to swim and relax on its sandy beaches.
After exploring Agistri, hop back on the boat and enjoy the views of the endless sea as you head to Moni. On the way, you’ll enjoy a delicious Greek meal accompanied by a refreshing glass of wine. Upon arrival, jump into the Mediterranean Sea and snorkel or swim near the island. Moni is a protected reserve, only inhabited by deer, rabbits, peacocks and other numerous wildlife.
The day trip concludes at Aegina Island, famous for its charming white houses decorated with colorful flowers and for the temples of Apollo and Aphaia. After discovering the island, relax as you swim in the crystal blue waters before you head back to Athens.
The boat will drop you off at Zea Marina at approximately 6:45 pm.

Description:
Explore the Athens Acropilis in one of the funnest ways around: on an electric bike! The Parthenon, Anafiotika, Plaka and the Panathenaic Stadium will be some of the world famous places you visit.
 Views of the Acropolis 
 Exploring the Acropolis by bike 
 Athens Acropolis 
 
 
 
Itinerary
The tour meets in the centre of Athens, close to the Temple of Zeus, where we'll climb on board our electric bikes, on which we'll explore the Athens Acropolis. We'll climb up to the 'high town' known as one of the most emblematic places in all Greece. From here you'll get an unbeatable panoramic view of the Partenón, Propileos, Erecteion…all the temples which make this visit more than worthwhile.
We'll pass through the Anafiotika neigbourhood, an area of quaint white houses reminiscent of island life. And we'll continue through the Roman Forum and the Agora, which dominates the Kerameikos area.
We then take a break in Plaka, the beating heart of Athens. An area which has a huge quantity of traditional Greek restaurants where you can have a coffee while you let the hustle and bustle of local life pass you by.
Then we'll return to our bikes, to take on the last part of the tour, the Panathenaic Stadium, an imposing white marble construction, which held the first Olympic games.
Requirements
You must be at least 4'9" (1.45 metres) tall to participate in this activity, as the bicycles are adapted for this height and taller.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Discover the hidden treasures of Agistri, Moni, Poros, and Love Bay, when you take our fantastic yacht cruise around the islands of Greece's beautiful Saronic Gulf.
 Cruise along the Aegean Sea 
 Snorkel around Moni island 
 Poros 
 Lunch during the cruise 
 Jump into the sea 
 Enjoying the Aegean Sea 
 Beautiful views of the crystal clear sea 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Agistri, Moni, Poros, and Love Bay Cruise
At 9 am, we will meet up at the Zea Marina, in the port of Piraeus on the outskirts of Athens. There, a yacht will be waiting to takes us on a cruise around three beautiful islands in the Saronic Gulf - Agistri, Moni, and Poros.
We will sail along the idyllic Meditteranean waters to the first stop, the island of Agistri. There, you will enjoy two hours of your own free time to explore the area at your own pace and admire the contrasts between the lush green pine forest and crystal blue ocean. You also have the opportunity to take a guided tour by bicycle with the other cruise passengers (not included).
After visiting Agistri, we will head to the coast of Moni island where we drop anchor. There, you will have 45 minutes to dive into the sea from the deck of the yacht, do some snorkeling, and even swim to the island. You will discover that this heavenly islet is only inhabited by animals such as deer, goats, and rabbits.
Our next stop is Poros, where we moor the boat in the harbor and spend two hours on the island. Then we enjoy a delicious traditional lunch in one of the local restaurants. Feeling re-energized, we will explore the enchanting streets and gorgeous coastline of the area.
To put the icing on the cake to a brilliant day, we will head to Love Bay, one of the island's most picturesque corners. Besides admiring the spectacular coastal landscapes, this is your chance to take a final dip into the beautiful ocean.
At 5:30 pm, we will start the return journey to Athens. The tour ends back at the bay of Zeas at 7 pm.

Description:
Who wouldn't want to enjoy a day touring the Greek islands? With this excursion, you can relax while sailing along the coast and visiting the Blue Lagoon and Sivota.
 Boat used for the cruise 
 Agia Paraskevi 
 Turquoise waters of Sibota 
 Enjoying the cruise 
 Sibota town 
 Enjoying a swim in the water 
 Enjoying the beautiful beaches 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Blue Lagoon and Sivota Cruise
At 8:30 am we'll pick you up from your hotel and transfer you to the port of Corfu, where we'll board a boat to sail the waters of the Ionian Sea in search of its impressive landscapes. 
The first visit we'll make will be to the historical cave of Papanikolis. What will be the secrets that this marine cave holds? After unveiling them all, we'll go to one of the most exciting stops of the day: the Blue Lagoon. Do you know why it is called this? We'll discover it while we swim in it. 
Afterwards, we'll set off for the beach of Agia Paraskevi, a unique place where you'll be able to enjoy swimming, sunbathing or enjoying a delicious buffet lunch that will be served onboard the boat.
Later, we'll go into the charming fishing village of Síbota. There you'll have one and a half hours of free time to explore the area at your leisure. You can walk through its streets, stroll along its beaches or go snorkelling.
After an eight hour tour of the most special places in the area, you'll return to your hotel at 4:30 pm. 
Pick up
If you wish, at the time of booking you can contract the option of a pick-up and return transfer to your hotel in Corfu. 
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
The turquoise waters of Greece are within your reach with this tour of the Paxoí Archipelago and the Blue Caves by boat - one of the best ways to enjoy the Ionian Sea!
 Voutoumi beach in Antípaxos 
 The day trip boat 
 Panoramic view of Gaios 
 The blue caves 
 Gaios port 
 Enjoying the blue waters 
 Voutoumi beach 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Paxoi, Antipaxoi and Blue Caves Cruise
At 8:30 am. we'll meet at the port, where we'll board a boat to sail the Ionian Sea. 
The first stop of the excursion will be the Blue Caves, a place closely linked to Greek mythology. Do you know the legend of this magnificent place? Besides admiring the beautiful landscape, we'll discover the history of these underwater caves. 
We'll continue the tour towards the Paxoí archipelago to stop at one of its islands: Antípaxos. Here we'll visit one of the most beautiful beaches in the Mediterranean: Voutoumi, where we'll anchor the boat for an hour so that you can relax and take a refreshing splash in its turquoise waters.
We'll then set sail for Gaios, the capital of Paxoí. During two hours you'll be able to explore its picturesque streets, visit the port or eat on your own in one of the fantastic local restaurants - perfectly splendid!
At the time agreed with the guide, we'll meet again and set sail for Corfu. We'll finish the excursion arriving back at the starting point at 6.30 pm.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Hop-on and hop-off this sightseeing bus as much as you please and discover the most emblematic places in the beautiful city of Corfu.
 Sightseeing bus on a sunny day 
 Corfu City Sightseeing bus 
 Hop-on, hop-off bus in Corfu 
 
 
 
Corfu Sightseeing Bus
The Corfu sightseeing bus has two routes around the main places of interest in the city. Plus, with an audio-guide in English, you'll learn about the history and culture of this city. Not only that, but you can hop-on and hop-off as much as you wish, exploring the places that interest you at your own leisure. 
How Does It Work?
The ticket is valid for three months after the date of purchase.
The ticket is valid for 24 hours after being used for the first time. For example, if you use it for the first time on Wednesday at 4 pm, it will be valid until Thursday at 4 pm.
During this time, you can hop-on and hop-off the buses as often as you wish, making the most of your time to discover the wonders of Corfu.
Routes
You have the option to take the Kanoni Line, the Achilion Line or you can purchase a combination ticket to experience them both. You can find a map with the routes and stops for both lines here.
Kanoni Route
With this route, from the comfort of our double-decker open-top bus, you can enjoy spectacular views of the Adriatic Sea from the New Port of Corfu. You'll also get to see Spilia Square, where you'll find the new fortress of Corfu, and a short walk from here will take you into the old town, which has been declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 2007.
The complete route takes 60 minutes, and the times and frequencies are as follows:
March to May: the buses run every 20 minutes from 9 am to 5 pm.
June to September: the buses from every 15 minutes from 9 am to 6 pm.
September to October: the buses run every 15 to 20 minutes from 9 am to 5 pm. 
December to February: the buses run once an hour from 10 am to 1 pm.
 
Achillion Route
One of the stops on the bus route is at the majestic palace, Achillion. The complete route is 90 minutes, during which you'll be able to admire the wonderful sea views from the comfortable double-decker bus. The buses run between 9:30 am and 1:30 pm, although they only run from April to October.
Achillion + Kanoni Route
If you can't decide between the two routes, you can always get a combo ticket and enjoy them both.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Sail the waters of Corfu in a unique and fun way with this pirate boat trip. The youngsters of the family will be able to dress up while the older ones admire the beautiful landscape of the Greek island.
 Pirate boat 
 Views from the pirate boat 
 Details of the pirate boat 
 Pirate boat cruise 
 Pirate boat 
 Views of the sea 
 Sunset from the pirate boat 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Corfú Pirate Boat Cruise
We'll meet at 6 pm in Donzelot, near the port of Corfu. Once we're all ready, we'll go to the pirate ship that will take us to live an unforgettable afternoon sailing along the Greek coast. It doesn't matter if you're more of a Jack Sparrow or Captain Hook, the experience will be unforgettable.
Aboard the Black Rose Pirate Ship you'll enjoy a fantastical trip, as you sail through Greek waters while enjoying some of Corfu's most famous monuments such as the King's Palace, the island of Vidos, Faliraki, Garitsa Bay or the city's famous fortresses. 
What's more, kids will be able to enjoy dressing up as real pirates with the costumes offered by the crew, with patches on their eyes, swords and parrots on their shoulders. 
We'll finish the tour by returning to the starting point at approximately 7:15 pm.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Cruise the Albanian border and discover the remains of an ancient civilisation with this excursion to Butrinto. You'll also get to know the picturesque town of Saranda and try traditional food.
 Venetian castle 
 Ruins of a Bizantinian church 
 Ruins in the Butrinto national park 
 Coastline of Sarandra 
 Mosaics 
 Antique theatre in Butrinto 
 The boat 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Cruise to Albania
At 9:30 am we'll leave from the port of Corfu, we'll sail northeast to the port city of Saranda in Albania. There, we'll disembark and, after a brief coffee break, we'll board a bus to go Butrinto.
Once there, we'll spend the morning exploring the Butrinto National Park - do you know what it's famous for? You'll find the ruins of Hellenistic, Roman, Byzantine, and Venetian monuments there - an open-air history museum! But that's not all, the area is surrounded by forests, the sea and a large lake. 
After the visit, we'll return to Saranda to get some strength with a buffet lunch in a local restaurant. You'll be able to taste typical products such as feta cheese or tzatziki, accompanied by mussels, meatballs or jacket potatoes. 
With your batteries recharged, you'll be taken on a guided tour of this picturesque town - you'll love Saranda's relaxed atmosphere! Afterwards, we will return to the boat and start our way back to Corfu, where we'll arrive at 7 pm. 
Pick up
If you wish, you can book the option of hotel pick up and drop off. 
Necessary documentation
In order to enter Albania you'll have to bring a valid passport on the day of the tour. 
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Delve into the fascinating history of Crete: explore the most important landmarks and monuments in Heraklion on this guided walking tour. Discover the myths and legends of the ancient Minoan civilisation!
 Agios Minas Cathedral in Heraklion 
 The Venetian-era Morosini Fountain 
 
 
Walking Tour of Heraklion
After meeting your guide at 9:30 am by the old Venetian Harbour, your guided walking tour of the fascinating Cretan city of Heraklion will begin. Ready to discover the remains of one of Europe's oldest civilisations?
As you stroll through the picturesque streets of Heraklion, Crete's largest city, you'll bear witness to the footprints left by the many different cultures who have populated the island over the millennia: Armenians, Greeks and Arabs amongst others! Admire the Church of St Titos, the elegant Venetian Loggia and the impressive Agios Minas Orthodox Cathedral, one of the largest cathedrals in Greece.
Continue exploring the historic centre of Heraklion, passing by the Basilica of St Mark and the Morosini Fountain before reaching the Central Market. You'll be immersed in the lively pace of daily life in the city as you walk through the bazaar and peruse the different local products and traditional Cretan handicrafts.
For the cherry on the cake of your sightseeing tour, you'll be treated to tasting of sweet Greek delicacies made of honey and pastry.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Enjoy the stunning island of Paros, visiting Naousa or Piso Livadi, two small towns full of the classic charm of the Greek islands. Travel by boat to Paros from Naxos.
 Monastery of Agios Antonios in Paros 
 Streets of Paros 
 Stunning Paros beach 
 
 
 
Boat Trip to Paros from Naxos
Meet at Naxos Port at the scheduled time, where you'll board the boat taking you to Paros island.
During the boat trip, which lasts around half an hour, your guide will reveal interesting details about the beautiful island, the third biggest of the Cyclades islands, and one full of history.
Cruise across the crystalline turquoise waters of the Aegean Sea before arriving at Naousa or Piso Livadi, where you'll have a full day to explore it at your own pace.
Marvel at the island's glorious beaches, stroll down picturesque streets lined with whitewashed houses and alleyways filled with flowers, or enjoy delicious local Greek delicacies in one of the town restaurants.
The boat returns to Naxos around 7pm.
Important information
On Fridays, the boat travels to Piso Livadi.
On Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays, the boat travels to Naousa.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Relax in the unbelievably crystal-clear turquoise waters of Koufonisia's beaches on this excursion from Naxos. Enjoy the extraordinary natural scenery of this Greek island or visit Chora, the islet's only village.
 Koufonisia beach 
 Enjoying idyllic Koufinisia 
 
 
Itinerary
Meeting first thing in the morning to embark your boat at Naxos Port, you'll set sail, heading southeast to Koufonisia, a tiny island with heavenly beaches.
After a couple of hours of travelling, you'll arrive at Koufonisia, where you can spend a full day exploring the island at your own pace. Just next to the traditional Greek fishing port, you'll find a stunning beach where you can unwind, soak up the sun on the golden sand or bathe in the waters of the Aegean Sea.
You might want to visit Chora - endlessly charming, this small village is the island's only settlement. Allow yourself to be drawn in by the idyllic Greek islet's complete disconnection with the rest of the world, and fall in love with its traditional whitewashed houses and the gloriously colourful flowers that adorn them.
Having made the most of Koufonisia's paradise beaches and regained your energy tasting delicious local cuisine, catch your return boat back to Naxos at around 7:30pm.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Visit two of Greek's most famous islands: Delos and Mykonos. Explore the islands' captivating sights and discover some of the country's most important mythological, historical, and archaeological sites.
 Streets of Mykonos 
 Paradise Beach, Mykonos 
 Statues of Cleopatra and Dioscorides in Delos 
 Ancient ruins in Delos 
 
 
 
 
Boat Trip to Delos and Mykonos
After meeting at the indicated time at Naxos Port, board your boat and head to Delos. You'll sail for around an hour and a half before arriving at the sacred island that is home to one of Greece's most important archaeological sites.
Having docked in Delos, you'll have three hours of free time to explore the island at your leisure. You might choose to visit the iconic historical landmarks thanks to which this area is a dedicated UNESCO World Heritage Site. Explore the unforgettable ancient monuments here, including the House of the Dolphins, the Temple of Isis and the famous Terrace of Lions, a group of statues created and dedicated to Apollo shortly before 600 BCE.
Once you've had your fill of Delos, the boat will set sail for Mykonos. You'll reach this popular Greek tourist destination after a short journey of around 20 minutes.
Enjoy another three hours of free time to wander its cobbled whitewashed streets, relax in the island's 'Little Venice' or visit its iconic windmills, which date back to the 16th century. Or, if you fancy a beach break after exploring historical Delos, why not head to Paradise Beach to take a dip in its glorious turquoise waters?
You'll return to Naxos at around 7pm.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Get to know Portara and Naxos Castle with this walking tour. Besides exploring two emblems of the island, you'll enjoy an unforgettable sunset. You'll fall in love!
 Naxos castle 
 Exploring the castle 
 Inside Naxos castle 
 Portara 
 Enjoying the beautiful sunset 
 Views of Naxos by sunset 
 Sunset in Portara 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Naxos Castle and Portara Sunset Walking Tour
We'll meet in front of the Kiriakos Tziblakis shop at 5:45 pm and go head to Naxos Castle, one of the most popular attractions on the island.
We'll visit the remains of this Venetian castle, getting to know each and every one of its details, including the Glezos Tower, the only one with a round shape on the whole island. In addition, the location of the fortress comes with a spectacular view of Naxos.
As we continue our tour, the sun will begin to disappear over the horizon, so it'll be time to head to the next stop of the tour! We'll walk to Portara, a giant gateway with more than 2500 years of history and which has become the undisputed symbol of the island.
We'll learn about is history while enjoying a beautiful sunset accompanied by a Citro liquor. Could there be a happier ending? You'll definitely fall in love with Naxos!
We'll finish the tour arriving back at the starting point at 8:15 pm.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Discover the incomparable beauty of Santorini on this boat trip from Naxos. Enjoy incredible views of the caldera and stroll through the winding whitewashed streets of this beautiful Greek island.
 Views of stunning Santorini 
 The coastal town of Oia 
 Santorini's Red Beach 
 
 
 
Itinerary
After boarding your boat at the indicated time at Naxos Port, you'll set sail for one of Greece's most famous islands, Santorini. Throughout your journey across the crystal-clear blue waters of the Aegean Sea, your escort will entertain you with fascinating tales of the history and culture of the magical island.
Arriving in Athinios, Santorini's port, after around three hours of travelling, you'll then have the rest of the day free to explore the island at your own pace. See Santorini's most iconic sights: visit the Orthodox church of Saint Nicholas, explore the Red Beach, or wander the streets of Oia and Fira, in the north of the island.
Wherever you decide to visit, one thing is certain: you'll enjoy incredible views of the Aegean Sea, the volcano and the caldera, so don't forget your camera!
You can also pay a visit to the Venetsanos winery, where you can learn all about the history and traditions of the Venetsanos family's winemaking process, as well as tasting locally produced wines, accompanied by Greek delicacies, in one of its restaurants (not included).
You'll return by boat to Naxos at around 8pm.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Enjoy a day sailing along the Aegean Sea and discover the charming Greek islands with this Iraklia & Schinoussa Boat Trip from Naxos. You can enjoy snorkelling and enjoy swimming in the crystal clear waters.
 Iraklia 
 Enjoy swimming around the island 
 Irakleia port 
 Snorkel in the Aegean Sea waters 
 Schinoussa 
 Discover the island of Schinoussa 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Iraklia & Schinoussa Boat Trip
We'll meet at the Naxos port at 8:30 am and board a sailing yacht that will take us to enjoy a day cruising the waters of the Aegean Sea. Specifically, we'll head south until we reach the island of Iraklia.
When we approach this island in the Cyclades, the boat will stop so that you can enjoy a pleasant dip in the crystal clear waters. We'll also provide you with snorkelling equipment so that you can discover the fish that live in the Greek sea bed.
When you return to the yacht, you'll enjoy an aperitif and refreshing drinks. Let's keep sailing! We'll continue on to the island of Schinoussa. Here you can enjoy another swim, or just relax and admire the view while capturing beautiful pictures.
Finally, we'll visit Alyko beach, on the west coast of Naxos. Can there be a better ending to a boat trip around the Aegean Sea? Surely not!
The day will end by returning to Naxos port, arriving between 6 pm and 6:30 pm.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Paradise beaches, sparkling turquoise seas, delicious Greek food, a traditional caïque boat... explore the south coast of Mykonos exactly as it should be experienced. An unforgettable full day cruise!
 Traditional Greek caïque boat cruise 
 Dragonissi Island sea caves 
 Spectacular Frangias Beach 
 Kalafatis Bay 
 Mykonos' Paradise Beach 
 
 
 
 
 
Mykonos South Coast Cruise Itinerary
After meeting at the dock on Ornos beach, you'll climb aboard a traditional Greek boat known as a caïque or kaiki, ready to set sail to the spectacular beaches along the southern coast of Mykonos.
Cruising along the south of Mykonos, you'll reach the tiny isle of Dragonissi. This uninhabited islet stands out for its incredible turquoise waters and intriguing sea caves. Continuing on your route, you'll next head to Frangias Beach, where you'll have the opportunity to disembark and make the most of the beautiful seaside scenery.
In Frangias, you'll have free time to sunbathe, take a refreshing drip in the crystal-clear seas, or even snorkel amongst the marine life. While you're enjoying the beach life, the boat crew will prepare you a light picnic so you can taste different snacks accompanied by ouzo, one of the typical drinks of Greece.
The next stop on your cruise of southern Mykonos will be at the stunning beach on Kalafatis Bay. Having dropped anchor here, you'll be taken to a local restaurant with incomparable views over the coast, where you'll indulge in a delicious meal of a starter, main course and water or glass of wine.
Following your meal, you'll make your way to Paradise Beach, where you'll have time to shop, treat yourself to a cocktail in one of the many lively bars, or simply relax on the seafront promenade. From this famous Mykonos hotspot, you'll make the return journey to Ornos beach, where your tour will end around 6 pm.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Experience an unforgettable scene with this Delos & Rhenia Sunset Cruise. You'll sail around the Aegean Sea with the last rays of sunshine and take a dip in its crystal clear waters.
 Delos and Rhenia cruise 
 Sunset cruise 
 Enjoying the sunset views 
 The sun setting over Mykonos 
 Sunset over the Aegean Sea 
 Delos ruins 
 Fisherman at sunset 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Delos & Rhenia Sunset Cruise
We'll meet at 7:15 pm at the Olia Hotel and board a catamaran that will depart from the New Port of Mykonos. Are you ready to experience the most beautiful sunset of your lives? Let's set sail!
The cruise will leave Mykonos while contemplating the view of the Little Venice district. Next, we'll head north towards Delos, a beautiful island that is home to a famous archaeological site.
We'll stop in the vicinity to enjoy some unforgettable views of the island and to take the first dip of the afternoon. In addition, the first colours of the sunset will begin to appear on the horizon and you'll be able to take impressive photographs.
The tour will then continue to Rhenia, where you can jump back into the crystal clear waters of the Aegean Sea. After this refreshing swim, we'll enjoy the beautiful sunset as we head towards the coast of Mykonos - we told you it would be really spectacular!
After this magical experience, we'll end the cruise at sunset arriving at the starting point at approximately 9:15 pm.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Explore Mykonos in a fun and unique way: drive your own 4x4 Jeep around the beautiful Greek island on this guided sightseeing tour. Unmissable!
 Jeep tour around Mykonos 
 Ano Mera, a village in Mykonos 
 Agrari Beach 
 
 
 
Mykonos Jeep Safari Itinerary
After meeting at Mykonos town port, you'll begin your unforgettable adventure exploring the Greek island on a guided Jeep safari.
Following your guide, who will lead the convoy of 4x4 all-terrain vehicles, you'll drive your own Jeep towards the north of the island. The first stop on your thrill-inducing tour will be at Mykonos Lighthouse, where you'll take in the spectacular views over the coast from this vantage point.
Your Jeep safari will continue around the island of Mykonos to Panormos Beach, whose paradise coastal views will leave you speechless. Not far from the beach, you'll reach the picturesque village of Ano Mera. This enchanting inland settlement stands out for its traditional architecture, particularly for its Venetian monastery, Panagia Tourliani.
You'll have free time in Ano Mera to enjoy lunch (not included), before heading back on your route towards the south of Mykonos. Take a break on the stunning Agrari Beach, where you'll have the opportunity to cool off with a refreshing dip in the sparkling blue sea, before driving over to Panigirakis, Mykonos' castle. The panoramic views from this hilltop fortress are truly incomparable - don't forget your camera!
At the end of your tour, you'll head back to Mykonos town port.
Important information
To participate in this tour, you must present your valid driving license.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Delos and Rineia are home to incredible history, archaeology and nature. Let yourself be captivated by their charm on this full-day cruise from Mykonos. What are you waiting for?
 Delos island archaeological site 
 Terrace of the Lions, on Delos 
 The ancient theatre of Delos 
 Rineia island 
 Traditional Greek caïque boat 
 
 
 
 
 
Delos & Rineia Islands Cruise in a Traditional Boat
After being picked up from your hotel in Mykonos, you'll begin your adventure, heading to Agios Ioannis port, where you'll board a traditional Greek boat known as a caïque or kaiki. On board this historic vessel, you'll have access to unlimited non-alcoholic drinks from the open bar throughout your excursion.
The first stop on your Greek Cyclades island-hopping cruise will be Delos, where you'll have free time to visit the museum and archaeological site. This island has an incredible legacy from Classical Greece: its ancient 5000-seater theatre ruins and the Terrace of the Lions are two highlights of its archaeological heritage. Alternatively, you can choose to remain on the boat and take in the sun from its comfortable deck.
At around 2 pm, you'll cruise over to the nearby island of Rineia. Here, you'll have the opportunity to swim in the crystal-clear sea and snorkel amongst the marine life, or sunbathe on the paradise beaches. Enjoy a delicious buffet lunch on board, including grilled meat kebabs, salads and fresh fruit.
Having made the most of your boat cruise, you'll make the return journey to Mykonos. After disembarking at Agios Ionnais, you'll be taken back to your hotel.
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Sail around the beautiful islands of Delos and Rhenia on a brand new catamaran with this Mykonos Islands Cruise. Let yourself be enchanted by its charm as you depart from Mykonos, a must-do trip!
 Cruise around Delos and Rhenia 
 Inside the catamaran 
 Enjoy the cruise 
 On board the catamaran 
 The catamaran cruise 
 The island of Rhenia 
 Explore Delos 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Mykonos Islands Cruise
After picking you up at your hotel at the time of your choice, we'll travel to the New Port of Mykonos. Once there, we'll board a luxury catamaran that will take us on a cruise through the turquoise waters of the Aegean.
First, we'll head to the north of the island of Delos and arrive at the front of its famous archaeological site, where we'll stop to remember the moment. You'll feel as though you've travelled to the past! This site is home to a great heritage of Classical Greece, including its theatre and the Lion's Terrace. 
After a brief stop to admire the island of Apollo, we'll continue to our next stop, the nearby island of Rhenia. Upon arrival on this island, you'll have time to swim in its crystal clear waters, snorkel or sunbathe on the deck of the catamaran. We'll have lunch on board which includes shrimp pasta, Greek salad and Greek tzatziki.
Finally, we'll return to Mykonos and arrive back at the starting point five hours later. 
Covid-19 Measures
All of our providers comply with local legislation and applicable health recommendations regarding protective material and safety to help avoid the spread of Covid-19.

Description:
Legend says the Rhodes was a gift from Zeus to Helios. Find out more throughout the corners of the island on this comfortable tourist bus.
 Rhodes Tourist Bus 
 The Temple of Apollo 
 The Rhodes Ampitheatre 
 The ancient Rhodes Stadium 
 Views from on board 
 Palace of the Grand Master of the Knights of Rhodes 
 Views from the bus 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Rhodes Hop-On-Hop-Off Bus
With this Rhodes tourist bus, you'll discover the most characteristic corners of the greek island of nymphs and goddesses. And you'll have the option of getting off and back on again, as you wish, at any of the 12 stops.
Throughout the route, oyu can enjoy the medieval old town, one of the oldest in Europe, the stunning Monte Smith Acropolis, the doric collumns of the Temple of Apollo and the remains of a culture which has left its footprint on the whole world.
How does it work?
Once you use the ticket for the first time, you can use it for the following 24 hours, getting on and off the bus as you wish at any of its stops. You can check the route and all of the stops clicking on the link below.
 
Routes and stops on the Rhodes tourist bus.

Description:
The temples of Apollo, the Terrace of Lions, Orthodox Greek churches and 16th century windmills. Discover Delos and Mykonos on this unique excursion from Paros. An unmissable experience!
 The 'Little Venice' area of Mykonos 
 Mykonos windmills 
 Mosaics in Delos museum date back to the 2nd and 1st centuries 
 Delos ruins 
 
 
 
 
Itinerary
Meet at Naousa Port at the indicated time to climb aboard your boat before setting sail, firstly, to the island of Delos. Explore one of the most important mythological, historical, and archaeological sites in Greece. Historically a holy sanctuary, Delos was also the birthplace of Apollo and Artemis in Olympian Greek mythology.
You'll have three hours free time to explore Delos at your own pace. Delve deep into its myths and legends visiting the temples of Apollo and the Terrace of Lions, or stroll along the harbour and enjoy views over the Aegean Sea.
Hop back on board the boat to continue your day of island discovery. You'll head to Mykonos, one of the most famous Greek islands, where you'll have more free time to explore its pretty cobbled streets, see its iconic traditional windmills, or enjoy a relaxing swim at Paradise Beach.
Finally, you'll head back on your return boat to Paros at around 6:20pm.
